Reviews.Title: “Geoff and Ana from Adelaide”
Reviews.Author: Geoffrey A
Reviews.Content: We loved the location - so convenient to the train station and certainly well positioned for dining at Darling Harbour, shopping on George and Pitt Streets, and sightseeing at Circular Quay. Unfortunately I spent four of my eight day stay in hospital, and during this time the reception staff were of great assistance to my wife, who was virtually alone in a strange city. We found the room with its balcony and queen bed very clean comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a 4*”
Reviews.Author: Greenybne
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing hotel. It advertises itself as a 4* but only during the 90's! Could JUST pass for a 3* now. Very very basic rooms and in desperate need of a renovation, that being said you can't knock the location. I'd choose somewhere else near darling harbour if you can.......

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jenny308
Reviews.Content: We always choose this hotel when in Sydney. has been fully renovated in modern design. Great location - half way between the Rocks area and Circular Quay and the main shopping streets of Sydney itself. Easy walking but requires about half hour to Darling Harbour and our favourite food hangout, The Sydney Fish markets. We arrive at the airport, then catch the train to Wynyard, exit to York Street, and the Travelodge is right outside! Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “I'd rather sleep on the pavement outside”
Reviews.Author: Victoria J
Reviews.Content: The receptionist managed to check me in without once making eye contact, after making me wait over 10 minutes despite being the only person in reception. The (allegedly non-smoking) room she put me in STANK of smoke. I mean STANK like a New Orleans bar on a Sunday morning. I had to battle to be moved to another room. The bathroom was unclean (nothing worse than seeing someone else's hair plastered to the shower walls.) Room service food was good - but I was slapped with an extra $5 surcharge on check out (no mention of this in the menu) for the honour of having room service actually delivered to my room: "it's normally served in the restaurant". Ok then. I feel like I need a holiday to get over staying in this dark, dirty, unfriendly place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Keith C
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Travelodeg Wynyard on 2 different occassions, the latest stay was 3 days ending on Good Friday.As a base to explore the central district of Sydney it's great. The rooms are clean, very comfortable and reasonably priced. Wynyard train station is minutes away and allowed us to get to the horse races and had we packed a bit lighter could have taken us to the airport. The staff were extremely helpful and pleasant and never seemed put out by any request made by guests.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money when booking early”
Reviews.Author: myvoyager
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a value accomodation that is reasonably equipped and clean, the Travelodge is a good choice. If you need a gym, go somewhere else, it's tiny with 4 cardio machines but practically no weights. Book early 2-3 weeks in advance to get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Handy to everything”
Reviews.Author: sometimesoon
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel handy to everything in Sydney CBD. Walking distance to Darling Harbour. Free bus to Circular Quay, China town. Concierge very helpful. Comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheapish and Good”
Reviews.Author: Mooseman100
Reviews.Content: It's a travelodge... Room was very clean, bed was large and mostly comfortable, lots of tea and coffee available in the room for free, air conditioning worked, bathroom small but functional, location great, staff friendly and mostly under control of what was going on. Absolutely fine for the money, no issues at all.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Nijh
Reviews.Content: Sydney is expensive to get a room in - especially if you want to be in walking distance to the main sites. This hotel, as other reviewers have said, is a short walk to Circular Quay and Darling Harbour and a few strides to Wynyard Station, so the location is perfect. Add to that the fact that the price was almost half that of the other hotels in similar proximity and you really have a winning combination. But a well located cheap hotel doesn't always make for an enjoyable stay. However I'm pleased to report that the Travelodge Wynyard does not let you down on the other aspects either. The staff were all friendly and helpful, the rooms spacious and clean, a good sized bathroom with a fantastic shower, and, probably most importantly, a comfortable bed. Worth pointing out that my room was on a high floor (so high in fact that the lift didn't go all the way up there!) so I got none of the reported noise. We got 25% off the breakfast buffet bringing it down to $20. This is still quite expensive, but then you have to remember that you're in a hotel in major city and thatâ€™s the price you'd pay most places. In actual fact we enjoyed the breakfast - fruit, cereals, pancakes, juices, bacon etc. The coffee was quite good too. Sometimes it's worth paying an extra few $$ for the convenience of not having to go out for breakfast. Only one thing was a bit annoying. We booked on a Tuesday to take advantage of their Chooseday offers â€“ the 2 for 1 breakfast being our target. When we came to claim it we were told that we were not eligible as we had booked using their Advance Purchase 30 rate. I've checked again on the website and can see nowhere where this is stated to be excluded. For this reason I mark the hotel down a point - I don't like to feel cheated. Overall, and ignoring the one moan, finding this Travelodge made the few days we had in Sydney all the more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and cheerful in the heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Rachael H
Reviews.Content: This was one of the cheapest hotels in the area. It is a little shabby and dated but there is nothing wrong with it if you are just looking for somewhere clean to lay your head that's close to everything. Circular Quay is a 10 mins walk in one direction, and Darling Harbour is 10 mins walk in the other. It is a 30 second walk from Wynyard station, so if you fly into Sydney then get the underground train to the hotel, it's really easy and cheaper than a cab. Don't eat in the hotel restaurant, breakfast is $25! Walk past Wynyard train station and there are some lovely cafes nearby that are nicer and much cheaper. Don't use the hotel internet, the McDonalds around the corner has free internet. Ask for a higher floor as the noise from the street is really loud (there were roadworks and lorries that made deliveries at 6am that woke us up a lot) and the walls are pretty thin so you can hear your neighbours. We kept our curtains shut the whole time as the office block was a metre away and they could see in. We were hardly in the hotel so none of this bothered us, we just wanted a central base. But you plan to spend much time here then I'd spend a little more and go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Night In Town”
Reviews.Author: whitefoil
Reviews.Content: Booked online for a one night stay with teenage daughter. We each had a generous double bed which was extremely comfortable. After attending a function in the evening we had a late dinner in the hotel restaurant which was of high standard and well priced. Staff were very helpful, especially with the offer of assistance in flagging down a taxi in peak hour. Nearby access to Wynyard Station made this an ideal CBD hotel for our needs. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value right in the middle of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: ScubaDave16
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the middle of the heart of Sydney. You can walk to almost everywhere you need to and can catch a ferry or bus to anywhere else. After comparing prices this place is a good deal for the area. The rooms are a bit dated, but clean and the AC worked really well. Our room included a full breakfast which was really good. The staff was very helpful with arranging airport transfers and with providing directions to local attractions. Bad things: extremely expensive WIFI and only available in the lobby. One bed is normal and one is smaller so someone is getting a little bed.

Reviews.Title: “"A Great Place to Stay"”
Reviews.Author: winsy2012
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay with families, it can be a little noisy from traffic at night, if you are allocated in the lower floors but it is not a big deal, if you are exhausted from visiting all the main attractions during the day and all you want to do is sleep. The rooms are clean and the beds are comfy and are made everyday, if requested. The restaurant is kid's friendly and the meals are enjoyable, Room service is also available with speedy delivery. The hotel is very close from the train station, bus station and if you walk a couple of streets down to George street the 555 bus can take you to Circular Quay for free. On Sundays you can purchase the family fun day train ticket that allows you to take buses, trains and ferries for $2.50 all day. This hotel is close from many main attractions including the Taronga Zoo. My kids loved their stayed at Travelodge and we're very likely to stay here on our next visit to Sydney. Forgot to mention, on arrival check-in was pretty straight forward and at check-out time the luggage storage was very convenient for late flights. Well Done Travelodge!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: RayleighTasha_1985
Reviews.Content: Excellent location 10minute walk to darling harbour and 10 minute walk to circular quay. Hotel is very modern and rooms a good size and clean! Also had a safe in the room. Bathroom had a bath and shower combo. Bed very comfy and lots of tv channels. No wifi in the rooms, computers for guest use in lobby $2 for 15mins. Would definitely stay here again due to location and helpful staff. Only negatives were expensive Internet and $25 breakfast!! (macca's is just round the corner...)Â

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good value”
Reviews.Author: KMPAdelaide
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night only a few weeks ago. I didn't want to pay a fortune considering my arrival was 10pm and really only needed a bed, shower & breakfast and moving on the next morning. The train from airport is ideal as the Wynyard stop is right near the hotel so literally about 2 mins safe walk from the station. I booked through the hotels website and paid on arrival. However the desk clerk charged me the wrong amount, three dollars less and I told him. He immediately reversed the transaction and then charged me the correct amount. Unfortunately I had 2 transactions off my credit card which both came off immediately. I don't know why but the reversal did not show up straight away. It took 3 days which was really annoying as I had paid twice for the room. I called my bank and they said the transaction was pending. I should have said nothing and let him charge me the $3 less. A few hours after checking out and talking to my bank I went back to the hotel to discuss with them. The manager told me he'd look into it and call me. I never received a call from him. So if you stay here I suggest you take care with checking in transactions to prevent it happening to you. All of this aside the room was quite high up and the morning traffic noise was loud but not unbearable. I was wanting a fairly early morning anyway so wasn't bothered. There was a musty smell in the room from the air conditioning. It went away when a/c was turned off. Didn't matter to me for the short stay of only a few hours. The bathroom was small but modern & clean. The room was fairly modern, clean & well kept. Looked very much like what is on the hotels website. The wooden shutters were a bit stiff to work but we got there. I did hear the water running in shower & toilet in room next door. But it wasn't loud enough to be a disturbance. The breakfast in the morning was quite nice. The buffet not much different from other hotels but the coffee was great. For the $167 I paid which included breakfast I feel this is a place worth returning to. The location alone being in between the centre of city & circular quay with Darling harbour a 20 minute walk away, and close to train station makes it very handy. I've been to Sydney many times and mostly stayed the first night at the Menzies which is opposite the Travelodge. But the last few times I've stayed there its been very disappointing and at least $50 more per night than this hotel and not including breakfast. I would definitely stay here again. Especially if just passing through and you need 1 or 2 nights its ideal but if staying longer I prefer somewhere 4 or 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: Sandy H
Reviews.Content: It is centrally located - - not actually NEXT to anything interesting but NEAR everything: 1 block to subway station, walking distance in every direction to major tourist spots, a few blocks from practical places (e.g., banks, pharmacies, Apple store, shopping mall). The staff is very nice and helpful and their restaurant is pretty good. The prices shocked me until I realized that food everywhere in Australia is really expensive. My room was good-sized especially considering it is a city hotel. There is a Starbucks right next door - - excellent internet plus good coffee and sausage rolls for a quick meal from 7-7:00. The bed was not comfortable (fairly hard mattress on wooden platform) and there no comfortable chair with a good light for reading; both big negatives for me. I had no view from my large windows, which is a pity because the city of Sydney and its setting are beautiful. The elevators were a little slow and had a mind of their own but did, eventually, get me where I wanted to go. Internet set up is lousy - - have to go to the lobby for wifi (unless your computer have Ethernet port) and itâ€™s pricey. There are coin-operated terminals in lobby you can use to access internet as well. I used Starbuck next door - - much better alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in the City”
Reviews.Author: Paul_n_Cris
Reviews.Content: For a hotel on the edge of the city centre, this is great value, but book early as I went to rebook for another week to find it fully booked. Very close to Circular quay and so Bridge and Opera house. Lots of restaurants close by. Room clean and adequate. Breakfast was OK, but a bit mass produced. Wynyard station very close. Parking underneath $30/night.

Reviews.Title: “A great location”
Reviews.Author: Winnie999
Reviews.Content: The Wynyard Travelodge is in a good location and an average 3 star hotel. It is easy walking distance to many attractions and the shops. The room was what you would expect for a 3 star hotel, however the bathroom was tiny and cramped, the breakfast was good. It is a good place to stay for a night if you want somewhere reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Lodge Wynyard Sydney”
Reviews.Author: SusanMary27
Reviews.Content: As the exchange rate was so bad when we visited we found it difficult to get a reasonable hotel near to Circular Key. Wynyard travel Lodge was much cheaper than hotels close by. It was perfect for walking to the Opera House, Botanic Gardens, The Rocks, many museums and the town centre was in walking distance.It was very modern and clean, with good air conditioning and a fridge. The breakfast was quite expensive so we bought some milk, cereal ,jam and croissant to eat in our room. There were table and chairs so it was ok. We ate in the restaurant twice and the food was good. If you arrive early they have a locked room in which to keep your luggage and when leaving if you are staying in Sydney until the evening. The staff were helpful and friendly. If you are in Sydney on a Tuesday Jackon on George Street have steak, chips and salad with a glass of wine for 15 dollars which is very cheap. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: faing84
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my sister, when we arrived we were aware that we couldn't check it as it was in the morning, it was a pity that the female staff member on the desk that morning couldn't smile. The young man that looked after our luggage in the storage room was wonderful and also the staff in the restaurant were friendly and always greeted you with a smile. The hotel was easy to get to from the airport as we caught the train to Wynard station and it was less than a 5 minute walk. The location was fantastic - it was handy to both downtown and circular quay. Our room was good but the bathroom could do with a makeover it was very tired looking. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Careful with your credit card”
Reviews.Author: OttawaCanadaSteve
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night after a cruise. Well located, in business district close to both Darling and the Quay. Rooms clean, average size. Good service all round. Fronts on busy street, traffic noise came through on the 17th floor, with all windows closed, which may be an issue for light sleepers. As with most, (if not all) hotels you need to give them a credit card. Our room was prepaid, no additional services used. At checkout was advised no additional charges - yet credit card billed over $60. Now trying to obtain details. Not a huge issue - but a irritant requiring time/effort to resolve.

Reviews.Title: “Okay.”
Reviews.Author: beachcouple2000
Reviews.Content: Title says it all really. Just stayed one night for a city night out. Check in/out very quick and friendly. $136/night for city centre Sydney isn't bad (wotif mystery deal) and we were not disappointed really. Hotel is basic throughout and they admit to that, with ads in the lobby saying "why pay for what you don't use". Fair enough, but we got the park royal darling harbour for bit less once before and that hotel is far, far better. Rooms are clean. Some grout issues in bathroom but nothing to write home about. Toiletries minimal. Mini bar outrageously priced (there's a 7-11 just 100m away). Tip for this hotel: Beware the car park deal!! They offer a "special" $30/day rate at the Wilson car park across the road (254 George St I think). But...if you book in advance via the Wilson website its only $9/day at weekends! The receptionist was taken aback when I told him, so i think they've been caught out rather than deliberating trying to rip off customers. Overall, just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Well past its prime”
Reviews.Author: Ian_Pratt
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Travelodge Wynard for one night in March 2012 as part of a 'secret hotel' deal on one of the booking sites. Check in was chaotic and slow, with the small lobby overcrowded and harassed-looking staff unable to cope with the numbers of guests. When I was eventually served it was reasonably efficient, but the wait was far too long. My room on the 21st floor was clean and tidy, but generally quite cheaply furnished. There were a few modernisations to what is clearly a much older room. The bathroom was absolutely tiny - more of what you'd expect in Japan than Australia. The shower was in a tub with a high step, which may be an issue for older or less mobile guests. A couple of points rankled a bit; Firstly, the penny-pinching is obvious. There was one small cake of soap, a tiny shampoo and a tiny conditioner, all low quality. There was no free bottle of water. The TV was old and small, the newspapers in the lobby were not free. All minor things, but not what you are looking for in a hotel at this price bracket. Equally annoying was the obvious push to on-sell. At check in I was pushed to buy dinner and breakfast in the hotel, and this continued in the room. I've never seen a place that advertises its breakfast buffer with signage IN THE SHOWER before, but there you have it. Innovative or just plain intrusive? I'll let you be the judge. There were also maintenance issues. Until I turned the air conditioner all the way down to '5 degrees', it pumped out hot air, turning the room into a sauna. At 5 degrees, it was practically Antarctic. This really impacted sleep quality (I opted to shiver under the blankets rather than to sweat in the heat) and was simply not good enough. Bed quality and room furnishing were cheap, but in reasonable condition and comfortable enough. The 'king bed' is too singles pushed together. There is a tiny gym (a couple of exercise bikes) and a laundry up on the 21st floor. Overall, there is absolutely no compelling reason to stay at this hotel and I would suggest that you consider alternatives. I certainly won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location not so great service”
Reviews.Author: Tino T
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a few friends in. Double room. We had arrived a few hours early (2pm check in is far too late) so we asked the lady at the counter if we could store our bags. She asked for the booking names with no smile or welcoming gesture (I've had a more personal service from an Automative phone service) The gentleman who took our bags was friendly enough. As we arrived back during Check in time the same lady who had 'greeted' us earlier had asked for my name as if she had never seen me before. We received this kind of service throught our whole stay. The cleaners were nice but when we had asked the cleaner if she could come back (as we were in at 10am during such an early turnover time) she had said she couldn't come back as she had nearly finished. Due to lack of any service and the laundry room being way up in the attic I've given this place a Two out of Five

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & value”
Reviews.Author: KandTCanberra
Reviews.Content: First time we've stayed at this Travelodge . We wanted to be close to the Rocks to see Cunard's Queen Elizabeth arrive and to do the Bridge Climb. The location is fantastic! All staff were very helpful and courteous. We were lucky to be "upgraded" to level 20 and the room was clean, quiet, bright with totally adequate facilities (including a safe) and was certainly everything we needed (we loved the sliding timber window shutters - far better than curtains!). Parking was easy and secure and at $30/night was as expected for a CBD location. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great base”
Reviews.Author: WinsfordNick
Reviews.Content: The Travelodge Wynyard is a great base from which to explore Sydney. It's not the fanciest hotel in Sydney, but then it isn't the most expensive. I had one day in Sydney which is explore the area and the hotel provided me with a perfect location to start this from. The hotel is only a half block from the train station at Wynyard which is very handy for those going to and from the airport. I would stay again

Reviews.Title: “The second visit was better than the first but........”
Reviews.Author: TimberBlueMountains
Reviews.Content: We had a better experience this visit, but this hotel is still average. We had a better room, with a decent view and larger than our previous visit. The front office staff were friendly and helpful but the hotel just lacks something. It is very handy to the Quay, The Rocks and Darling Harbour, as well Wynyard Station, so if it's location you are looking for this is one of the better placed hotels. If you are looking for a hotel stay experience then this is not for you. There again was no exhaust ventilation in the bathroom, and I mean none at all, the aircon works on cold or unpleasantly warm and nothing in between and you are issued with one tiny piece of soap. No complimentry newspapers, $20 for a continental breakfast and a general appearance of a wear makes this a place to sleep and then move on.

Reviews.Title: “Central Sydney Location”
Reviews.Author: HarryOz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a business trip. The rooms are small and not suited to working in the room; there was no desk to set up my computer and work so I had to use the lobby lounge area, not ideal. Breakfast was very good. Location is just 5 minutes walk downhill to Circular Quay and Rocks area. Almost impossible to try to get a taxi outside; there is no stopping for any vehicles so you need to go up the hill or around to another street. However, it is not expensive and if you are out all day then it's good to stay here. Staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - walk to everything”
Reviews.Author: NikkiParty
Reviews.Content: The hotel was less than a block from Wynyard CityRail station, short walk to The Rocks/Circular Quay (hop on/off bus and opera house), and a short walk to Sydney Harbour. The hotel room was pleasant and had been updated and the staff was friendly. There was a laundry and exercise room on the top floor. There was also a restaurant on site but I thought the breakfast buffet was a little pricey so I didn't eat there. Also since I was spending over 2 weeks in Australia, I bought the vodaphone prepaid internet (hotel internet was expensive) and cell phone sim card (for unlocked phones). I only spent 1 week in Sydney and I spent the rest of my time in Cairns for the Christmas holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Senoc
Reviews.Content: Great location, helpful staff. Although I thought that a bigger spread could have been oeganised for breakfast. Should I come back to Sydney I'd definitely look at staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Super location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: Eisaacs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel after reading reviews, as I was looking for good value and a clean hotel close to Circular Quay. It's a clean hotel with all the basic needs being met. The rooms are on the small side, and the walls a little thin - but overall would stay here again on my next trip. The restaurant was great, and the staff was nice. It's York street location makes it almost unknown to the locals, most not knowing where it is - but it's a very central hotel - about a 15 min walk from the Opera house. Of note : Buy soap. This had the smallest bar of soap that I've seen, but a quick walk down the street to the store and $3 later - I was fine for the week.

Reviews.Title: “Great balcony!”
Reviews.Author: bodmor
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in the Travelodge on York St in a standard sized modern room with good bathroom facilities - standard 3-4star room nothing out of the ordinary! Our room on a low floor, surprisingly had a large balcony overlooking York St. We enjoyed the views of the buildings on York St from our room - nice architecture. I don't think many rooms have these balconies, but it may be worth requesting. We live in Sydney so it was nice to spend time in a part of the CBD we are unfamiliar with.

Reviews.Title: “Don't trust pictures...”
Reviews.Author: chri r
Reviews.Content: Usually all travelodges look all the same,nice lobby to impress but old fashion rooms.This Travelodge was not different from all others.Room style was close to that 60/70's style that surely does not make you feel at home.Price was not bad but I'll never go back again.The location was very good,close to all main spots so can be a good choice for just one night but not more than that.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Base”
Reviews.Author: Mickey_d31
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while in Sydney for the New Year celebrations. We had hoped to stay a little closer to Circular Quay, but the prices for those hotels were just silly. So we ended up at the Travelodge as it was still relatively close to the action, but not going to break the bank. The Hotel is on York Street, a ten minute walk to the Circular Quay Ferry Terminals and just a two minute walk from the train station and bus stop complex at Wynyard. It has a carpark attached, but, with such good public transport connections, you would be better off leaving the car at home. The room was basic, but comfortable, with quiet air conditioners and all of the home comforts you would expect. We had no view from our room, but that was of little matter really as we spent virtually no time in it other than sleeping anyway. The staff were friendly and helpful, despite being very busy due to the time of year. The restaurant served nice, good value meals in a pleasant environment. Overall, there was nothing to fault. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Simple but comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: CanberraLocal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Travelodge Wynyard for one night during a business trip. It was the second time that I had stayed here. The hotel is located in the middle of the CBD and is within walking distance to The Rocks and Circular Quay and is one street back from George Street. It is also very close to Wynyard Train Station. The hotel itself is simple but clean and comfortable. Upon checking in I was upgraded to a "studio suite". This room was larger than a standard room and included a small kitchenette with a second fridge, portable stereo, sink and microwave as well as a small dining table with two chairs, two seater and single seat couch and small coffee table. There was also a work desk, flat screen television and drawers for clothes storage. I was located on the 2nd floor and personally found the traffic noise on York Street quite noisy. The occasional siren, car horn or passing bus disturbed my sleep from time to time during the night. I found the bed too firm for my liking as well. I have stayed on the 25th floor previously in an "executive room" which was smaller than the studio room (and did not have the apartment style inclusions) but was a lot quieter. Overall, the hotel doesn't offer the quality inclusions that you might find in other more expensive hotels, but it was clean, well maintained, comfortable and the service was fine. If you are looking for a cheaper alternative in the CBD then this hotel is probably for you - I had no complaints regarding my stay. I think the Travelodge have purposely made this hotel this way in order to offer an alternative to other hotels in Sydney that can get very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “walking distance”
Reviews.Author: Ben W
Reviews.Content: many attractions are within walking distance of this hotel eg Darling Harbor Opera House Rocks area .many cafes restaurants pubs close by hotel is value for money as you have to remember your in the heart of one of the best city's in the world.our check in was reasonably quick they allowed us to check in at 11.30am which we appreciated.restaurant wait staff seemed a bit pushy as far as tips go faces turn up thats only a minor gripe on an enjoyable time in sydney

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for the location and price not the amenities”
Reviews.Author: ellipsis000
Reviews.Content: I travel to Sydney regularly for business and this isn't my usual hotel. I must say I was generally happy. It's probably more of a tourist hotel than business, but the room was comfortable and clean and the meal in the restaurant was good and the staff were friendly. The location near Wynyard railway station, the bus stops and being in the heart of the city would make it ideal for a visitor to Sydney who is planning to be out and about most of the time. For me the gym was tiny and the first day I got up for some early morning exercise it was full (4 people) so I went for a walk in the rain instead. The bathroom was also small, the sort you squeeze in the door and that's it you're within arms reach of the toilet, the basin and the bath (shower over the bath). There were minimal toiletries and no shower cap. Given the price I thought it was good value, I've stayed in some shockers in Sydney and this was not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly”
Reviews.Author: Kbubz
Reviews.Content: The website says parking a a available. But when we arrived it was full. My husband ended up driving around the hotel trying to find a carpark so i jumped out and checked in. The front desm didnt let me check in because it was under my husbands name. very inconvenient. We asked for a queen bed and got a double. It is very small and the whole hotel smells. The rooms were dusty not impresssed. I will not be returning

Reviews.Title: “Clean and close to Rocks”
Reviews.Author: michellejeanette
Reviews.Content: A 4 star hotel that is clean and has updated their rooms since last stay, the rooms are on the smaller size along with the bathrooms, we were moved on our second day due to others guests being noisy, no view only office buildings and felt had no privacy with both rooms, especially 6th floor with wooden slinging shutters, had to keep closed all the time. Front desk were friendly. The second room was a king but they did not provide a king doona only the doubles that are used for the king to be split..I could have telephoned for correct size but could not be bothered....it was very odd!

Reviews.Title: “Location great but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Keith G
Reviews.Content: I suppose you get what you pay for and this is definitely a budget hotel. The room was adequate and clean. We paid extra for breakfast which was quite expensive but there was plenty of choice. The thing that let it down was that there was no atmosphere in the evenings when we came back for a drink and the drink was expensive even by Sydney standards. On the plus side, the hotel is a 5 minute walk to circular key and there were plenty of bars nearby. If you want a cheap basic hotel and don't plan to spend too much time in the hotel is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but VERY average accommodation/quality/cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi04NZ
Reviews.Content: Positive: excellent central location right next to Wynyard train station and quite easy walking distance to The Rocks and Circular Quay. Negative: awful rooms where the proverbial cat could not be swung. Window shutters unsuitable for opening due to neighbouring office building being just metres away so it makes the room dark and claustrophobic. Cheap (stingy) soap and shampoo items provided. Chipped bathtub and basin. No wireless Internet in-room and highly priced cabled connectivity. Tiny, tiny bathroom where anyone over 5'7" cannot stand fully upright to shower or even attempt to shut the bathroom door in order to use the toilet in privacy. Would only stay here again if there was NO other hotel available - very disappointing for the cost ($282 NZ/night on a wotif prepaid special!!)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Monica M
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I enjoyed our stay. It wasn't fancy, but we were completely okay with that. Hotels are pricey in Sydney (as to be expected) but we preferred to find a good deal for a hotel that would be near the ferries and other attractions. This hotel is great if you are looking for a decent priced hotel that is in walking distance to the Sydney Opera House and ferries.

Reviews.Title: “You don't get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: ColinG1960
Reviews.Content: I feel a little embarrassed to write negative things about a Hotel. The reception staff were friendly, the Hotel was clean and the location good-access to trains etc. So why the low rating you ask. We stayed in an executive room and paid a healthy amount. We were greeted with 1 tiny piece of soap, and small amount of shampoo and conditioner.The room size was ok but for an executive suite the desk area should be comfortable and it wasn't-very small. $11 an hr for Internet. Everything costs heaps. Car park at $30 a night (don't take your car), and the bar - Spring water at $6.50 a bottle and it is the cheapest brand you can get at Woolworths (that's a Supermarket for OS readers, Safeway for Victorians). You can buy it for $1.70. Charges if you pay by credit card etc. Costs if you check out late, and the views. Nothing!!!!!!!!!!! I was staring at office buildings. Sorry! I don't plan to go back. If you want to pay a bit of money and be close to the centre of the city then go there. There is no place to really relax in the room, certainly not to do any work and i just felt it was overpriced for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable hotel in good position”
Reviews.Author: teddytnorwich
Reviews.Content: The Travelodge Wynyard is well situated being near Wynyard station and also being close to Circular Quay for further trains, ferries etc, including a fast service to the airport. We were on a 4 night stay at the end of our Australian tour, the hotel is also conveniently within walking distance of the Overseas Passenger Terminal where our subsequent cruise departed from. The hotel itself is reasonably modern and fits the standard Travelodge bill, not huge rooms but perfectly respectable for a city centre stay where you are likely to be out for most hours of the day. The breakfast we had included was good with a decent buffet selection and hot items. The staff were friendly and concierge helpful when we asked for his assistance. The Rocks area is also close by, Darling Harbour is also walkable, albeit a fair bit further away. Basic maps of Sydney don't show how hilly the city centre is so be prepared for some up and down walks.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, and accomodating”
Reviews.Author: ekile
Reviews.Content: When we were delayed mid-trip, and had to returnunexpectedly in Sydney, we ended up coming back to this hotel because we liked it so much. It's in a great location--easy walking to Circular Quay, Darling Harbour, shopping areas, public transit . . . Both rooms we had were clean and sufficient, though a bit small (and the views from the windows left much to be desired, although it was fun peeping at the workers in the office directly across the alley). The restaurant downstairs was a great option for breakfast, although there is a Starbucks next door if that's more to your taste. There's a tiny gym on the top floor, with not much more than a treadmill, but that was good enough for me. We were most happy, however, with the employees. We had had a very poor experience at a fancier (and pricier) hotel that the airline had put us in for a night, and coming back to the Travelodge was like coming home--the people at the reception desk remembered us and were most welcoming and accomodating. I would recommend staying here based solely on our experience with the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge Wynyard Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Roger-marston
Reviews.Content: Good location, close to all downtown and harbour points of interest. Rooms on higher floors are quieter. Bar a bit basic and not much seating. Reception helpful and porter / concierge excellent. Plenty of places to eat within walking distance as is the main shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “A little expensive but great location”
Reviews.Author: Cassandra W
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Travelodge Wynyard, Sydney was very good. The location was fantastic, which was what we were after. The rooms are a good size, and are very clean and well furnished. The walls are thin but we were lucky that our neighbors weren't the rowdy type! It was abit expensive but considering it is is such a central location it isn't that surprising. All in all, I was happy staying at the Travelodge and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not such a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CSkuza
Reviews.Content: The front desk service and the location are great. The building itself is old and not as well mantained. While the room was clean, the air conditioning in our room did not work, it was early spring but it was very hot in the rooms, Sydney was about 75 at that time. The bathroom had a bit of mold but not as bad as our other friends, their bathroom was very bad covered with mold. The food in their restaurant was very expensive, but since they are in such great location, you are able to find good places to eat that are less pricey. They have coin operated computers with internet access in the front lobby and wireless connection for a small fee in the bedrooms. While the hotel is non smoking, the smokers gathered by the front door and it really reeks like smoke as soon as the door is open.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the location.”
Reviews.Author: freedombird
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for work in October. I found my room to be clean and comfortable. I enjoyed being able to open my window at night to get some air. It was a bit noisy but I didn't mind listening to the sounds of the city. Breakfast was very good with hot food at the buffet and constantly refilled. I think it was the busiest hotel I have stayed at, probably because the price is right for Sydney. The only minus was the lifts. The hotel was full one of the nights I was there and the lifts were busy. I was on the 16th floor and waited 1/2 an hour. Another guest chose the stairs it was so long! The next day not so busy and no waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff, but extremely busy”
Reviews.Author: slowrunnerHampshire
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Sydney with my mother, and we stayed at the Travelodge Wynyard for 3 nights in early November. The hotel is in a great location, its easy to get to from the train station, and its a good price for the area. Our room was very clean, and had tea and coffee making facilities. I had paid for breakfast in advance, and thought the breakfast was very good. I also found the reception staff to be extremely helpful and pleasant. The only downside I found was that the hotel was extremely busy when I stayed. I think they may have had a couple of coach trips at that time. There was always a queue at reception, a queue at the lift, and breakfast was absolutely packed. The staff looked absolutely run ragged, and worked so hard. They were always extremely helpful, though. The hotel is within an easy walk of both Darling Harbour and Circular Quays. So I would recommend this hotel, but it was particularly peaceful when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Lacey_U
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for six nights in Sydney back in September 2011. The very best thing about this place is its location. You can walk or hop a train at Wynyard station to go anywhere you need to be. Many tourist attractions are very convenient, no train required. The room was clean, nicely remodeled, and refreshed daily at our leisure. A few days we were in the room when the cleaning staff came by, but they were happy to return when we stepped out. The room overall was fairly cramped with minimal space to walk and the bed was perhaps a full or a double, not even a queen. A bit tight for two, to be honest, but I suppose thatâ€™s all in what youâ€™re accustomed to. The bathroom was large but had no vanity except for a tiny 3â€�x10â€� glass tray mounted to the wall. Obviously not meant to cater to anyone who has anything they need to use at the bathroom sink besides a toothbrush. Like a cosmetics bag, perhaps? All of that I could live with, particularly for the stellar price when considering where youâ€™re located, but two things drove me batty about this place. First is the Internet service. It was $11 for the first Â½ hour or $22 for a full day. Thatâ€™s just highway robbery. Do yourself a favor, go across the street to Starbucks and pay for their internet for a far more reasonable rate ($6/day). The other thing was the NOISE. If you think youâ€™ll be able to sleep in at this hotel, think again. I donâ€™t know if the windows are made of paper, but from the 7th floor I could hear all sorts of traffic noise, people talking on the sidewalks, even the audible crosswalk alert â€“ from my closed windows seven floors up and around the corner (we were NOT street facing). The sound through the closed door wasnâ€™t much better. I could hear every word of conversations going on in the hallway. The bottom line: You get what you pay for. If you want to see Sydney on a budget and can put up with a few inconveniences to do so, this might be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “no free Internet , poor service and small room for three persons”
Reviews.Author: ric78
Reviews.Content: the bed for the third person in a triple room is terrible with a sofa convertible. the room is not any larger and is terribly small - the service staff were not helpful when being approached and sounded proud when being questioned for directions and Internet options

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, basic but clean, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: gabgeneva
Reviews.Content: Decided to add two days to a busy three week trip and chose this hotel for the price and location and really didn't expect much. The hotel is just 100 m from the Wynyard line which connects you fast and easily to anything, including directly to the airport...so no need to take a taxi. The Opera harbour and George Street, the main shopping artery and the one street that easily connects both harbour areas is on the parrallel street. A shopping mall is under the plaza on the right of the hotel. The room was ready at 2 pm and so I left my luggage with them... they have a locked room with apparently good security. The people at the reception were friendly and competent. The person I had even knew how to tether my iphone so that I could use it with the plug-in Internet on my computer. The room was clean and well equiped. Supplies in the refrigerator were reasonably priced and just marginally higher than at the convenience store around the corner. The Internet cable is behind the TV and the first evening, neither me, nor the person on duty could find it. I didn't expect luxury and didn't get it...but that was fine. The bed was very comfortable but might have been a bit small for two.

Reviews.Title: “Baisic but clean and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: jwfhunts
Reviews.Content: A spotlessly clean property and helpful staff, though I found the bed to be somewhat on the small side though very comfortable. With the smoking restrictions in operation in Australia, lots of smokers and smoke outside the entrance to the hotel. For value for money compared to hotel prices in Sydney in general, I was satisfied. A restaurant serves breakfast only in the mornings. There seemed to be lots of backpackers and overnight guests staying. Would be happy enough to stay here again if in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if desparate”
Reviews.Author: wackijac
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work as it was the only hotel close to the training I was attended to that was inside my TA rate. When I checked in the staff were rude. The hallways are dingy and smell. In the morning the cleaning cart comes out early and takes up most of the corridor. The bathroom was tiny but even worse it wasn't clean. I have stayed in some very basic places, but this was awful. I didn't feel comfortable at all in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great economical hotel close to city”
Reviews.Author: TravelQueenAkl
Reviews.Content: Great value for money hotel near Sydney city. Small rooms but who needs a ballroom when you only need to sleep there. Mine had a fridge and microwave. Lovely friendly staff who were very helpful and nice and smiling (boy am I sick of surly service elsewhere!). I would stay here again for the price, convenience and value.

Reviews.Title: “Worn hotel, great location, great friendly helpful staff though. Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: PingSwe
Reviews.Content: Great location 2min to the subway station, around 8min to sydney opera house, ferry terminal, 8min to city center, 10-15min to chinatown. Great helpful and friendly staff. The hotel condition is worn though, loose furniture on some places, heater broken, AC thermostat broken, so it was throwing out cold air all the time. Worst part was the cumstain on sheets, eeewww (I did not touch it). Now I know why some people complained about the noise. There was 1 or 2 night I heard noise from the street, from construction of some kind. Really late, somewhere around around 23-02 o clock. Great location and friendly staff. And great japanese restaurant next to the hotel. But really not worth the money for that standard. For that standard I rather go to a hostel. Next time I will try a hostel or another hotel/appartment.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and family friendly”
Reviews.Author: rprinsep
Reviews.Content: Travelling with young teenagers we needed two rooms on the same floor and the hotel was happily able to assist with this. The rooms were very comfortable and serviced regularly. We enjoyed being within walking distance of the city centre and highlight areas like the Harbour Bridge, Opera House, The Rocks, Pitt Street Mall and Darling Harbour. Taxis stopped outside and the underground train station was only a few hundred metres away. The options for eating nearby are plentiful and a Coles Supermarket only a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Good front desk service but old/dirty facilities”
Reviews.Author: Tracy and John R
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the good: good customer service from front desk and duty manager; good location as you can walk to Circular Quay, Darling Harbor, and the Rock pretty easily. The bad: the room and the furniture/fixtures are old, dirty, and sticky (remote control for the tv, bedside lamp, light switches, etc). The first room they assigned to us was really smelly. Smells like mildew/wet carpet and old milk. After complaining and having their "engineer" to come up to our room, they said that we had to stay there for the first night since they are sold out. The next morning we called them again and was promised that they can move us. The second room was smell free so it was good but similar to the first room, everything is old and dirty. Housekeeping was horrible as well. They never gave us a hand towel. We have to call every day to complain about it with no improvements. We stay there for 6 nights and it happens every day. They also didn't refill toilet paper and tissue paper. We paid around $135 (Australian dollars) on average per night but so it was not super cheap. It makes us think that we need to spend more on hotel in the future or avoid all travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: LoneStarTrvlr
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent. It is within walking distance of most sites. The hotel is clean with comfortable beds. The rooms are on the smallish side. The laundry is clean with full size machines. This is a very busy hotel. Although the staff is friendly they are really too busy to help with tourist type questions. We ate two meals in the hotel restaurant. The food was good but they were so short staffed that the service was very disappointing. Within two blocks is a business building with a food court that is open for breakfast and lunch. The food is very good at good prices. One does have to go further afield to locate a restaurant for evening meals. Darling Harbour is within walking distance and many restaurants and cafes are in this area.

Reviews.Title: “wouldnt bother staying here much better else where”
Reviews.Author: Kendelle
Reviews.Content: we booked two rooms for two nights because of a great deal on Wotif.The airline changed our flight and we could only stay one night..We were very firmly told we could not get a refund fair enough I hadnt even asked., Not the hotels problem and probably their benefit. You wouldnt have thought so with Sydneys Basil Faulty sighing,raising eyebrows finally gave us two rooms one on level 10 and one on level 6 With two teenage children that probably wasnt going to work We asked if we could have the rooms on the same floor. Basil then gave us a lecture on how busy it was that weekend,mutterd about cheap wotif customers sighed and then for 1 hour 12 minutes ( I timed it) stared at the computer banging sighing and obviously annoyed. he even checked in another couple before returning to banging his computer and sighing with rolled eyes. for the first time ever I asked to see the manager, basil took off making sure to bang the door very hard twice. The manager arrived and fair enough gave us two rooms on the same floor in about 5 minutes 1 and 42 minutes later from arriving we were given keys to the rooms.Rooms old and tired had a great view of the office next door.Stuffy aircon didnt work but i was just gratefull to get a room Next morning on checkout Basils brother was on the desk We had a plane to catch and in a hurry. i got a lecture on how busy the hotel was and why had we booked (and paid)two nights and only stayed one. 45 minutes of banging the computer sighing and another door slam we checked out of our prepaid no extra charges bill The staff then watched us carry our luggage out to the taxi I was not happy Does the management realise that customers are more important than the computer screen OK we were paying lot less than most but if you dont like Wotif customers dont put it on their website. Of course their is the ultimate come back of this website Dont bother staying here unless you enjoy being embarrassed and made to feel uncomfortable Same good a deals on Wotif in much more friendly, newer and nice hotels Basil Fawlty is a alive and well in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “OK location, tired rooms”
Reviews.Author: rabelaus
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in this hotel and were very disappointed with it. Rooms were basic (which I don't mind) but old and never seemed to get clean. It wasn't hot whilst we were there (about 15C during the day) but the rooms were stuffy and baking - and the air conditioning didn't work at all. In the bathroom there were broken drain covers and dirty tiles. To top it all off the bed was very uncomfortable. The internet charges are rather high - go across 2 streets to the Macdonalds (open 24 h) and you can get it for free! The plus points - fairly central and close to the underground station (useful to get to the airport), the staff seemed OK (not that professional though), the breakfasts were OK. The downsides - the room, the view (straight into offices - lucky them), the non existent air conditioning, the bed, the lifts (honestly, we waited 10 mins for them on one day - even the staff were complaining about them).

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - tidy hotel”
Reviews.Author: CHH-pretoria
Reviews.Content: Honestly, this is a standard chain hotel room. Beatutifully clean and tidy, room style is exactly what you would expect. location is extremely convenient. cheap internet ad helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Handy Location”
Reviews.Author: DLArmstr0ng
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while in Sydney for the NRL Grand Final and found it's location an absolute winner! It is only a short walk from Circular Quay and Darling Harbour. We even walked back from the Kings Cross markets on the Saturday morning - however, that was quite a big walk, but not difficult at all! We chose it because of it's close railway station making the airport just a half hour away by train - so easy! The staff were very friendly and helpful when we checked in and the 3 days were very enjoyable although, someone was smoking on our floor on the Saturday night which wafted under our door into our room (yuk!) and in the morning, we had a notice under all the doors on our floor reminding us that it is a non-smoking hotel. I think perhaps the people involved should have been confronted at the time as it wasn't hard to tell who it was. Anyway, a reasonable hotel, but as others have already said before me that the hotel is old and the bathrooms are in real need of a make over! Having said that, it was very clean and that is the most important thing! Yes, the airconditioning was not the best, but I don't like it too cold anyway. The tv also didn't seem to have a volume control that worked and on some channels, it was too loud! Anyway, would recommend it to other travellers - especially if you are going to be out and about most of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: FurryFlaps
Reviews.Content: For a "budget" hotel this was all we could expect. We chose the hotel because of the location and having been to Sydney before couldn't find a better value hotel in the area.Close to Wynard Station also so great for quick transfer from airport. As the blurp in the lift say's " your luggage stays in your room longer than you do " and this is why we didnt spend over the top on a hotel in a city with so much to do. Within easy walk to Circulat Quays, harbourside, aquarium and shops etc etc , really acnnot fault anything. Helpful staff, regular pick up /drop off for airport and local tours and a very nice little Japanese restraunt with great soft shell crab next door. Rooms adequate and by far better than UK Travelodge standards. Views are of course restricted as you are in downtown Sydney , but I didn't go to look out the window !! Would stay again and probably will do on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Mellygator
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, very close to Wynyard station and only a 10 minute stroll down to the rocks and the quay. Fantastic cleaning crews, Every day the room was made up and tidied wonderfully, the staff are definitely an asset. We had a few gripes with our room, the biggest being the aircon and its complete ineffectiveness. We we're fortunate enough that it was cooler during our trip, I have no qualms in saying I wouldnt have been able to handle being in the building in summer time. The buildings very clearly old, but nowhere is that more obvious that in the bathrooms. They are very small and seem unfinished (weird gibbing patterns behind toilet), we also had trouble with the showerhead not staying locked up. Its age was also highlighted in the little soundproofing it has between rooms; we were unfortunate enough to have a very loud couple next door to us who woke up quite early and talked quite loudly. While there wasn't anything glaringly wrong with the hotel I'm not sure I'd stay again unless it was winter and i got a really good deal. I much prefer Travelodge on Wentworth, the rooms are bigger, the aircon is far superior and there's a kitchenette.

Reviews.Title: “great location, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: kazza7665
Reviews.Content: My son and I were made to feel very welcome, couldn't fault the service. Location, location, location says it all......close to all the main attractions, train station, bus stops, monorail and starbucks just over the road, what more could you possibly want. The only thing I would say is that the room was quite small and the beds were quite hard, but honestly we were only in the room for a few days and it was only used for sleeping and showering so that was just a minor inconvenience for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good Base”
Reviews.Author: ENB346
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 days in April. Great view of nothing but an office building.......literally watching people on their desktop PC's (at least whilst I brushed my teeth). Big hotel, friendly service and central location. 2 minute walk from Wynyard train station (which still has wooden escalators!!!). Clean, comforatble and reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Very simple hotel room”
Reviews.Author: biemaibaby
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here for 6 days and i can tell that the service was good, they always clean the room every morning. The thing i complain about the room is that the aircondition is not working very well, the room remain warm despite putting the cooler to the lowest degree.. The pillows are hard as stone and makes my neck sore in the morning.. The location is good considering the train station is just a few walks away.. When we go back to sydney, we will try other hotels than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent sydney location”
Reviews.Author: tonz1976
Reviews.Content: We Booked this hotel through hotels.com website. This hotels quite central location was great for visiting the Rocks, Circular Quay, Darling harbour etc. We caught the train to Wynyard station from the airport and the hotel is only a short walk away. If your staying in Sydney for a couple of days well worth buying a multi ticket at the airport which means you can travel around the city by train,bus and ferry up to 7days. We had a room on the 10th floor but after a disturbed nights sleep due to traffic noise I asked to be moved. The hotel staff were very accomodating and arranged for us to have a room on the 17th floor which was far quieter and they moved our bags for us while were out that day. There was also strangely a step into the bathroom which caused a stubbed toe or two but I suppose teaches you should look before you walk!! To sum up we had a great stay and will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Average 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: untravels
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great, a short walk to the Harbour and right next to the train station. Its definitely noisy in the mornings, like other reviewers have mentioned. The heating did not work that well in our room. Also, the staff would not recommend and restaurant names, and instead suggested we eat at the hotels restaurant. Basic internet should be included for guests, but its not so you would have to use the paid internet in the hotel lobby. The rooms were ok, a little dated, and bathrooms are very small and dated too.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Travelodge in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: megalomaniac1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 3 nights due to a good deal on a travel site. Originally I booked the executive room but upon arriving we found no kitchenette which we came to expect from most of the Travelodge's we've stayed in and so upgraded to a Studio room for $120 more. The studio is spacious but almost immediately we wished we had booked our usual Travelodge Wentworth which is A: cheaper and B: has a lovely kitchenette in all rooms. The water from the kitchenette tap was a disgusting milky white which we have never encountered from our many stays in Sydney so we were forced to subsist on their over priced waterbottles;the walls are not as sound proof as the Wentworth and I did not realise the hotel was close to a train station and so we could hear a train coming in at most hours of the day. Not to mention the kitchen cupboards had an odd mouldy odour and unlike the Wentworth which has a Coles close by and many take away outlets the Wynard is actually more isolated than I expected and it took a good walk to find any decent food. I am generally a big fan of Travelodge and have stayed in many but this one was a great disappointment and I will never veer from Wentworth Travelodge again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, reasonably priced, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MLPandLB
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Pricing varies a lot so one has to be quick to book. Best to book directly on their website rather than through other accomodation websites. I recommend bringing your own shampoo and conditioner or buying at the nearby Coles supermarket in the building housing the Wynyard train station. Newspapers are complimentary by the evening. Food is acceptable; there's lots of alternative choices. To get around the city during the day time, walk down to George St, about 10 minutes away, and catch the free City Circle bus.

Reviews.Title: “well situated, reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: boltartas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights. We know Sydney well, but hadn't stayed at this property before. The location is great, walking distance to the Rocks, Circular Quay, Martin Place. We caught the train in to Wynyard station from the airport and the hotel is only a short walk away. The room was spacious. The windows aren't double glazed, so there is some traffic noise, but as most of the immediate area is office space, there is very little late night revelry to disturb your rest. I requested a small pair of scissors whilst we were staying there and housekeeping lent me a pair for the whole duration of our stay, with no trouble at all. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: zaraza77
Reviews.Content: Great location, walked to circular quay, centrepoint, darling harbor, opera house. Train station beside, which was very handy when taking train from the airport with luggage, no need to taxi. Room was small but comfortable, the only complaint would be the shower head was very weak in spraying water. it's a water saver, but it is really bad or a hotel, they should fix this.

Reviews.Title: “Neat, clean; good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: VivoOra
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Travelodge on numerous occasions, both for business and for a weekend Sydney city getaway. Each time I am pleased to have chosen this hotel The location is great - comfortable walking distance to the Rocks, Darling Harling Harbour and Pitt Street Mall. So close to Wynyard train station, it's easy to get off the plane and into your room without any dramas. The meals in the restaurant are tasty, well portioned and value for money. Staff were very attentive and friendly, in the restaurant as well as on the reception desk. The rooms are compact and clean; comfy beds and a very hot shower. No complaints here.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic lodging in good location”
Reviews.Author: empjm
Reviews.Content: We were sightseeing all day and just needed a room to sleep in so this Travelodge fit our needs well. Room cost was reasonable and food in hotel restaurant was as well. Breakfast is rather pricey but there are plenty of cafes and food stands within walking distance. Only negative of room was dated tile in bathtub that had accumulated a little black mold. Otherwise very clean room and staff was pleasant. No wifi in rooms but available in lobby for high cost. Walk a few blocks to Apple store or McDonalds for a free wifi fix. Central location within walking distance of many attractions including circular quay, Hyde park, opera house, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Carolina P
Reviews.Content: The rate was ok, the location is very good. Breakfast was really expensive (AU$25), not included on the rate. Starbucks on the corner, and train station on the next block. Internet extremely expensive (AU$11 for 1 hour, or AU$22 for a day). They also had coin operated computers at the reception (AU$8 for 1 hour). Washing machine for AU$4, drying machine for the same price. The dryer didn't dry my clothes, I complained at the recepction and the guy limited himself to say "pay again". Rude staff. The restaurant has good and cheap options for lunch. Main course + glass of wine or beer or soft drink or juice for AU$15. I recommend this hotel, but be aware of extra costs. If you leave the room 15 minutes later, they will charge you extra AU$22.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Tak Soen L
Reviews.Content: Great location!! The train station is only a few steps away. And both Darling Harbour and Circular Quay are within pleasant walking distance. Shops, cafes and restaurants are all around, extremely convenient! Room is cleaned everyday, and the staff are all knowledgable and helpful. I particularly love that the hotel has lots of information on day tours. Most suitable for my family who are first time visitors to Sydney. Will definitely come back to Travelodge.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: krisc2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend in Sydney and a business trip on the Monday. The reception staff were inconsistent in that the Asian lady that served us was exceptionally courteous and sweet annd dealt with us swiftly on check-in. I noticed another member of staff was rather rude to customers at the desk with no manners and barking at the guest for information as if the guest were an inconvenience. The room was basic, not the cleanest but OK. The covered coloured pillows on the bed are decorative only and are very scratchy and pull your hair out! Beware! Essentially, this was the cheapest most central hotel and was fine. It's no four star hotel but I'd settle on three stars.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location - and thats about the only good thing”
Reviews.Author: Frank F
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights on Friday 26th and Saturday 27th of August 2011. After being conned into believing we were going to be staying the in The Rocks, Circular Quay 'precinct' by purchasing a mystery hotel deal, it is on the outside of said area and very stretched to say its in The Rocks, Circular Quay area. This hotel, in my opinion, is not 4 star, maybe 3 or 3.5 star. So check in, get to 18th floor, hallways are dark and univiting, its like an old office building has be divided up into rooms, generally a very tired looking interior, get into room and generally it was OK, but for the money and other positive reviews is a bit rich. The bed linen was tatty and scuff marks visible, the bed was on big wheels and couldnt be locked in place to prevent bed from moving (even when sitting on it), the bathroom was not exactly the most clean, soap scum on black tray which the complimentary soap etc sits on, mould in tile grouts, the television reception was terrible, and a very old tired looking air conditioning system, and a window which could not be close fully as it was missing a screw to the fixture of the handle. Even the view from the 18th level is overlooking noisy air con units on the neighbouring buildings roof. Also, I notice in previous reviews that the walls did not block out all noise from other rooms - this is definately the case. Staff on front counter are nice enough but could crack a smile once in a while and could be more forthcoming in friendly conversation. The front entrance is where the designated smoking area is, so its a lovely thing to walk outside and first thing you are hit with is a waft of cigarette smoke. There is no where to pull up out the front if you are driving and need to drop someone off. I would'nt be staying here again as a couple, but would be more of a cheap and nasty option for a bucks party if nowhere else was available. Regardless of what I have said, its a great central location, not The Rocks/Circular precinct as advertised, but a quick walk to those areas and everywhere else. You get what you pay for and I am more than happy to wear my experience on the chin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location....but wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: Eva497
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in fantastic location - you can walk pretty much anywhere from here - Opera House, Cirqular Way etc. We were not expecting much as the price was very reasonable for being in centre of Sydney and at the end of the day it is a Travelodge. However there are certain things you do expect like customer service, cleanliness........ When we got to our room we had two singe beds with a small bedsite table in the midlle.( We have asked for a double bed when we booked) When we rang reception to ask why this hasn't been obliged we were told that because we booked over the internet and not directly through Travelodge website our request doesn't need to be acknowledged and that the hotel is full so there is no way we can change a room. I understand that you don't alway get all you requested especially if they are fully booked but there is a way to tell people!!!! The room was at the end o the corridor and was very small with tiny bathroom. New deco and refurbishment much needed. When we put the two single beds together we discoverd large amount of dust and the room clearly hasn't been hoovered properly. Bed was comfy but didn't feel or look very clean. Towels in the bathroom were very rough and definitely needed changing for new ones. Shower wasn't working properly and we had to hold the shower head (which was attached to the wall) as it wouldn't stay in place) No wifi availalbe in the room unless you are staying on 12th floor or higher (we were on 5th floor). Reception was always busy and whenever you spoke to someone they made you feel like they were doing you a favour!!! Overall very dissapointing and we would not stay again. (altough the location is great)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very good value”
Reviews.Author: donbeshy
Reviews.Content: Really good central position, easy walking distance to the Rocks, Circular Quay, the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. Location is unbeatable at this price. Also close to Wynyards station. Like all Travelodges I have ever stayed in, comfortable rather than luxurious. The room was an adequate size But the room was very clean, we had a good shower and a comfortable bed. Like other reviewers we found Sydney very expensive so by Sydney standards this hotel is fantastic value. Look for online promotions or book direct on the travelodge.au website. Book on a Tuesday for a choice of promotions (Tuesday chooseday). Internet is chargeable but can be found for free at various sites including Maccy Ds and the public libraries.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: slyunus
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice in the past few years. This time we were on the 17th floor in an executive room over looking the city and parks. This hotel is in a great location, it was clean and had everything that you needed close by. Yes the bathroom is small but adaquate, the room was a good size and the linen was fresh and clean. Limited bathroom accessories were supplied but I usually take my own anyway. (Shampoo, conditioner and soap were supplied). There was a mini bar and inhouse movies. We had a meal at the restaurant and the food was good and the service excellent. The hotel staff were all helpful and friendly. The foyer had a nice atmosphere and was a nice place to sit and have a quiet drink and snacks. Compared to other hotels in Sydney, I thought this hotel was well priced. I would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel. Great location, everything else not so good.”
Reviews.Author: travelfiend_30
Reviews.Content: Location is great, close to everything - Darling Harbor, bars, restaurants... really great. However, room is dated and old. Service at reception is awful and depressing. There is no wifi in rooms. I could go on... overall, you get good value (I found a great deal on octopus travel) but the room and hotel are low end, period. Peeling paint, stained carpet... you get the drift.

Reviews.Title: “Good location close to Wynyard Rail Station.”
Reviews.Author: Helen749
Reviews.Content: Great value for money, really clean room and friendly and helpful staff. Would stay again when visiting Sydney next.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, ok for business trips”
Reviews.Author: Ally1066
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at our room there were dirty glassware from the previos occupant sitting outside the room, and they sat there until we complained about them. The room was small but furnished in a modern style. Our biggest problem was that our air conditioner seemed stuck on a heat setting and we had to keep opening a small window to cool the room down. We raised the problem with the front desk who said they were going to look into it but that was the last we heard.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: silverAnn
Reviews.Content: It was a very comfortable hotel, very good location in Sydney, train station only a few metres away and only a ten minuet walk to Sydney Harbour bridge. Rooms were very comfy and bed was also comfy. The staff were also very nice and helpful, hotel also has a restuarant if you don't want to venture out. I would defenitaly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews Can be Deceptive”
Reviews.Author: Michael C
Reviews.Content: Probably the worse hotel I've ever stayed at. I would hazard a guess that the majority of these good reviews here were written by hotel employees themselves. Rooms and decor haven't been updated since the mid-70's and everything felt dirty. Linen was scratchy and uncomfortable; pillows even worse. Learnt a valuable lessen - don't trust all reviews and in future avoid generic sounding hotels with "travel" and "lodge" in the name. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: LancashireLass21
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Sydney after an overnight flight from Hong Kong and travelled by train from the airport to Wynyard station where it is then a short walk to the hotel. In the CBD so quiet evenings and weekends but still lotsof places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Steven W
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay. Three nights this time. All evening meals in house with no disappointments. All staff courteous. All round good value in a very convenient location

Reviews.Title: “Good location Basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: hawick
Reviews.Content: Being rated a 4-star hotel, I expect more from the Hotel, but for the price I paid for the 2 night stay, I can't help but to say it is not worth the price. Only one word to sum up the hotel experience: "Basic". The room size was satisfied, but for the ammenities provided in the bathroom was somewhat disappointed. Nothing was given to us other than 2 towels and a hand towel and a Shampoo+conditioner. Thats all and not even a bar of soap and floor towel. All I can say is, the location is great, but other than that, the hotel seems like a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value!”
Reviews.Author: PuffinRTW
Reviews.Content: Staff were helpful and friendly. Room was spacious, clean and cosey. Location was ideal, a short walk from most places or a short train ride from others - nearest station just over the road. Liked the onsite restaurant for convenience after a long day sight seeing. The worst thing was the overly expensive wifi.

Reviews.Title: “great homebase for seeing Sydney”
Reviews.Author: judyAlabama
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in June with a group of students and adults. The location is very convenient, with public transportation nearby, but Hyde Park is only a few blocks walk away. The hotel is modern, and it serves a full buffet breakfast. It has internet available for a price. We were able to safely store our luggage until check-in time. Rooms were clean, flat screen tv's, and nice size baths. No complaints at all!

Reviews.Title: “Central and clean”
Reviews.Author: Loud1Canberra
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very central for business in the Sydney CBD. The room was clean and comfortable. The car parking is badly sign posted and took some time to find. The restaurant is small and at dinner time was overflowing and the service was almost non-existent. Nevertheless, I would stay again for business as it was convenient, clean, comfortable and cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: griswald-uys
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a 'Wothotel?' special because we couldn't decide where to stay in Sydney. We were bound by $150 cap due to friends of ours being on a budget, so to get the room for $165 on the deal was pretty good. The rooms are small and there is no real view, but it was clean and comfortable. The best part was being 50m from the train station and a quick walk from just about everywhere in the city. Staff were efficient and friendly. Overall a good hotel in a great location. Would definitely stay again if it was a quick trip.

Reviews.Title: “The small things make a difference - and all the small things were poor”
Reviews.Author: aussiegirl77
Reviews.Content: I only stayed in this hotel for a night on business and was disappointed. For a standard four star hotel in the city there isn't much to differentiate them - it really is about the small things. So I'll start with the 'misses'... the bed was rock hard - it was like sleeping on the floor. The jug in the room didn't work and so when all I wanted in the ten minutes before leaving the room was a quick cup of tea it was really irritating not to be able to have one.
