The shower was dreadful - the pressure wasn't great and the temperature kept changingâ€¦ from scalding one minute to cool the next (I assume it had to do with other people on the floor using their taps - but who knows). The towels were small and pretty threadbare. On the plus side the room was quiet and the drapes were heavy allowing for a good nights sleep (if the bed wasn't so hard!). I can't comment on food, room service or anything else of that nature because I checked in at 9:30pm and checked out at 8am.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: LaughingKookaburra
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for tourists and business people alike. Litrerally a few short steps away from Wynyard train station which is one station away from Circular Quay where the Opera House, Harbour Bridge and Rocks are located. Likewise its only one station away from Town Hall which is above the beautiful Queen Victoria Building and the main shopping precinct of David Jones, Myer, etc etc. Although it's just as easy to walk to all those destinations. Underground Wynyard Station are eateries and a Coles and Woolworths supermarkets, chemist, newsagent, great shops etc. Right opposite the hotel is Starbucks. The hotel room was of average size with usual appointments. Quiet and clean. Great value taking into consideration being so central. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine, nothing spectacular, great location”
Reviews.Author: Copyedster
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine -- room was clean, decent size. Bathroom and some of the in-room features were very dated. The ironing board was something out of the '60s -- but who chooses a hotel based on its ironing board? All in all, it was a fine stay, just nothing special enough to warrant a better-than-average rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - get the executive suites”
Reviews.Author: Cloudburst77
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. Its 4 star and I think this is pretty spot on. We stayed here 3 nights and got the deal on their website for a 3 night stay in an executive room. We chose this as the room is on a high floor. We are glad we did as I can only imagine the noise from lower floors. But in any case, those rooms are cheaper, so if you like a bit more quiet choose the executive rooms otherwise don't complain. Another one I've heard is that the bathrooms are small. Yes I guess they are but .. its a bathroom! For a couple its fine. You are not making a cake in there. But what I'd like to say is I wish hotels would include a ceiling fan in there, for obvious reasons. There is a vent but I haven't actually seen a hotel which has one in the bathroom. I was really impressed with the view facing York street. I thought I'd be looking directly onto another building. I could see the river, the tower and watch the "workers" rush around like ants below. Check in and out was simple. We were able to leave our bags in a secure room while we picked up the hire car. We came back and could park our car in their car park for free. But yes, its small so don't use this car park if you have anything like a 4WD!! Anyway, a nice stay and perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: utya
Reviews.Content: Good spot for a Sydney visit - easy walking to main attractions. But if you need a shower cap take your own - none were provided, staff did not have one and could not get one for my wife at our request.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Qldstar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel when I could not get into my usual Sydney hotel. The location is very good, however the rooms were very small and my room had the smallest bathroom I have every seen. The car park is near impossible if you have a large car. The staff were average however the breakfast buffet was great.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms but smelly air con - had to keep moving rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Joanna5
Reviews.Content: We had two separate stays here - a four night stay, a trip to the Blue Mountains & Hunter Valley, and then returned for a 1 night stay before heading to the airport. This was booked in advance - wouldn't have necessarily returned if not already booked. When we first arrived we were pleased, it is clean, the service is fine (although always allow for time to queue at the desk), and it is very nicely located for exploring Sydney. The room we got smelled damp, coming from the air conditioning unit that is located at waist height below the windows. It really is an unpleasant smell and filled the room. However when opening the window the noise from the busy street is loud. We had to change room as the smell was making me feel ill...the room we had faced Margaret Street, and we were moved to one that faced York Street - this was a massive improvement and we were happy enough there for our 4 night stay. The location is great, we walked everywhere...5-10 mins easy walk to Sydney harbour and Opera House and the area feels safe to walk around at night. On our return to Travelodge Wynyard (for our one night stay) we were booked into another room facing Margaret Street, which again, stunk! We moved again to one facing York Street which was fine! Try to ensure you get one facing York St and you should be fine! Although relatively expensive for a Travelodge everything is pricey in this area - must be because it seems safe, and central. It is definitely worth the money, especially because you don't have to rely on any public transport or taxis at all. We ate in the restaurant for 2 nights, they have different themed deals on each night e.g. steak night, pasta etc. The food was nice and good value. It is really close to the train station so you can walk with your bags - it's literally 1.5 blocks. We used the train to get to/from Sydney airport and it was great, well worth doing. We used the internet computers in the lobby quite a few times. It's about $2 for 20 mins...and some of the computers are very slow and crash. When this happens reception denies all knowledge as the internet is outsourced! Regulars seem to know which are best so look out for the computers that most people head to and you should be alright! Overall, we enjoyed our stay - basic but comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Savy_Sydney_Lily
Reviews.Content: I stayed here about a week ago. I flew to Sydney for a medical appointment, and was looking for something central as I was feeling truly physically ill and couldn't see myself walking great distances around the city. I have to say that I have never stayed anywhere but a 5 star in the City, but i decided to stay here for the location. I'm glad i did. Location was brilliant - goes without saying, and close to my beloved Rocks area. The counter service and check in was fantastic. I had booked online for a 2:30pm check-in, but i arrived at 11am, and apologised to the young man serving. I advised i could sit on the lounge and wait if need be until after lunch, but he checked me right in. I was VERY grateful as i was feeling quite faint after my solo flight to Sydney. He was a young Indian male, who was very pleasant throughout my 3 day stay there (unfortunately, I forget his name). The room was just what i needed - clean, quiet, warm, a comfy bed. This establishment may not have the bells and whistles of some 5 star hotels nearby, but it was perfect for my purposes. I stayed at the Swissotel a few months ago, and absolutely hated it. The worst experience i have ever had staying at a hotel. This place, being a 4 star, trumps it! The only slightly negative comment i would make would be the very limited late night room service menu. When i called to place an order, i was told i had missed the chef by 4 minutes (!), but that pizza could be arranged. Apart from that issue, i have nothing but praise. The breakfast downstairs was great. I had a craving for scrambled eggs, and it was perfect. If i hadn't been too embarrassed to do so, i would have gone back for seconds and thirds, i loved it that much (currently pregnant with twins and was craving eggs that morning)! My partner joined me on the second day. His only complaint was the car park space was somewhat cramped, and it was difficult driving out. But overall, i really enjoyed my experience here. I will definitely be back. (as an aside, my colleagues often stay at Travelodge Phillip Street as its close to the Supreme Court, and they all say positive things too).

Reviews.Title: “Great location for business minded people”
Reviews.Author: bribs28
Reviews.Content: If you're not looking for a 5 star hotel or 5 star service, this place is okay. Travelodge is conveniently located in the heart of the CBD so if you're going there for business, most likely your meeting will be in this area. Definitely not the 4 star status it was given, but a good place to stay nonetheless. I would have no problem spending a few more days at Travelodge at some point. A major con - you have to pay for Wifi. Not only that, you pay about $11 for half an hour and upwards after that. Not ideal. However, if you're just stopping by for a few days on a work trip, this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Robert255108
Reviews.Content: we stayed here from the 12th--- 17th of june.the service was great.the staff went out of their way to accomodate us early after arriving on an early flight from new zealand.the restaurant attached to hotel served great breakfasts and the dinner menu offered a good selection.the room was very clean and well presented.and the bed was soooo comfortable.best sleep we have had for 5 years that we have been together.would not hesitate to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good, you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Harry_B11
Reviews.Content: You really do sometimes get what you pay for. This is a nice place, the location was perfect for the conference I was going to. But it had lots of young people and tourists that were running around in the lifts and I could hear them around midnight. The rooms were pretty good, quite plain but good. The cafe had an ok coffee and the staff were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HelenJ44
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault the accommodation at Travelodge Wynyard. The room was well furbished, very clean and comfortable and well set out. The location is excellent - close to The Rocks, Quay, Darling Harbour, QVB. Reasonably priced. Friendly staff. Late check-out of 11 am. One great advantage was no time limit on the parking - didn't have to leave the city at check-out. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A Central Sydney hotel comfort zone”
Reviews.Author: 255103Wynyard
Reviews.Content: I recently travelled from Perth, Western Australia to the Travelodge Wynyard, to meet up with some friends from America. My husband and I stayed at this hotel some eight yrs ago and the standards have not dropped. The warm welcome from Reception Staff, quick and succinct check in, the brightly furnished room, plus a comfortable bed and pillows were a great start. A good bathroom, plenty of hanging space, plus all other amenities like tea/coffee making facilities, ironing board and iron etc. Excellent slim line tv. Rooms very clean and well serviced each day. The restaurant served good food and it was understandably well patronised. I was travelling alone before my friends arrived (it was to surprise them) so I particularly appreciated the hotel's restaurant, the proximity to Wynyard Station, the plentiful buses and taxis, plus it was a pleasant walk to the main shopping area, The Sydney Harbour Bridge, Circular Quay, and even a free circular bus from nearby George St. Apart from all of the above, I suppose the main factor was the pleasant and helpful staff - nothing was too much trouble. Booking by telephone was also another very agreeable experience. Attitude is everything in this day and age. For an experience such as mine in a major Capital City this has to be worth recommendation. I am also willing to report bad experiences, but always happy to document good ones too. I hope Travelodge Wynyard get to see my comments as they are sincerely meant. I also felt proud to show my American friends the polite, friendly hospitality of Australia (it was their first visit). The hotel is excellent value and this is always a huge consideration for most overseas travellers. I might add that I and my husband have travelled the world in the last 25 yrs so we really appreciate good quality and value. Thank you Travelodge Wynyard.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will come back.”
Reviews.Author: old pet name
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for only 1 night but would have loved to have stayed longer. I had a twin share room with my daughter which had a double and a single bed. The room was amazing with a great view of the city, which was fantastic a night. The amenities were modern, clean and spacious. The dining room was open until 10pm which allowed us to have dinner after getting back later than expected. The food was of excellent standard and the service in the dinning room was great with friendly, attentive staff. Over all Customer service was excellent and we were able to leave our luggage in a secure and locked room prior to check in and after check out. There was adequate information in the hotel information booklet found in the room for anyone who needed extra care or in formation about other services the hotel has to offer, travel information and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic & convenient location, but some areas of improvement required”
Reviews.Author: MelTravel72
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a great hotel to base your trip when visiting Sydney. One block from Wynyard train station for getting to & from the airport. Walking distance to the harbor, the rocks, shopping, chinatown & darling harbor. Downsides of the hotel was lack of customer service, hard bed, the instant coffee (Starbucks was across the road which we frequented), no use of pool, couldn't get into gym & when checking out, again lack of customer service, was not asked how our stay was or for any feedback.

Reviews.Title: “Better than you think, Business or Leisure”
Reviews.Author: Scottiec75
Reviews.Content: My first review of a hotel on here and perhaps a little biased as my travel is for work, so Iâ€™m not paying. Although I do stay in a number of hotels around the place so I have a fair idea what is good value and what is not. I have stayed at this property 5 times over the last 12 months on business mostly 3 - 4 nights at a time and have just booked again for next week. Check in is usually busy when I get there. I have to wait most times but not for long as the check in counter is one of the most efficient I have seen at a Sydney hotel. Lifts are reasonable fast and never too crowded. I have never had to wait long and they don't take long to get even to the 20th floor. (Tip if you room service dinner - They put the daily specials on a sheet in the lift and you can order it through room service. I always check it out) Rooms are not huge but they are very well laid out and to me that is more important than a heap of space I will not need. I have only ever stayed in a standard room which has a Queen bed (very comfortable and not the zip together type), two tub chairs and a desk with chair, LCD TV (decent size too) and good lighting. The bathrooms are compact with shower over tub, basin and toilet all neatly packed in but still very usable. I'm a big guy and I have no trouble using the facilities. Iâ€™ve never had any trouble with water pressure or temperature. Room Service has a good menu (along with the specials in the lift) and very prompt service. Iâ€™ve never waited longer than half an hour for a meal. Only downside is no Breakfast Room Service. Restaurant is always clean and tidy. They are open early for breakfast and always have customers at night which is a good sign that the food is good. I mainly do room service dinner but the times that i have had dinner there I couldnâ€™t fault the service or the food. At breakfast time there is a good selection of all the regular Buffet or Continental style items. Gym, they have one and they have equipment in it that I have seen people using. Looks like modern equipment. I should be able to tell you more but I havenâ€™t used it. Checkout, See Check in. Same same. Location, Perhaps the best feature of this hotel is the location, about 1 minute slow walk to Wynyard station. (barely get wet in the rain) Major Supermarkets very close by, perhaps 2 minutes. Good Coffee shops and Restaurants in the immediate area. I have also noticed that even though you are in the city it is pretty quite outside between 10pm and 6am so i always get a good nightâ€™s sleep. I have stayed here on holiday too and its a great location for everything the city has to offer. The Rocks, Circular Quay, Opera House and downtown shopping are all easy walking distance. It will continue to be my choice for business and holiday in Sydney unless something changes.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Cayci_3
Reviews.Content: The room is a typical 3 star place the US would have. However the staff was friendly, the food in the restaurant lobby is AMAZING, and the Wynard Bus/Train station is less than a block away! The location is perfect for hopping on the train to Circular Quay (5 min trip tops). Also the Darling Harbour bay is just a quick walk north and you can get on the ferrys there and just cruise around. I'm sure a hotel next to the bridge is awesome, but this was just the perfect location because you can get on the train so quick or walk down the street for a ferry. We will no doubt stay there the next time we go. It wasn't too hot when we were there but getting the AC to work (we weren't sure how to work it) was a pain, but when we figured it out it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: eddie78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week on a business trip. It's located in Sydney CBD and close to Wynyard station. Because of it's location, it was easy to hire a taxi or hop on the train to get around. It's a 10 minute walk from circular quay, The Rocks, Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. For the shopaholics, Pitt Street is also just about a 10 minute walk away. Rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable to sleep in. The bathroom, though a bit small was OK as well. Check in/check out was a breeze. The restaurant was also a good place to grab a bite(especially when it was raining outside.). The only small gripe was that the walls were not completely sound proof.

Reviews.Title: “Fine except for air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: linds4516
Reviews.Content: We booked here on a "five night deal" which gave us a significant discount for the seven nights we stayed. We found the deal on needitnow.com.au On these packages, they're not going to give us a room on a high floor with a view but rather sell the rooms on low floors with no view, so we were not surprised to get just such a room. It didn't matter; we were hardly ever in it. It was fine, easily four star, flat screen TV, cable etc and one nice touch was the huge shower head in the bathroom. Room service was prompt and the food excellent. One con, and a big one, was the erratic air conditioning and I notice this has been mentioned in other reviews. Sometimes it worked, giving us air at the temperature we wanted. More often it gave us hot air unless we turned the dial down to something ridiculous like 12C, sometimes we had no air flow at all. Some hotels like to reduce air flow in the dead of night assuming guests won't notice and this property did that every single night, so sleep quality was poor despite the comfortable furnishings. The room had no opening windows. Would I stay there again? Yes, the convenience of being right in the CBD is hard to overstate but I'd pay extra for a room on a higher floor which faced York St, as they all seemed to have windows that would open.

Reviews.Title: “Good position, Good value”
Reviews.Author: spacewaitress
Reviews.Content: Reception staff friendly and advised of hotel facilities on check in. Room was very clean, comfortable and nice and warm on a chilly Sydney night. Had dinner in the hotel restaurant. Service and food were great - and reasonably priced too. On check out staff asked if I would like my bag minded to enjoy the city. Would definitely stay again. And when in the city for the day would keep in mind the restaurant for lunch! Being so close to a train station, The Rocks and the Quay is a huge bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: pjl7420
Reviews.Content: The Travelodge represents good value in Sydney ( which is becoming ridiculously expensive). The rooms are functional but clean, the staff are helpful but it is noisy at night. Don't plan on sleeping in. If you trade the noise off for location then this has to be on nay short list.

Reviews.Title: “Long Weekend in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: greenfrogBrisbane
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I recently stayed 3 nights at the Travelodge Wynyard Hotel in Sydney for her 24th birthday and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Rooms were comfortable and clean, featuring flat screen TV, comfy beds and beddings -plenty of spare pillows, nice quiet bar fridge - well stocked (although as normal for hotels - mini bar pricing is dear!!), large full length mirrors, table/chairs, clean bathroom with bath and hairdryer. We were on the 6th level with a view of exterior office buildings but it was nice and quiet. The Mon-Fri lunch at $14.50 with a drink was great value for money. Breakfast is $20 to $25 per head which is a little pricey so McDonalds is a cheaper option!! My only complaint was that there were insufficient power points for mobile phones/cameras needing to be charged. Being a traveller - I think it's nice to have a bottle of water offered free of charge in the room rate. Otherwise everything else was spot on. Hotel is central to all Sydney sightseeing options - Circular Quay, Harbour Bridge, Sydney Opera House, Pitt Street and the CBD as well as Darling Harbour. Wynyard Train Station just 2 mins from hotel, free 555 tourist bus one street away. Would definitely stay here again and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “No frills”
Reviews.Author: middlemanontheroad
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights on a business trip. The room I got was basic but could not be faulted as this was what I had expected for a room in a Travelodge (I've stayed in other Travelodge hotels before). The hotel has a gym at the top level (sweat it out if you work out in the afternoon as the sun hits the gym directly!). The hotel location is very handy as it is very near the Wynyard train station and I only needed to take the train to get to my client. Also, as it is in the Sydney CBD, there is no shortage of places in the immediate area to have a meal. Avoid the breakfast on the go package advertised in the hotel lifts as you will get a microscopic muffin which will hardly fill you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Location, Never Staying Anywhere Else in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: Mich05-66
Reviews.Content: My parents, husband, our 4 month old and I stayed at Travelodge Wynyard Sydney for a long weekend, booking two executive rooms. Having previously had a nightmare hotel experience staying in Sydney I was a little apprehensive, however the Travelodge Wynyard met and exceeded our expectations. The executive rooms we stayed in on the 19th floor were great; most importantly the rooms were clean and tidy with a comfortable bed and we even had a bit of a view! The cot provided for our baby was in good condition. The noise (within the hotel and outside) wasn't excessive and we had good sleeps. The staff were extremely helpful and pleasant at all times and nothing was a problem - they stored stuff we needed refrigerated for the day when we first arrived and a private taxi was suggested and organised for us with a baby car seat to get us back to the airport at the end of our stay, which was cheaper and easier than taking the train in peak hour (even though the station is just a block away)! Luggage can be stored for you before check-in and after check-out if required. We enjoyed a nice meal in the hotel restaurant, which was able to cater for a gluten-free diet for Coeliacs like my Mum and I. The location of this hotel is perfect for getting around the major highlights of the city - everything is within walking distance. The rates are fantastic, especially when compared to other hotels in the area. There are only two small things I could come up with to note; the bathrooms were on the small side (however were totally functional and clean) and the tea/coffee facilities were very basic, however I generally stay in accommodation that has a kitchenette so it might just be my perception! When we next visit Sydney we will not even consider staying anywhere else, and would definitely recommend Travelodge Wynyard to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: ztinkerbelle
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the website's photos: that photographer should get a bonus, because there endeth the quality. From reviews and photos, we thought this was an excellent price for a Sydney hotel, but you get what you pay for. Our hallway smelled foul for 3 days (granted, other floors were odor free), our shower had mildew, and the beds were godawful. While staff was friendly, the level of service was very poor (when we requested extra towels, we were told that we could go and fetch them from the gym). The lobby was fully of loud, obnoxious, frequently drunk/hung-over university-aged kids at almost all times, giving it a hostel feel, but I was pleasantly surprised to find that the rooms were quiet. I made the profound mistake of leaving something in the room after we checked out - all attempts to recover it were in vain. Don't waste your money here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, 2 chairs, a table and a sofa but bathroom needs updating and bed hard.”
Reviews.Author: Hertstraveljunkie Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of location - next to Wynyard Station for the Airport Express, and within walking distance of Circular Quay and ferries, and main sights with buses in all directions from just over the road. After 6 weeks touring in motels and hotels we were expert in assessing rooms. Positive: location, helpful staff, pleasant room. Nice 2 seater sofa, so we could watch TV ( rotating flat screen) in comfort, as well as 2 upright chairs and a small table. Cheerful orange and grey decor. Nice big wardrobe with enough hangers, full length mirror, 2 bedside tables, 2 lamps. Iron and board, plus guest laundry on top floor . Main negative was small bathroom - needed updating. Grout grimey and bath chipped. Could have turned basin unit into open shelves as not enough counter space for washbag, make-up, etc and tray of toiletries. Difficult to fill kettle in basin as taps too low. Folding bath/shower screen meant impossible not to flood a bit of floor. Irritating trendy sliding shutters on windows, kept jamming and leaked light. Could have done with another lamp/ceiling light as a bit murky - those low energy bulbs again! Bring back black out curtains/blinds! A/C noisy and safe in wardrobe was on high shelf so vertically challenged had to teeter on chair to see what was in it!. Our room faced onto York Street, so traffic was noisy but view interesting. Breakfast buffet a bit expensive, but had dinner in restaurant as raining on first night and that was good. Numerous breakfast alternatives nearby and Woolworths in Met Centre on George/Margaret St. corner for picnic supplies and also food court there. Various shops in Wynyard Station complex too.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: Roadtripper1987
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night and that was more than enough. We chose this hotel because it was centrally located and we just needed a bed for the night before leaving for a cruise. At both check in and check out, the receptionists that we were speaking to stopped what we were doing to walk away and talk to another staff member or answer a phone call. The staff were rude and it seemed too busy to smile. The room was itself was fine, but the bathroom was discusting. There was mould in the bath/shower and something black running down the front of the sink. It looked like the person before us had shaved and housekeeping had not cleaned the whiskers from the sink. There was also no soap supplied. The airconditioning was not working at all. I had called Reception to let them know and they advised that there was a problem with the whole building and nothing could be done until a technician had arrived. Another guest that we had spoken to was given a fan for the night but there were none available by the time we called. The temperature made it almost impossible to sleep and the problem was not fixed by the time we checked out in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Every trip I say "Never again"”
Reviews.Author: SimonWise
Reviews.Content: I've done my best to avoid Travelodge's in my frequent trips to Sydney. Not that I have anything against chain hotels - It's just that Travelodge seems to thrive on one-off tourist business where the tour operator's margin is everything and a brand name gives the illusion of consistency of quality. I'm forced, now and again, to consider this hotel when booking in the sub $200/night range. Every time I run out of options (because all the other decent hotels are booked) I feel ripped off. Poor service, tired and smelly rooms with mass-catering breakfasts and an insistance to debit money from your c.card as security against damages (perhaps I do look like a Keith Moon, drug-crazed business man after all) all make for a very unwelcome stay. If you have the choice, leave this to the tourist buses and book yrself into something smaller and nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Beaniee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the strategic location. Walking distance (5-10 mins depending on your speed) to Darling harbor, the rocks, Circular Quay. And its very close to Wynnyard train station to catch the train to airport. The hotel room is bit old and small but it's fine with me. I would recommend this hotel to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ljs3096
Reviews.Content: Located a 5 minute walk from Circular Quay and 10mins from the opera house, this hotel is perfectly situated. The rooms are clean and well-equipped. Staff are friendly and helpful. They stored luggage for me on my last day before I left for the airport, and on arrival I was able to check in a couple of hours early. All in all, a really good choice for a Sydney stay. The internet in reception was very expensive though at $11 per hour.

Reviews.Title: “A tale of two very different rooms”
Reviews.Author: sueom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Travelodge for4 nights at the beginning of February. My friend and I travel to Sydney often as we have children living there. This trip was a girls trip to show another friend the delights of Sydney before she returns home to Scotland. I have stayed in numerous Sydney hotels. The location of the Travelodge is exceptional, very close to Circular quay, The Rocks, the cbd and Darling Harbour. This review though is about 2 very different rooms. My friend and I had a very nice twin room overlooking York Street. Although not exceptionally large, it was light bright and very clean. All we needed. We did not see our Scottish friend's room until the second night and were frankly a little shocked.It was on the opposite side of the hotel and very dark. That we could have lived with, but the room stank of cigarette smoke (the hotel is supposed to be non smoking) even the bed linen smelled of smoke and there was what looked like a burn mark on one of the quilts and a stain on the other.All in all it looked very grubby. The room had an interconnecting door and the queen bed was 2 beds joined together. Not unusual I know but this had 2 seperate quilts on it so it didn't look like 1 bed, just 2 pushed together. We opened the window to try and get rid of the smell. The next day I spoke to the reception staff who said they would look into it and inform the duty manager,but nothing happened and my friend didn't want to complain further as she doesn't like to make a fuss. It was disappointing, though, as the rooms were poles apart and no one attempted to speak to us about it again. So would I recommend the Travel lodge? That would very much depend on the room I stayed in. Absolutely if it was my room, absolutely not if it was my friends room. I will be in Sydney again in either April or May so we will see whether I am game enough to risk an awful room.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: itsabigplace
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Sydney in November 2007, and stayed here. It is what it says, a travellodge, but the rooms are large and airy, as good as a hotel. But this hotel is all about its location. Literally a five minute walk from Circular Quey (where the bridge and opera house are)! In the other direction, a ten minute walk will get you to the main shopping area. Whichever way you go there are restaurants. If you want location, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Good value stay in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: hugh19
Reviews.Content: Situated 10 minutes walk to Circular Quay and Darling Harbour. This hotel is clean and comfortable without frills. A great base for exploring Sydney, close to station for airport link.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Traveleator
Reviews.Content: I found a very sweet deal on one of the discount hotel websites for Travelodge and pounced on them given the TA ratings, location and the price that I was getting a room for 3 nights. The hotel is situated very close to Wynyard station, the Rocks, Circular Quay, Harbour Bridge (Bridgeclimb) and other attractions such as QVB (a must visit, if not for the shopping than for the architecture), George Street etc. The hotel has a ramp for rolling luggage and wheelchair access. The lobby is big with a decent seating place, a few internet access points and a restaurant and bar that has daily special meals at a reasonable rate. The rooms are spacious with a queen bed, couple of sofas, coffee table, air-conditioner, heater, ironing board and iron, safe, etc. The bathroom wasn't the biggest that we saw in our stay at 5 hotels across Australia, but was clean and well light. The bed wasn't the most comfortable as every time either my partner or I turned (which we tend to do a lot through the night) the other was inconvenienced because of the spring under the bed. The safe wasn't functioning properly though, I guess some of the keys weren't recognizing an entry every time I pressed them. We ate breakfast only on the last day as it was a Sunday and we'd to catch a flight....the hotel has a discount if you pre-book one the night before, I guess just a gimmick to get people to eat there. They had scrambled eggs, cereals, toasts, preservatives, baked beans, juices and luckily hot chocolate included. The hotel is great for business travel as well as people who'll be out most of the time visited the wonderful spots in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “budget & basic”
Reviews.Author: 2AYEARFROMNOW
Reviews.Content: We already knew this. Plates,cups and cutlery at breakfast have not been cleaned properly and are stained. Room had dust on shelves and in bathroom corners. More attention required to cleaniness.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Jim104
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the travelodge for 7 nights in Jan 2011, the hotel is in a excellent location for wanting to see the sights of Sydney. All the major attractions (Opera House, Harbour Bridge, Darling Harbour, The Rocks) are all within a 10 minute walk, which is excellent as it keeps costs down to a minimum so you can do all the tours you want. The rooms are a reasonable size, you have to pay more for a room with a view the higher floors. We were on the 14th floor looking out the back of the hotel, not the best view in the world but just depends if you want the extra for paying for it. If you are booking from the UK to go over i suggest you arrange a transfer or go by bus when you get to the airport we didnt and had to pay $70 dollars for a taxi from the airport. The hotel restaurant is reasonably priced to Sydney's standards, the food was very good and the staff excellent. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wanted a base while exploring this amazing city!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel, but clean and tidy in a good location”
Reviews.Author: FirebrandFox
Reviews.Content: The hotel isn't bad at all, however, it's older and is probably in need of a major overhaul given the price of the rooms. Having said that, it's clean and tidy and there's nothing wrong with it all.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value in a fantastic location. Can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: RedRH
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location - only about 10 minutes walk from Circular Quay, and buses and train station right outside. The location is also in a quieter part of the Sydney CBD. The rooms are spotless, and I didn't hear noise from any of the adjoining rooms. My only criticism was the room service food - very freshly cooked, but a little bland (desserts were delicious, though). But I'll stay there again when I return to Sydney next year. The location is worth it, and the staff are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: elliottsonpender
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Wynyard Travelodge. We were pleasantly surprised. Great location, walked all over Sydney and took in all the sights. We had a room on the 18th floor. It was quiet and spacious. All the employees we met were happy and helpful. Would recommend this hotel to all. Easy access to transportation also. Took a taxi from the airport for $45.00 including toll fee.

Reviews.Title: “Functional”
Reviews.Author: 3littlepigsgotroppo
Reviews.Content: Country style motel in the big smoke. The Travelodge doesnt cut it with the big boys in the 4/5 star category but if you can get a cheap price its worth a look. Pluses: Convenient location Comfy pillows and bed Bath as well as shower Efficient Checkin Harbour glimpses from our 16th floor room Opening windows let in some fresh air Negatives: Small room Shower tiles could do with a dose of bleach after Sydney's humid spring Upstairs public areas very dated Overnight parking expensive at $30 Very basic amenities eg No handtowels/ face washers, just 2 small towels and a bathmat.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but very basic”
Reviews.Author: benrobinson
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several small boutique hotel in Sydney before but due to late booking had to stay in the large Travelodge on Wynyard St. The cost is comparabel to the smaller hotels but the location is much further out from the two main harbours and sites. Staff were friendly, communal areas clean, cheap internet was available in the reception area. The room, whilst clean, is very basic. The biggest downside is the world's most uncomfatable bed!! Anybody over 6" tall avoid this hotel at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - Clean and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: T-birdTraveler98
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and got a good deal with a non-refundable advance pay option on hotels.com. Fantastic LOCATION...(only better hotel locations would be the Park Hyatt, Old Holiday Inn, or the Four Seasons). Easy to walk to the Rocks, Circular Quay, and the Opera House as well as Darling Harbor. Hotel is fully NON-SMOKING, and those who violate will be fined. We had an issue our first night where the folks next door were smoking, and it was wafting into our room via the ventilation system. The late night front desk staff responded immediately and resolved the issue. The front desk staff advised me that any guests found smoking were automatically charged a $500 fee. Those folks next door to us were not a bother after the first night. Front desk STAFF: very helpful and efficient but not overly friendly, which was perfectly fine in our opinion. ROOM: Good size, with plenty of storage and wardrobe space. Beds were comfy. The bathroom is too snug for two people, unless one is in the shower. The state of it looks like it's been refreshed but not renovated per se. We found the hotel and room to be good. However, note that if you don't have earplugs, the STREET NOISE from York Street on weekdays could be bothersome for some. There are rooms that face away from York, so ask for one of those if noise tends to bother you. Hotel FACILITIES: Laundry (coin-operated 2 washers and 2 dryers) is on the 21st floor along with a very small fitness room and a couple of vending machines. There is a restaurant in the hotel but we did not eat there. INTERNET: No free internet (neither hotel computers nor WiFi). However, there are coin-operated computers with internet in the hotel lobby. To get free internet, go to either of the libraries (city or state library) for free access (free to residents and non-residents). In addition, we found McDonald's had free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but watch the fine print & double check the service”
Reviews.Author: Tallblue
Reviews.Content: Booked into this hotel for two nights on a recent weekend trip to Sydney. Telephoned early in the afternoon to advise we would be checking in later that evening. Booking was confirmed and we were informed there would be no problem with a late check in as the desk was maned 24/7. Arrived about 10.00PM to find that apparently we had no booking! After some discussion our booking was "found" and we were given the room key. However firstly we were informed that hotel policy required a payment of $100.00 as a payment for incedentals. Not just a credit card swipe but a full charge against our account. (Remember we had just arrived!) Informed them we had never done this before but gave in and they took our $100.00. Given the magical door key and informed our room was on 13th floor. Found the room opened the door, swithched on the light to find it was fully ocupied with two people in bed! After a quick and most embassing exit back to the looby to get another and hopefully vacant room. Apart from this and the demand for $100 up front the hotel was very pleasant. Great location right in the middle of Sydney CBD and next to the rail station. Bathroom very small and tight with shower over bath but everything worked and was clean. bed remarkably comfortable. Upon departure we were informed our $100.00 would be repaid into our account "within a week"

Reviews.Title: “Good value in the CBD”
Reviews.Author: dooragan
Reviews.Content: This 4 star hotel is clean, modern, comfortable and very well located, especially if you want to be near the Rocks, Darling Harbour and Circular Quay. I've stayed here before but booked it as a Wotif 'secret deal' for only $99 (Sunday rate) so was very pleased to find somewhere like this for such a great price. No frills but still a great travelers hotel. The hotel has been refurbished and my room (10th floor) was well laid out, well appointed, surprisingly quiet (I faced York Street), clean and comfortable...not large but enough room for me. A queen and a single bed were complimented by a decent sized desk and chair and a comfy side chair and small table. A new flat screen TV finished it off. The bathroom was spotless and large enough. The lobby and adjoining restaurant were inviting with large leather lounges and an Internet kiosk (although $11 for 30 minutes is way too much). A good selection of keenly priced meals were available and good room service is also available. Very, very close to trains and buses but most places you'd want to go are a reasonably short walk. The King Street Wharf precinct is only a few blocks and the Quay is a 10 minute walk. Overall, a good option for a comfortable, well priced and well located hotel in the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, aging facilities”
Reviews.Author: aengusj
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 9am, checked in but told the room wasn't ready until the official checkin time of 2pm. Free luggage storage was offered. The room (twin double) was small, but had all standard amenities. Bathroom/shower is cramped though and aging. Almost impossible to get a consistent water temperature from the shower. Minibar prices are on the high side. Walls are thin and you can quite easily hear conversations in the hallway or the neighbouring rooms. Beds were fine. Overall impression is not of a 4 star hotel, but more like a 3 star. Expensive for what it is, but I guess you pay extra for the perfectly central location. Most attractions are within 10 minutes walking distance and the subway station is right next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: beachmonkey13
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 2 nights at the Travelodge. The staff was welcoming and helpful with directions and ideas our entire stay. The rooms were small, but quite clean. Was surprised to see a well stocked minibar in our room. We did hear our neighbor through the adjoining room door one night, so I would recommend asking if they have rooms that do not have connecting doors. The location was wonderful. We were able to walk to all the tourist spots. Being located by the train and bus station was also a plus.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed two nights at the Travelodge...”
Reviews.Author: MrPeters
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Travelodge Wynyard. Its location is very good. Only a 10 minute walk to the King St and Cockle Bay wharf precinct. It is also a good walk to Circular Quay. Rooms are small but were suitable for our requirements. The staff were helpful on check-in. Overall a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: EsCHalesowen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five nights. This is an excellent base for a sightseeing trip to Sydney. It is central to all local attractions - the Rocks, Harbour, Opera etc. Excellent value for a city centre hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the pictures”
Reviews.Author: BobWinck
Reviews.Content: I booked the Travelodge based on the location and 4 star rating. The Travelodge is located in a perfect position to allow an easy walk to both wharfs and all attractions. Unfortunately, the hotel was in terrible condition. It appears to have been built in the 50's and has not been renovated since. The rugs are original and look. like they have never been cleaned. The bed is basically a cheap hard box. There weren't even any drapes in the room. It took three rooms before we found one we could breath in. The first smelled of rancid food and vomit. They moved us to another that smelled of stale smoke (even though the hotel is non smoking). The third had no odor but felt more like a prison cell than a hotel room. The maids did a good job in that the sheets and bathrooms were kept very clean, but the hotel itself is in serious need of major renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Pauline2795
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night and the hotel is very close to Wynard Station. I arrived at 9.00pm and found the hotel restaurant still open and decided to have my meal there instead of trying to find a restaurant open at that time of the night. The meal was very good and excellent value for money. My room was comfortable and even though it was basic it had everything I required and the bathroom was huge. I had a very peaceful night's sleep and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a good stay”
Reviews.Author: ahallnz
Reviews.Content: Next to Wynard makes its easy to get to for tourists. Rooms were comfortable and staff were friendly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: abnpat
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed with my mother at the Travelodge in a twin suite. Having stayed in Sydney many times previously in other hotels, I really liked the location of the Travelodge it was a short walk to both the Rocks area aswell as the Pitt st Mall. Our room was comfortable, but perhaps a bit dated though if you don't plan to spend much time in the hotel this isn't really an issue! Our only problem was a very loud noise which came from the air vent in the room but this problem was rectifyed for us on the second day and that night was fairly quiet considering our location right in the heart of the city! Overall I would reccommend this hotel if you just wanted somewhere comfortable to sleep and weren't to concerened about luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Overall hotel clean, central and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: carolinerooke42
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Travelodge Wynyard for 5 nights on the first leg of our Australia trip. The location was great â€“ right by the Wynyard train station which provided direct links to the airport and other places such as Bondi junction for shopping. The breakfast was OK, although we only paid for continental and that is what our booking said, we were entitled to have full breakfast. Breakfast did get very busy very early so you may struggle for a seat some of the time. Darling Harbour was about a 15 minute walk away, Sydney Opera House about a 15 minute walk in the other direction. Taxiâ€™s were available outside and were frequent. Deinately recommend the Meat & Wine Co. Restaurant in Darling harbour. Hotel was simple which is what you would expect for the price and accommodated us very well as we arrived at 5am and although check in wasnâ€™t until 3pm, they had our room waiting for us (I emailed in advance and asked if we could have early check in â€“ our travel agent said we should really pay for the room the night before in order to get early check in but we decided to risk it!) We went to Manly Beach on the ferry where they had a food and wine festival, visited Bondi Junction for shopping (the biggest shopping centre I have seen in my life), went to the aquarium, walked the Old town streets and along from Darling Harbour to the Opera House, went to the botanical gardens and walked the length of the Harbour Bridge (was planning on doing a bridge climb, but for the price and the weather at the time we went we decided against it.) Overall hotel clean, central and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location but don't bother with the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: JEHSskibumsuk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located for Sydney's major sites; we did the walking tour recommended by Lonely Planet easily from this starting point, and Circular Quay is about a 10 minute walk away. Its also about 30 metres walk from the train station, so very convenient in terms of travelling to/from the airport. The staff were very helpful and the room was quiet and comfortable; perfect for a three night city break. We ate in the restaurant one of the nights but the food was very average- there is a Japanese noodle restaurant next door with outside seating (with patio heaters) and limited space inside which serves lovely food, and there is a Starbucks nearby for coffees. The breakfast seemed over-priced so we didn't bother - there are better, cheaper options. There is also a food court situated near to the hotel which was great for lunch. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again !”
Reviews.Author: TwistyBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in Sydney Travelodge Wynyard Hotel. Booked room through expedia online for just over $ 100 per night for a double. We had 3 adults travelling so extra $ 40 per night for the 3rd Adult. Room was clean & comfortable. Bathroom a little small and outdated but still fine. The sofa pulled out for a single bed however I have stayed at places that have a much thicker mattress for the rollaway bed, maybe better for a child rather than an adult. Location was perfect, as we stayed mostly mid week we could grab some cheap eats of a afternoon from food courts accross the road. Handy to the train station Wynyard and one stop via train to circular quay, short walk to Darling Harbour etc. Did not use restaurant as mostly eating on the go. Would stay again just for the location close to most things.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service was very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: bekmac
Reviews.Content: Two girlfriends and I went to Sydney for the weekend to see a concert, and had booked a mystery room on Wotif, with a bedding configuration of two singles (assuming, perhaps incorrectly, that having paid the extra fee for the third person, they would put us in a triple room with three single beds). We ended up at Travelodge, which in terms of location was perfect. After arriving to check in, we went up to our room and discovered that our room had two double beds only. After ringing reception a number of times to sort this out, we did eventually move rooms, but not before confusion with reception, the housekeeping staff (who came to the door and asked us if we were checking out - apparently code for 'did you want to move rooms?'), and the room was pleasant enough. However, I was made to feel like I had personally ruined the day of all the front of house staff. There was no understanding, apology or decent customer service by the staff at all. Apparently, the hotel was 'fully booked' for the night (but who knows if it really was), however there was no comment such as 'we are fully booked, but we are doing what we can to make your stay comfortable', which would have gone a long way. In the end, this in no way affected my stay at the hotel, but it was disappointing that the staff of a so-called 4 star hotel do not understand the meaning of customer service. Unless I book a mystery hotel from Wotif and end up there again, it is definitely not a place I would choose to stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the money and great location”
Reviews.Author: DizzyScot
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nicely located, easy walking distance to Circular Quay and the Opera House, as well as Darling Harbour. The rooms were perfectly acceptable, although not the nicest I have ever stayed in. I was expecting this, so was still quite happy. Our room was clean, but perhaps in need of a refurb. We paid about Â£60 a night which is far less than most places in Sydney so that was a big factor in us deciding to stay here. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a reasonably priced place to stay in a great location in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “A basic hotel for a quick stopover. The...”
Reviews.Author: ShaneMcDonald
Reviews.Content: A basic hotel for a quick stopover. The hotel itself is clean and in a great location only 2 mins from a train station and 15 mins walk from Circular Quays. The rooms are big but basic. No shower gel or hand towels but they did give us an extra shampoo & bath towel instead. Rooms are quiet & warm. It felt a bit hostel-ish rather than hotel-ish. Overall nice but not my cup of tea. Good points, bright , good location , big rooms. Bad points, bathrooms could have been better stocked / serviced.

Reviews.Title: “very budget -not 4 star- rooms small and cramped”
Reviews.Author: allyson360
Reviews.Content: Pretty icky. Not a 4 star hotel...really disappointed. Stay for budget and not comfort. Good location but miserable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Walls too thin x2”
Reviews.Author: AU_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Changed my booking from Rydges to Travelodge purely due to price (only $105/night via Hotel Club), as I just wanted a clean cheap hotel to sleep in...Our first impression of the room was wow what a great deal...but after the first night that went out the window as we didn't get any sleep! The hotel is in a handy location, the rooms are clean and modern but if you need a good nights sleep forget it. Isn't that what hotels are supposed to provide...a clean, quiet and comfortable place to sleep? The walls are so thin you can hear everything in the room next door, impossible to sleep. We stayed three nights and every night we were kept awake from the people in the rooms either side of us, and you could hear people in the corridor. You can also hear every noise from the bathrooms around your room, showers, toilets and all the other bathroom noises you don't need to hear. I also booked a queen bed room and was put into a double bed room, after reception tried to tell me the bed was definitely a queen size they moved us to a king room (two singles pushed together). IMHO this hotel is only worth the $105/night certainly no more, probably fine if you are a heavy sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Location...but not without issues”
Reviews.Author: coro35
Reviews.Content: This place is great to stay because it is close to Wynyard station, which makes it pretty easy to travel either by train or bus. But it is very basic. It is certainly not 4 star. We wanted a couple of bowls and a spoon sent up to our room but were told to go down to the restaurant and get it ourselves or we would be charged room service! I did that, and it's not a hassle but you pay for service! As I was travelling with my daughter we wanted twin beds rather than a double. This didn't seem to be a hassle. But we were put on floor 22 and the lift stops at 21 so we had to climb about 20 steepish steps to get to our room, I have added photos of the stair well. In the night there was a continuing sound of machinery, which I think was probably either the lift, the air conditioner or the water system. It was not very annoying except when you were awake. I asked to be moved and there was no problem. we packed up our stuff and they shifted us to another room. Which was fine but we couldn't control the air conditioning. . Didn't matter too much but I wondered what it would be like if it was hot (remembering this was winter in Australia) Internet access was bizarrely expensive It seemed to be pretty busy. I suspect this is because it's modestly priced. Travelodge make a point of advertising "Why pay for your room when your never there?" It's a good question So I have mixed feelings. Bed was clean. Two supermarkets nearby (Coles and Woolworths) not far into town and safe district. No pool, which is a pity

Reviews.Title: “Still the Greatest Value”
Reviews.Author: nomadMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Couldn't go past the Travelodge Wynyard again when we visited due to a fantastic $95 a night standard room rate. As usual the room was impeccably clean and spacious except for a tiny bathroom. This time however, the stuffiness of the room at night was uncomfortable. Despite having the heating "off" warmth still eminates and creates that sauna effect - alright if you suffer from the cold but a bit stifling for me. Location is a sightseeing dream with everything a pleasant stroll or quick train ride away. Don't do breakfast there tho, instead try the "Barramundi" cafe. As you come out of the hotel its to your left, up the hill and across York st. A fantastic freshly cooked breakfast for under $10

Reviews.Title: “Good location and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: surrideo
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my three day stay at this hotel. The location is great for exploring Sydney. It is just across the road from Wynyard station (buses and trains) and within reasonable walking distance of tourist destinations such as Circular Quay and Darling Harbour. My room was clean, modern and comfortable. The staff that I met were friendly and helpful. I thought this was a very good choice for the price and I would stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and comfy stay”
Reviews.Author: coolestbabe88
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a good location. it is a short walk to attractions but what do you expect for the price. if you want to sit right upon the sights pay the price! The travelodge wa great, 15 minutes to most sights and quite enjoyable walks. the hotel rooms are excellent. Nice big rooms, fab shower/toilet room. tea and coffe available in the room. the staff were very helpful, our remote for the tv wasnt working, with a few hours this was sorted with no hassle. Great hotel for a great price. look around for deals as we got 4 for 3 plus breakfast thrown in.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok but not the location”
Reviews.Author: albm7
Reviews.Content: Location of hotel is ok if your there for business but not so good for sightseeing, It is close to Wynyard train station but not much else. Is stuck in no mans land 15mins walk to the rocks / harbour and about the same to Darling Harbour. Staff not that helpfull, rooms ok but they do not compare to say Travelodge in Melbourne for size.

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge Wynyard Hotel Sydney change room's price casually ! awful !”
Reviews.Author: kong94
Reviews.Content: I have lived in the hotel two times in 2008,because one Chinese travel agency recommended it ,i often come to Sydney ,but my english is not good,i hope find a familiar hotel .This time I arrived at the hotel on Jun 19 Saturday 2010,I payed two days $192 and$124,two days later,I told the reception staff that I wanted to keep staying the hotel for 4 days,and asked him how much money per day,the staff informed me to pay total $496,and told me $124per day,I thought the price was reasonale because the days which i would live were from Monday to Thursday ,not on Weekend.To my greatly surprised,Friday morning ,when I checked out at the reception,one staff gave me a detailed list that I should pay another $272 ,and on the list $192 every day ! I was furious with the behaviour,the staff hurrily went in to one room discussed with the duty manager, the manager wasnot ready to give up,I had to hurry to airport,and to help me,that day ,my friend went to hotel find the duty manager,he was willing to get half of $272,my friend didnot want to be in a tangle,finally payed him $100,and the new list changed written different price :from Mondy to Thursday $112 ,$192,$100,$192.I hope related department supervise and inspect the hotel .thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: JulieSTL1978
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night at Travelodge Wynyard on our last night of our two week journey through Australia, and were very pleased with our stay. While we were in Sydney during the first leg of our trip, we had stayed at the Travelodge Sydney. Since we were pleased with Travelodge, we decided to stay at the Wynyard for our last night. The location was perfect. Only a short walk to most major Sydney sites! Like our previous Travelodge stay, this room was also clean, spacious, and comfortable. The bathroom was a bit small, but still manageable. The room was also a little noisier, due to it's downtown location, but it wasn't awful! We still slept well and were pleased to have a king sized bed.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy, comfortable, good location”
Reviews.Author: rickpow
Reviews.Content: Relatively big, comfortable, quiet rooms. Circular Quay is just a short walk away. We didn't eat at the hotel -- we usually bought food at nearby markets for breakfast in the room. The location seems to cater to the business crowd, so a lot of nearby places close for the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryWill
Reviews.Content: We just stayed one night when we first arrived from overseas. The room was not ready yet, so the staff recommended that we change in the fitness centre on the top floor (great views from there). They held our bags while we went for a tour around town. This is really close to everything, and just 1 block from the train from the airport. While not a fancy room, it had all the basics, was clean. Just a 10 min walk from circular quay or from Darling Harbour area, or monorail. Right in business area, so lots of reasonable restaurants nearby, not tourist traps.

Reviews.Title: “Well located mid-range accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Gat16
Reviews.Content: This mid-range hotel is well located and we thought we got good value. While the immediate vicinity is fairly bland, itâ€™s only a few blocks walk to Circular Quay, the Rocks precinct and QV Building (and the other main shopping areas). Darling Harbour is reasonably accessible, too. The room was fine and everything was clean. Although the bathroom wasn't really generous in size, it was OK. The staff at reception were helpful and there were enough of them even though they were busy at times. We didn't eat in the hotel, and noticed there was a food court just down the road in Margaret Street. Itâ€™s very close to Wynyard station, but if youâ€™re coming on the train from the airport with baggage, make sure you use the York Street exit, which has an escalator that exits just down the street from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Edward4Ausy
Reviews.Content: I did not think the hotel was that well located as many other fellow travels on this forum did. It's a steep walk to and from Circular Quay and even longer walks to other attractions. Its great that its across the road from the train station but not great that there arnt too many restaurants in the area. The hotel itself is nice and clean but I did not find the reception staff that helpful and there was even a guy who could hardly speak English. But then again I did pay only $101 per night so I cant really complain. I think it's a hotel more suited to business people than tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a central location”
Reviews.Author: nzers
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at this hotel with my teenage daughter. Booked direct with Travelodge.com.au on a Tuesday and got a special rate of A4144 per night excluding breakfast. Compared to other hotels in the CBD this was a bargain. We caught the train from the international airport and arrived at the Wynyard Station within 25 minutes. The hotel is only a couple of hundred metres from the station exit which is extremely convenient when using public transport with luggage. Found the reception staff to be extremely friendly and helpful. I had booked a standard room at the cheapest rate and found we had been upgraded to a suite. Yay! Our room was on the second floor facing York St so it wasn't particularly quiet (I always travel with earplugs so the street noise didn't bother me). We had a queen size bed, a sofabed, kitchenette with mircrowave, fridge, sink and dining table and the room was much larger than the standard rooms. It would have been more than adequate if our family of four were staying here. Bathroom amenities were minimal (I'm a sucker for all those little bottles :-)) but it was clean and functional. Airconditioning was a little touchy but did the job adequately. We used the internet in the annex off the foyer which cost $2 for 15 minutes. There were loungers in here also for meeting with friends and a concierge during the day who was happy to advise on restaurants, shopping, transport etc. We ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant which was pricey for what was offered (but I knew that from previous reviews) but it suited us and it was more than adequate. The location was fantastic! We walked to the Rocks, Darling Harbour and Pitt St mall in minutes and when we needed to catch a bus to the Northern Beaches, the bus stop was across the street. Unless you must have the 5* service and facilities (and wish to pay for it) I would recommend this hotel and will definately stay here again. ** We also stayed at the Old Sydney Holiday Inn for 1 night at the end of our trip and I have posted a review.

Reviews.Title: “Central location in middle of Sydney city; convenient walking to major sights; access to extensive public transport”
Reviews.Author: Chelydra
Reviews.Content: Stay at this hotel for its central location in the middle of the city of Sydney, convenient walking to major sights and facilities, and access to extensive public transport taking you to other places of interest. Do not expect any sort of memorable view from your room, as the hotel is surrounded by other high-rise buildings. If you intend using public transport extensively for sightseeing, before you leave Sydney airport find out details about the various types and durations of TravelPass. We found the information counter at the end of the arrivals concourse often had a long queue. If you go downstairs where you buy train tickets, you can also obtain information from posters and from the ticket sellers. We found our TravelPass very useful, as it gave us unlimited access to regular trains, buses and ferries which covered everywhere that we wanted to go and saved us money in the process. Note that travelling to and from the airport terminals involved special fares (expensive given the short distances). Once you arrive at Wynyard underground station and pass through the exit from the platforms, leave by the escalators leading up to York St. At the top entrance, you will see a park facing you. Turn left and walk to Margaret Street. Cross over and continue about 50 feet. The Travelodge entrance will be to your left. About 10 feet to the right of the steps leading up to the reception counter you can find a recessed ramp for wheeling up your bags instead of having to lug them up the stairs. To the right of reception is the hotel restaurant and to the left a lounge area with computers providing Internet access. The lifts-elevators are to the left of reception and opposite the lounge area. Reception staff were polite and cooperative; social skills varied with the individual we encountered. Robert was especially pleasant, and Manuel of maintenance was responsive to our need for the replacement of a defective bedside lamp. Housekeeping on the 7th floor provided us with sugar when we ran out prematurely. When we stayed, use of Internet access using computers in the lounge area was $2 per 15 minutes. Use of an Internet connection in a room was $11 per hour, $22 per 24 hours, and $66 per week. If you donâ€™t mind a 10- to 15-minute walk, you can obtain free Internet access for 20-minute periods in the basement level of the Macquarie Street wing of the New South Wales State Public Library. Leave bags and accessories in free electronically operated lockers just outside the basement entrance. We found library staff pleasant, helpful and cooperative. The hotel has 22 stories. Each floor with accommodation has about 15 rooms with lifts at one end and the room numbers starting and finishing at this end. Quieter rooms are at the end of the corridor away from the lifts-elevators. Up to the 16th or 18th stories (depending on the room location along the corridor), the back rooms face a blank wall or the windows of an office building about 20-30 feet away. To have a view of sorts (mainly of other high-rise buildings), you will need a room facing York Street. At the time of our stay a desk clerk told us that rooms above the 12th floor cost more. On the 21st floor you can find a gym, shower and laundry room with two washers and two dryers (each $2 per load). Of acceptable size and with a table and two chairs plus a sofa, our room was adequate for sleeping and showering, and for leaving our luggage while we went out sightseeing. It also had a bar refrigerator with a small ice cube tray (the hotel did not have a public ice machine available), and tea- and coffee-making facilities. Beds were comfortable and the closet contained two extra pillows. There was good closet space with 12 hangers, a room safe and a bureau with two deep drawers. The air conditioning worked well, and you could darken the room during daytime if required. Phone calls from the room had an 80-cent connection fee added, including those considered toll free. One item of printed information in the room that we would have found useful would have been a list of all the services and facilities offered by the hotel and in its immediate vicinity. The windows had single glazing, so the noise of traffic and sirens clearly entered the room; however, it did not bother us particularly. Soundproofing between rooms was adequate â€” only if other occupants restrained themselves, and did not yell conversations or bang furniture doors and drawers. We could hear the flow of water occurring in the shower of the adjoining rooms, but it was not particularly bothersome. We could hear voices from other guests in the corridor, as the door frames did not have a seal or buffers to dampen noise from doors banging or others talking. We had a problem with nighttime party-goers, but this was our bad luck. When the rowdy occupants of the next room turned up at 2:30 a.m. from a night out on the town, someone from staff at reception came up in person immediately and told them in no uncertain terms to quieten down or the hotel would evict them. Hooray! They and their cronies were not the only guests on the floor. In the middle of the small park between York Street and Carrington Street, you can see a dome. Under it is a Sydney bus office Transit Shop which has racks with bus timetables and routes. Ask at the inquiry window for free comprehensive network maps â€” of which there are four â€” one each for the northern, southern, eastern and western regions. We found them useful for getting to places not served by the train system. There is a small Coles supermarket at Wynyard and another at 388 George Street â€” both listed as open till midnight every day, except Saturday (then till 10 p.m.). We used the Woolworth supermarket at the corner of Park and George streets across the road from Town Hall, also open till midnight most nights. If possible, avoid buying from small convenience stores. As almost everywhere, you will pay a lot extra for whatever you buy there. A good place to eat in Chinatown is in an inconspicuous food court at the top-left of Dixon street (lined with restaurants and touts). It has numerous counters with a range of vendors serving various Asian cuisines, freshly cooked at very reasonable prices. You can eat there for several days and always have something quite different. Well worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “central location”
Reviews.Author: mac1CrieffScotland
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in Sydney staying here. Very good central location, within easy walking distance of Darling Harbour at one end and Circular Quay at the other. Twin room had plenty of space, breakfast good, staff helpful. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but needs a makeover”
Reviews.Author: arabinblack
Reviews.Content: Good location with easy access to the Circular Quay, Opera House etc. Room was fairly basic and could certainly do with being given a bit of a makeover as it is looking a bit tired, especially the bathroom. Breakfast was a bit pricey for what was on offer and there are plenty other places to eat close to the hotel, especially on weekdays.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: blott
Reviews.Content: Hotel excellent all round,everything to see are all within walking distance,

Reviews.Title: “Dont STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: blogger1
Reviews.Content: i recommended my very important overseas friends to stay at the "problemlodge" I have made few mistakes in my life and this was a big one. They were very rudely met at front desk and questioned over a period of 3 days if they were guests and had to show proof. This was embarrissing for them as they are from Korea and you dont get treated like that. There was a door man behind hes desk on the28Th of March who should be fired he over stepped hes authority and acted like he was a cop. DO NOT STAY HERE YOU GET BETTER SERVICE IN THE MCDONALDS DOWN THE ROAD

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Geamz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights as it is a great base for exploring Sydney. Much better than you'd expect from a Travelodge, Great location, right next to train station which makes the commute from the airport easy and cheap. Rooms were fairly large and modern and clean. There is a gym and laundry facilities, which was a bonus that we were not expecting. Good price for such a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: addmore
Reviews.Content: Smallest bathroom I've come across but the room was clean (big plus!) and comfortable and of course a fantastic location. Train from the airport to Wynyard station was easy and it was only a few minutes walk to the hotel from the station. I paid $405 for two nights and got the third night free. Pretty expensive for basic accommodation but I guess you're paying for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: tinzaroo
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. Easy to walk to Circular Quay, Darling Harbour, Stay City Casino. Very close to the Wynyard Train Station, and lots of little cafes with great coffee are open on the weekdays (give Starbucks a miss in favour of these little cafes!!). Great pubs nearby too :o) Easy to walk to QVB where there is fantastic shopping!! Check it out for sure. The Strand is also great for shopping. The hotel staff were super friendly and the room was clean, airy and bright. Towels were changed daily, mini bar was checked and replenished. The lifts were a bit annoying at checkout time though - one lift was out and it was a looong wait! However that's such a minor thing. I would definitely stay here again, absolutely no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: tiredtravellerSydney
Reviews.Content: great rooms, we had an adjoining room which fit us all in one space staff were great. the location was central and taxi's were easy to get out side the front of the hotel. prices were reasonable. i wouldn't hesitate to reccommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Would definatley stay again!”
Reviews.Author: kbow9154
Reviews.Content: fantastic hotel, friendly helpful staff! have already booked my next stay at Travelodge Wynyard. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very weel equipt hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarah L
Reviews.Content: For a Travelodge this is a great hotel. You get far more than you expect ! There is parking underground (approx AUS$10 a day but this is first come first serve but there is always plenty of space). There are tea and coffee making facilities in the room, a very good do it yourself laundry service with powder available to buy at reception. Clean and comfortable rooms, you can hear a bit of street noise at night but then you are in a city. Don't have the breakfast there though because although i'm sure it is very good there is an even better cafe opposite called 'Barramundi cafe' that everyone stops at on the way to work, they will cook anything you want, eggs, bacon, mushrooms whatever, they also do lovely banana bread to eat in or take away, you sit out on the street or the little back yard bit, a really nice little cafe obviously doing a very good trade. This hotel is in a great location, very near to bridge, harbour, rocks and shopping the other way

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: JaimeL_10
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed with the tiny room as soon as we walked in. The aircon, shower, bathroom door, and other things didn't work. Woke up the first night with welts over my entire body and saw little bugs crawling in my sheets. When I contacted reception, they brought someone up to the room to look for bedbugs, and found a heap of them in the mattress. Was moved to an equally disappointing room, and wasn't given a refund.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,Basic Hotel”
