Reviews.Author: lizzyloulou
Reviews.Content: if you have stayed in a Travelodge then you should know what to expect.this hotel is in a great location, within 10 min walk to the harbor and opera house. not to far to the main shopping area and plenty of eating places within minutes walk. the hotel is clean,basic and could do with mini refurb,didnt eat in their restaraunt as we thought it pricey and didnt appeal. lnternet access available in the lobby area ,you may need to wait to use. overall a good base to drop your bags and explore.

Reviews.Title: “great location but place needs improvements”
Reviews.Author: OntarioTravellers2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a decent price in comparison to what we heard others were paying during the same time frame. It was in an excellent location. We were on the 17th floor and traffic noise was still an issue. Housekeeping was substandard and the room was very tired looking and was in need of refurbishing including the bed

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable accomadation, nothing outstanding, noisy traffic”
Reviews.Author: rawlings42
Reviews.Content: Arrived late evening and checked in no problems, staff polite and helpful. Rooom was on the 11th floor at the front of the hotel, apparently the executive rooms are the front !!!!! the main let down was single glazed windows which let the noise from the street below straight through at all times, also the window openers were wedged tighter closed by packed cardboard. Room was OK reasonable location was 10n mins away from circular quay, and not too far from other shopping areas. Wynard station about 50yards away. Breakfast for us was included and was buffet style hot or cold, plenty of choice to start the day off well. Check out was fine , reasonable hotel , not the best on our multi stop holiday but acceptable for a room to sleep in, basic ammenities

Reviews.Title: “Well Located”
Reviews.Author: Ringy67
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is we ll situated with Circular quay (water taxis andSydney Opera house), Sydney Tower, Darling Harbour and the monorail all within easy walking distance. The citylink railstation was just down the road My Room in the hotel was reasonably sized and the conditioning worked well. There was very little street noice. On the downside the room decor was very drab with grey colouring. The bathroom had seen better days and could do with being repainted but nothing drastically wrong The minibar as usual was expensive but you can obtain chilled soft drinks and snacks for a lot less from the vending machines on the 21st Floor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but innacurate advertising.”
Reviews.Author: mikecar52
Reviews.Content: Tv supposed to have foxtel for free, skynews, 3 sports channels and channel 8 is what we got and some fm radio stations, not even basic foxtel, N o free to air digital channels just the analog. 3 movie channels at $15.95 a movie. $20 for continental breakfast. $14.50 supposed to be starting price for evening meals in the restaurant. True but only one course at that price then up to around $20 for the next and upwards. $410 for 3 nights stay with no meals in a standard bedroom suite. Air conditioned, TV, bar fridge and kettle, free milk, coffee and tea. Nice staff, clean place but next time we will stay in a 3 star cheapie. It won't be much different.

Reviews.Title: “wot a mistake”
Reviews.Author: wottafeeling
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel through Wotif, as a mystery deal, four stars guaranteed they (wotif) trumpeted. When we checked in we were told by the woman (girl) on the desk that we had been allotted a room with no bathroom or toilet!, "this sometimes happens with one-nighters, as they only decide the room the day before. I reminded her we were there for 2 nights and had booked and paid 1 month ahead.! she then agreed to give us a proper room. the room and service were quite good. the day before we were due to leave, we booked and paid for the shuttle bus service to the airport, for 12 noon. we had a good, and reasonably priced meal that night which we had billed to our room. on checking out today 17/feb/2010, we were presented with our bill for the extras incurred, ie. the meal. fair enough, but they also tried to charge for 2 nights parking, $60.00, when we didn't even have our car with us!. it pays to be vigilant......! ok, all that was taken care of, so we dutifully presented ourselves out the front of the hotel at 11:55, so as not to miss our airport shuttle, at 12:15, my wife went in to check on it's progress, guess what?, that's right they didn't make the booking...... just took the cash. whilst they managed to get us on the next bus it didn't do much to help our stress levels, as we were trying to keep to a schedule.

Reviews.Title: “Very overpriced and very tired!!”
Reviews.Author: We2downunder09
Reviews.Content: Although we were staying in Sydney for NYE and realised that accomodation would be expensive, we were charged Â£220 p. n. for a 3 night stay, this Travelodge is completely overpriced. We reserved online back in March and because of favourable exchange rates at the time, wanted to exchange funds there and then. Travelodge told us that their payment policy did not allow forward payment. About 2 weeks before our intended stay and whilst we were in Australia, we received a an e-mail, confirming that the charge would be taken (without our authorisation) from our credit card details that we had supplied at time of reservation. This really annoyed us, as because of the weaker Â£ our 3 nights actually cost us about Â£100 more!!! Upon arrival we were assigned a room that we stayed in for 1 night. It smelt musty, the carpet in the corridor outside was heavily stained, our room was not that clean either, there were hairs on sanitaryware from previous occupants and holes in bed linen. We immediately complained about a broken kettle and the smell, we were given a second hand kettle, some air fresheners and our bedding was changed. However the smell lingered all through the first night and we complained again the folowing morning. The duty manager agreed as a complimentary gesture to upgrade us to an executive room and offer complimentary breakfast, this we agreed to, but expected an executive room to have some style to it!! In fact although we lost the musty smell, the only difference between the 2 rooms was a mini bar (which obviously cost money) The breakfast experience was not great either. The food lacked presentation and quality , the staff lacked any sort of finesse or style. We were hurried away from our table and the food was literally thrown onto the buffet bar. On the up side (if there is one) the hotel although not having harbour views, is superbly centrally located. To summarise, we would not stay there again, as we feel that the fiasco over our reservation payment was completely out of order and the hotel needs a complete shake up and severe renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: KathM85
Reviews.Content: I stayed here whilst in Sydney with a group for the Edinburgh Military Tattoo. The staff went over and above the call of duty to ensure our stay was a happy one. The hotel is situated in an ideal location and the food is great. The rooms are looking a little bit tired however they are a good size (the bathrooms are slim).

Reviews.Title: “Great value, superb location!”
Reviews.Author: poppypumpkin
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel after reading the recommendations on tripadvisor, I'm glad we did as this hotel had everything we needed for a city break in Sydney. The room was light and spacious and very quiet. We didn't pay for a bed for our 6 year old but when we arrived we had a double and a single bed! Wynyard train station is about 2 minutes down the road, George Street is about 5 minutes walk away and the Rocks is about 10 minutes walk away. We walked home from darling harbour twice and it was about a 25min walk but very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has seen better days, but its location makes it value if you get a discount rate.”
Reviews.Author: HRG94
Reviews.Content: Not wanting to travel back to the suburbs after a planned night on the town with friends, we ended up at the Travelodge Wynyard after choosing a discount "mystery" hotel from wotif.com. The "mystery" hotel seemed a bargain - a claimed 4 star hotel for a little over $100. After our brief experience with this hotel we felt that the price we paid was still reasonable value given the inner city location, but that if you go expecting a 4 star experience you will probably be underwhelmed. Our room was neat and relatively clean, but smelt slightly musty. The corridors on our floor were narrow and definitely looked like they had seen better days. As we were simply using the room as a place to sleep after a night out and left as soon as we woke the next morning, we didn't use any of the hotel facilities. We had very little interaction with the staff, but the one staff member we asked for advice re: bus stops and bus travel was friendly and helpful If you can get this hotel on a discount rate and value location over luxury, then you might want to put this hotel on your list of possible places. stay.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID - Stolen ring and poor rooms”
Reviews.Author: LondonDuncan
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was good value in a good location. However that is where the good points end. On the first morning we were there my partner left a Tiffany ring in the bathroom, which had been stolen by the time we got back later in the afternoon. We reported the theft immediately and the duty manager informed us that all the cleaners had gone for the day but they would deal with it in the morning. We heard nothing the next day and when we checked with reception were told that the note on the system said that there was 'never a ring in the room'. After speaking to the manager they informed us they would check the lock log and CCTV. When we returned that evening we were informed by another duty manager that they had questioned the cleaner and that they didn't think the ring had been stolen as the cleaner 'had worked there a long time', basically accusing us of not telling the truth. We spoke to the actual manager the next day and he had exactly the same attitude! All in all it was a terrible first stay there but at luck would have it we ended up back there via a 'secret hotel' deal online that could not be cancelled. This time we would not let anyone in the room so nothing was taken but the room itself was very poor for the price. I have attached a picture of the bathroom ceiling. I would avoid this place at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money!”
Reviews.Author: Birdistheword
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four days in the beginning of january and we were content with our stay. The rooms were nice and clean. Nothing fancy but not disappointing either. The location was good and we were pleased to find laundry facilities for the hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “bargain hotel in an excellant location”
Reviews.Author: Janebow
Reviews.Content: The travelodge wynyard was my first point of call in australia as a solo traveller. i was young and a little out of my depth when i first arrived but the staff made me feel safe and welcome. the computer and internet area was a god send. the rooms were fine, great value for money. the food is ok, but there are many other options near by. the starbucks next to the hotel was handy. the hotel is ideally located with a ten minute walk to the harbour and many of sydneys attractions. darling harbour is also within walking distance but many would probably prefer to take another mode of transport as it is quite a long way. after touring, i actually returned back to this hotel for my last few nights in australia as it was safe, friendly and a brilliant bargain!

Reviews.Title: “don't stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Juju00
Reviews.Content: Only the location is good. Rooms need some refurbishement. Staff unfriendly. We asked for a non smoking room but they give us a smoking room, when we asked to change the room because of the smoke, they told us we have to pay a extra fee for that. Just one towel in the room. We booked the parking for all days of our stay, but it was not available every day. And at the end of our stay however they tried to charge us the parking for 4 days, even if we parked only 2 days because the other days it was full!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: djrum13
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 11am and were told our room was only a hour away! We were please to get in earlier than t2pm! The bedding configuaration was perfect for us. A Queen sized bed & a single bed. Rooms are a little on the smaller side, but was okay for a two night stay. There was no where to put your luggage though, so we ended up putting them on the desk and chairs. We had booked three people and only had two towels and no handtowel. Room was clean though The hotel is within walking distance of Circular Quay, alot of dining options, public transport & shopping! On checkout their were three recpetion staff on who were not assisting anyone, so we asked them to call us a taxi. We apparently had to wait for the porter, who was assisting about three people with bags. We tracked down a phone number and called on ourselves. The porter was already overworked as it was.

Reviews.Title: “Would Never Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: crazycanadiancanada
Reviews.Content: I would never stay here again. We checked in and even though we had booked a double, some how manged to end up with 2 single beds. The front desk were extremely unhelpful and we were told that the hotel was booked up for the days we were staying there for and they could not do anything about it. The location is not far from Central Station which was convient. The next day when I asked the front desk for directions, she started to get me a map and then started to help other people. As if she forgot I was still standing there waiting for help. We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good location, poor staff manners”
Reviews.Author: ranger054
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be in an ideal situation for the harbour etc. As we met up with other friends for brunch every day we had only orange juice, coffee and toast early morning and also ate there on all but one evening as it was convenient. On the last morning of our stay I was horrified to see a commotion at my table and everyone looking at my friend as the girl in charge was telling her in loud tones that she wasn't to drink the juice as we weren't entitled to it. Humiliated doesn't cover how we felt, the guy who had been in charge on the other days was off that day, left a survey with the desk for the manager but needless to say have heard not a word from him. When we checked we had everything when packing we found a pair of plastic thong sandals under one of the beds!!, What a pity as it just took the shine off the stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Businesswomen travelling alone beware”
Reviews.Author: superbusinesschick
Reviews.Content: If you're female, travelling alone on business, security is a big feature. At the Travelodge Wynyard, where things go bump in the night and the room is noisy and often smelly, you have the added attraction of (male) housekeeping staff waking you up at 7.30am by helpfully letting themselves into your room. How does this happen? A tiny knock at the door was followed in a nanosecond by the door opening without so much as a 'housekeeping', 'mini bar' whatever. A frightening and appalling situation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: SpikeDaisy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights and really enjoyed our stay. Fantastic value for location and quality. The location of the hotel is pretty ideal...it's next to the metro station so you can quickly get to other destinations and is within walking distance of Darling Harbour. Make sure to try Longrain while you are in Sydney, excellent Thai restaurant that has the best cocktails ever!

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay just OK , but Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: aussierover
Reviews.Content: Stayed previously for one night in May 08(see past review), so was interested to see if many changes. Our room was on York street 8th floor, a bit noisy from the traffic (double glazing needed) and this time noticed more noise from other guests, but not a major problem. Room renovations starting to look a little shabby around the edges already. The one problem my husband encountered was with the TV remote control. He likes to fall asleep watching TV and the control would only work when the (old) TV was manually switched on and could only be switched off by getting out of bed and manually turning it off!! We mentioned it to reception 3 times, but were met with a smile and told they were in the process of changing to flat screen TVs and there was nothing they could do,"most of the TVs are like that" Only a minor issue really, but NOT GOOD ENOUGH! On a better note, the small fitness centre was well equipped and everything appeared in working order. We paid $A526 for 5 nights (breakfast $25 extra) which was ok, but would be a rip off at the full rates.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: AndrewM11
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, housekeeping was a little slow until I spoke to them. Location is problematic, close to Sydney's financial district. This means lots of lunch places, nothing for dinner. The rocks and ferries are close but at the bottom of the hill, I didn't see too much to like in the rocks, too many boutiques, not much else. The most convenient feature is the nearby Wynyard Cityrail station, however local fares are high. The lobby restaurant is expensive, but OK.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value; excellent location”
Reviews.Author: maestrolms
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five days, having found the original recommendations on TA. My room was on the 19th floor, with a nice city view, and was of a reasonable size. Everything was clean and well-kept; the daily cleaning lady was outstanding. Staff members at the Reception Desk were always friendly and helpful, especially one who was seven months' pregnant! I ate dinner the first evening at the hotel and found the meal to be tasty and fairly priced. The location is EXCELLENT, being less than a block from the Wynyard Underground station, which provides convenient access to all areas of the city and 20-minute trips to the airport. The only mild concern was that the soundproofing could have been a bit better, especially with the adjacent, connected room, but it was not usually a problem. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “If location is what you want this is where to go”
Reviews.Author: dbloke2004
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 days to do you tourist thing and this hotel was in a great central location for all the sights. It is fairly new so the rooms are tidy and clean, if not a bit small. The restaurant looked nice (i didnt eat there though). Service was quite good. Basically, if you are spending most of your time out in the city then this is a great location for transport links and the attractions and it is very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “terrible hospitality and overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: tropicalsunshine87
Reviews.Content: My partner and I got stuck with this hotel after a "Mystery Hotel Deal" on Wotif.com for $130 per night, which promised a quality 4-star hotel - which it sure was not! Firstly, the staff were TERRIBLE. No people skills whatsoever, zero hospitality and the tendency to ignore all requests. On arrival at around 10am, we'd just undergone a long 9 hour overnight bus ride and couldn't wait to shower and sleep.. we were made to wait about 10 minutes at reception - which is a long time standing there while the staff were avoiding eye contact and flicking through files. Finally, when the receptionist did acknowledge us she simply told us the room will not be ready until 12pm. I commented that we'd been on an overnight bus ride and would like a shower, she suggested using the upstairs gym shower, and there should be towels up there - if not, we should go and FIND housekeeping OURSELVES for more towels!!! Skipped the shower, headed into the city to watch a movie and pass time - we got back at around 1pm, and were informed our room was STILL not ready and wouldn't be until at least 2pm - they did NOT offer any sort of complimentary tea, coffee or anything. Room ended up not being ready until 3pm, and not once did anyone apologise. The room was NOT 4-star quality.. it'd be lucky to be 3-stars. Tiny bathroom, no fan, tiny room, no microwave, no bowls, glasses or cutlery and little storage space - basically just a bed and TV. Rip off. We requested some bowls so we could eat our own breakfast in the room rather than spend $25 each a day on their breakfast - the rude receptionist informed us it would be a $5 charge for them just to BRING up the bowls. I said that was ridiculous, and he said I can get them myself then - RUDE and NOT 4-star service!! Adding onto that with the restaurant - extremely expensive - around $25-$35 for basic burgers, pasta and steaks. They did not replenish tea or coffee either, and staff told us if we wanted more, we had to find housekeeping ourselves for more. Internet access is a RIP OFF.. and very slow. To top it all off - on ordering more towels from a receptionist who barely spoke or understood English, they did not arrive after 20 minutes, so I called back, got another receptionist and they were up within 10 minutes.. still a long time to wait for towels. Staff were the rudest I've ever encountered and did not even farewell us nicely or thank us for our business. I will NEVER stay here again - location was not all that great unless you want to be near Darling Harbour.. but rooms are poor for the amount of money you pay, and with the service so terrible, I do not know what you are really paying for. You can find better places around Sydney for this amount of money.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: abc246
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as the price was very good, despite mixed reviews on Tripadvisor. Didn't have any problem with the staff unlike other reviewers. The internet access, both Wi-Fi and in lobby, is extremely expensive. We were unlucky to have a room on the second floor. Very noisy. We had rubbish trucks backing up at all hours and a loud mechanical noise coming from the bathroom one night. Would strongly advise others to stay on higher floors. There is a small gym and laundry on top floor. Restaurant is good but we didn't have breakfast any morning as it was $25 extra each. The hotel is located halfway between city centre and Bay bridge/opera house so fairly central. Only problem is that is surrounded by office buildings so everything closes early and NOTHING is open on Sunday. An okay hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic downtown location, very good value for Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: XHagton
Reviews.Content: My trip to Sydney was enhanced by staying at the Travelodge Wynyard. It is across the street from the Wynyard train station, which makes it extremely easy to get to/from the airport. The station is also a nexus for city buses, which provide a great way to see the city. Finally, if you enjoy walking around a city to see the sights (I do!), this hotel is perfectly located. The staff made an instant happy customer out of me when they allowed me to check in VERY early (my 14-hour flight arrived at 7am), plus they upgraded my room because that's what was available. The experience was 100% positive, and the room rate was actually lower than some dives I saw while exploring Sydney. My room was on the 19th floor so street noise was not a problem and the skyline view was excellent. The photo included with this review is looking out my window.

Reviews.Title: “good central location good value”
Reviews.Author: pots169l
Reviews.Content: Liked the city centre location and very clean and very good value like all Travelodge hotels. Good restaurant and good staff. Restaurant has good selection of meals.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: colin1962
Reviews.Content: This was the third or fourth time we have stayed at this hotel. I have to say it is still an excellent hotel. The location is superb for the price. About 10 minutes walking from the harbour. As other people have said don't be put off by the travelodge name. This hotel is of a much higher quality than the equivlent travelodges in the UK. The rooms are spacious and nice and modern. We were lucky enough to get a view of the city this time. Checkout was 11:00am which was later than most of the other hotels on this trip which seemed to want you out by 10am. Staff were polite and freindly.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room & Value - In the heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Chekodok_Pisang
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and comfortable, but a bit small. The location was superb, only walking distance to the centre of the city, Circular Quay etc., but walking back to the hotel at night can be scary....a bit dark. Nice people at the reception. Coach transfer to the airport was quite reasonable and on time.

Reviews.Title: “If from America - don't think this is like our Travelodges, this is much better than ours.”
Reviews.Author: SenseIntoDollars
Reviews.Content: Nice room. Clean, well equipt, quiet, comfortable, limited views, but right by the wynyard station and airport train, near the rocks and quay, and a bargain rate for early bookings. A great stay for a lot less than the other area hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good, basic hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: dnkholiday
Reviews.Content: If from the UK, don't expect this to be like a UK Travelodge hotels as the rooms are much better. Is in a very good location within a few minutes walking distance of the harbour, Rocks and main shopping area. Wynyard station is less than 50m away so excellent access to airport and public transport links. Starbucks opposite if you want a less expensive / quicker breakfast option. Room was modern, clean and a decent size. Internet in the room expensive at approx 20 AUS dollars a day. Staff were 'UK Travelodge' like - casual but effective.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent room and good value.”
Reviews.Author: Don35
Reviews.Content: The location is great for a easy exploration of downtown Sydney and Circular Quay/The Rocks. Clean and comfortable if a little small. Doesn't feel like 20,000 people have slept in the bed before you. reception staff were helpful and friendly. Our rate was $130 which, for the location, is excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: whoa1225
Reviews.Content: I initially had reservations at The Menzies across the street but after reading some pretty disturbing negative reviews, cancelled those reservations at the last minute and reserved our week's stay at Travelodge Wynyard. I was very impressed by the newly refurbished rooms and even more impressed by the price we paid ($534 USD for one week). Iâ€™m not sure if I would have paid much more for the rooms and I will say that this hotel is perfect for the traveler who is not planning on spending much time in their room and on the hotel property. I completely agree with another reviewer that this place should not be viewed as somewhere to stay-in for cozy evenings but as a handy and well-equipped base for making the most of visiting Sydney. If you want lazy days by a pool or long/fancy indoor dining, go elsewhere. The room was clean and had everything we required for a nice one weekâ€™s stay: refrigerator, hair dryer, a pitcher that made hot water for coffee and tea, in-room safe, comfortable bed and a nicely functioning AC. We could easily walk to the Quay area, Opera House, Darling Harbour, anywhere within the CBD, and The Rocks. The Wynyard Train Station was within a stoneâ€™s throw of the property. It was a slightly longer but definitely doable walk to Chinatown, North Sydney, and Paddington. If you want a clean, friendly, up-to-date room/hotel while in Sydney that is within walking distance of many of the cityâ€™s top spots, I would whole-heartedly recommend Travelodge Wynyard.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- extremely basic accomadations”
Reviews.Author: mightygeo
Reviews.Content: Located 1/2 block from Wynard trainstations and walking distance to the opera house, bridge, rock, darling- it was an excellant location. The rooms were small, and they were skimpy on towels and soaps. The rooms had refrig, dryer and coffee maker, but no AC that I could find (and opeining a window added street noise). There was a restarant that was very pricey (especially for a travelodge). Neverfear ,there was a Subway and Mcdonalds 4 blocks away, and a Starbucks across the street. The front desk was very helpful and its location was really the hotel's highlight. It was okay, if you can find a better hotel in the area- go for it. Otherwise the location really cant be beat... Shop around fro rates, hotels.com beat they hotel's website's rate.

Reviews.Title: “Tidy and Practical Accommodation in Superb Location - BUT with a Potentially VERY Serious Safety Issue”
Reviews.Author: LPWilliams
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights in this hotel in March 2009 as part of a package tour of New Zealand and Australia, so cannot comment on the room cost but can make observations on the facilities etc and compare it to all the other 'same-standard' 3* or so hotels I stayed in. Having been in a Travelodge (Melbourne) earlier in our tour I was pleasantly surprised to find the excellent experience we had there reflected at Sydney - for smart/practical accommodation in an ideal location handy for city sightseeing Travelodge are '2 for 2' ! ****** The only concern during my stay is potentially VERY serious. We experienced a long, block-wide (as I found out later) daytime power cut which halted EVERYTHING (incl lifts). Since I just happened to be back in my room at the time, I had to use the emergency stairs to go down the many floors (bells were ringing and I was not confident there was also a fire, perhaps causing the power-cut, so was keen to make an 'escape'), but was halted around floor 5 as the emergency lighting wasn't working at all on the stairs at that floor or below (so it was pitch black). WORSE STILL, the access door to that floor was LOCKED. I was able to to get to ground-level by going back up a floor, crossing-over and going down the other stairs but the ramifications of my experience are hopefully clear to all. I shudder to think what might have happened if there had been a fire during the night and a evacuation required. The manager on-call was rightfully concerned when I pointed out the problem, BUT I did not get the full confidence it was going to be investigated or rectified with any immediacy since the staff were more concerned about the on-going power-cut. I hope it was attended to and resolved soon after, but it shouldn't have been like that anyway..... ****** The hotel is a narrow high-rise located on the corner of a very busy street in the centre of the lively city of Sydney. The local area is dominated by corporate business, so the noise really centres on traffic which is mostly present during the day - if, like I was, you are in a higher room the intrusion of that noise is minimal at night. Since Sydney is a huge city you can never be located close to everything, but this Travelodge has the best compromise I think since an underground train station is barely 100yds away and the very attractive 'hub' of the massive ferry wharfs and Sydney Opera House/Harbour Bridge can be accessed by a 10 minute walk (or short train ride). There is a very well-stocked supermarket in the underground complex of the nearby train station, as well as several shops of various kinds at ground-level. The facilities and locale of this hotel mean it is really more like a motel, but that should not detract from the overall quality of what is there - it should not be viewed as somewhere to stay-in for cosy evenings but as a handy and well-equipped base for making the most of visiting Sydney. If you want lazy days by a pool or long/fancy indoor dining go elsewhere ! Having said that, the restaurant does evening meals and an extremely popular and good value lunch special (AU$14.50 incl a beer when I was there) on weekdays - ideal if you are returning in the middle of the day for a recharge before venturing out again. Overall, the hotel was fine with no significant negative points, with all the expected room facilities and cleanliness. There was an in-room safe, effective aircon and the bathroom had a bath (some hotel bathrooms don't !). Due to the surrounding high-rise buildings don't expect too much of a view from your room.... There are 3 lifts which, after 5 weeks on tour with several bad experiences, managed the distinction of all working properly and coping with demand - amazing ! The aforementioned dining area is at the front of the hotel on ground-level, looking out onto the road (so you can feel a bit like a zoo animal at feeding time); it is quite large and practical with the chefs accessible via the wide serving 'hatch' for thing such as eggs 'cooked-to-order' (something I like a lot) at breakfast, which was buffet-style with a reasonable choice of foodstuffs. I found the reception staff to be friendly and helpful and there were 2 quite well stocked information areas with leaflets for local attractions and tours as well as a small armchair area with TV 'waiting area' by reception. This is a smart, clean and tidy hotel for a stay in Sydney which offers a superb location for visiting the city. I have some serious reservations about the emergency facilities, but can only hope my experience was isolated and the problem resolved.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mumontour08
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location - very close to Wynyard Station, near Circular Quay, the Rocks, the bridge. I was initially given an Executive Room (in a way that made it seem like a treat) on the top floor - Room 2201. Wasn't told the lift only went to floor 21 and would have to get my bag up about 25 steps (which was a struggle). Being an Executive Room the fridge was full of over-priced snacks and drinks. The room was very nice - huge bed, workspace, nice bathroom. it also camewith a whirring and clunking noise which went on until the small hours and then started again about 6am. I am pretty sure it was the lift machinery. I asked to move rooms and this was acheived without me being made to feel tooooo much of a nuisance. I was then in a room on 6th floor. This was a standard sized room with a double bed, tea and coffee making suppies, a kettle and safe. The bonuses were an empty fridge (much more useful) and a TV which worked much better. The bathroom was done as a wet room with an excellent shower - my only grumble was that there was nowhere to put anything down apart from on the floor. I think this bathroom may have been intended for wheelchair access - anyway it was great. My room rate included continental breakfast for the first 4 days. The buffet was really nice - fresh fruit, lots of cereal, cheese, muffins, toast, drinks - and went well with the complimentary newspaper. I paid for breakfast one morning and it was $20. there was also hot food which looked appetising. There were computers with internet access off the lobby area - this was expensive and I walked about 10 minutes down the street to Woolworths who had way more machines and were about a quarter of the price. There was a good guest laundry on 21st floor. I would stay here again because my second room was fine and it is an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Governance review trip”
Reviews.Author: sri67
Reviews.Content: Travelodge Wynyard this visit had a fresh ambience given the recent makeover. I had stayed here for almost half a dozen times and every room gave me a different and beautiful feeling. The complimentary breakfast is sumptuous and healthy too. One of the chefs is of Indian origin and he server fantastic parathas. I have thoroughly enjoyed the gym and the open air balcony above the gym. It's in the CBD and so easy to go to any place during the weekends, Wynyard station being just few meters away. The coles also has lot's of Indian food. I would again and again stay here and recommend to all my colleagues and friends visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate as long as you don't spend too much time in it”
Reviews.Author: Geeketteliang
Reviews.Content: I brought my parents to Sydney for their first time. We went when the Australian dollars was very high, so we decided to just look for a hotel that is more convenient than fanciful. And this is hotel is it. The building itself is on the older side though they did renovate the interiors. The rooms were clean but small. But location wise it was fantastic. It was within walking distance to the habour even though there is a Wynyard station. We just preferred to walk. For a short stay, this hotel is adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge Wynyard”
Reviews.Author: moggles10
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay at this hotel and would definitely recommend it if you're after something central. It's no frills but it was in such a good location and the room was very clean and spacious. We got the train from Sydney airport and the station was only a few minutes away on the same street so it made that journey so easy. I would say the breakfast is a little overpriced but there are so many cheaper alternatives on your doorstep that it shouldn't be a deal breaker. The little bar was very nice and good priced internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for one night - but no more”
Reviews.Author: Moss11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our last night of a two week trip in and around Sydney at this hotel. Clean and ok for one night. But the service is very limited and not friendly at all. Double room is standard. Hotel is perfectly situated next to Darling Harbour and Circular quay, both at walking distance. When we checked out, I paid for the two cokes and bottle of water we took from the fridge. But I have to say that I was very angry when we arrived back home, a few days later, we received a letter from the hotel saying that they charged us for a small bottle of whisky that we didn't pay for when we checked out. The truth is that we never drank / took away this small bottle. Someone may have stolen it when the room was being cleaned after we left. Anyway, as it was a small amount, I didn't want to waste my time trying to get it refund (especially being back in the UK). I don't appreciate being charged afterwards for an item I didn't take.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location”
Reviews.Author: remoh
Reviews.Content: This is a travellodge but not as my brit compatriates will know it as...Its formerly a 4* hotel and the level of service is still at that level. The rooms are adequate and the location is extremely handy for the transport system as wynyard station is literally 100 metres down the road. Staff were unphased by us turning up at 7am to check in, bags were stored until our room was available and in general this is a good place to stay if you want to explore sydney...A few metres down the road and you can pay double the cost of this hotel....try their website directly for best rates....happy traveller...

Reviews.Title: “An excellent location for seeing this wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: ChrisOntario.Canada
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within walking distance of everything - the Harbour Bridge, the Opera House and public transportation - buses, ferries, trains, monorail etc. The room was well equipped and most comfortable. Staff were most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value at the Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: Damaskfan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent spot for walking to see the sights of Sydney. The rooms are average travelodge rooms. The continental breakfast is simple. The staff are friendly and helpful. There were several computers for internet access in the foyer - nice touch. The laundry was really handy for those of us travelling with 20kgs of luggage on long holidays. We didn't try the evening meals so can't comment on them. Out of the front door and to the left is a great little inexpensive noodle cafes. Out of the door and left, across the road and on the corner a great little bar that does fantastic food. Sorry I don't know its name! The hotels lifts need to speed up a little - maybe they have by now.

Reviews.Title: “good value no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: droob
Reviews.Content: last time we were in sydney we stayed a couple of hundred metres away in george street, so knew it was a good location, roughly halfway between circular quays / the rocks, and darling harbour. the hotel was comfortable, a fair size room , large double bed, and well eqipped. we were a fair way up above the street so it was fairly quiet inside and outside the hotel...the lounge was comfortable to sit in and have a drink..we didn't have breakfast but had an evening meal that was good.,the staff were ok/ average.. only downside we had a room facing onto york street and at times felt like we were in the film " rear window " with the buildings accross the street having people in them who could look in....tip if you want to save yourself a walk uphill from george street go into the wynyard station entrance up two escalators inside and you come out just accross the road from the travelodge..

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Tina E
Reviews.Content: Great location in the centre of the city. Close to shopping and all major sights. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, great location”
Reviews.Author: SittingbourneOwl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the beginning of February, booked through Trailfinders, it is a popular hotel with Trailfinders judging by the number of Trailfinders tags amongst fellow guests. The hotel is only 100m from Wynyard Station which is only 20 minutes from the airport, the location is convenient for anything you want to do in Sydney, close walking distance to The Rocks, Opera House, Bridge, Circular Quay, Darling Harbour, City shops, Chinatown. No issues with the hotel staff, the hotel lobby always seemed busy, the reception staff were attentive and friendly. Hotel lobby also had internet at $6 an hour, useful for keeping in touch. The room was on the 15th floor with a view of York Street, no problems with traffic noise level, room reasonably clean, housekeeping service very efficient, definitely somewhere to sleep and shower as the rest of the day was spent sightseeing. There were some problems with the lifts when staying as they behaved erraticly which is a problem if there is only 3 lifts for the whole hotel. Did not use the restaurant for breakfast or dinner as there are many choices nearby, particularly The Rocks, Chinatown and food courts in the centre of the city. Would definitely consider staying again as it is value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very central hotel, in walking distance from most Sydney attractions”
Reviews.Author: piaech
Reviews.Content: I recommend the Travelodge Wynyard because of the location, it's approx. a 10 minute walk to the city centre and a lot of shops, a 15 minute walk to Darling Harbour and a 15-20 minute walk to the Opera house. If you just need a room for sleeping and showering, Travelodge Wynyard is good value for money. That's what we used it for. However if the plan had been to spend more time in the hotel, I would have missed a better view, a more spacious room and more comfort. The rooms are clean and the front staff is helpful when it comes to giving directions, booking tours etc. In the reception you'll find tour leaflets, a sitting area with a tv and computers with internet (they'll charge you per minute online). You can buy beers, wine and long drinks in the hotel bar but not for take away - and they don't have a cocktail menu. I didn't have dinner or lunch in the restaurant, so I cannot anything about that. However I did have breakfast in the hotel restaurant and found it to be both boring and pricy. Get your coffee and sandwich at the next door Starbuck's instead! LAST MINUTE RATES: Be aware that many hotels in Australia lower their prices by up to 50% if you book only 1 to 4 weeks ahead instead. They may of course be fully booked but we had no problems with that in late January and the beginning of February.

Reviews.Title: “Smack-in-the-middle at a good price”
Reviews.Author: bjornstrom
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel at a good location - and we got a really good rate booking online. It seems that when you book online on Travellodge.com.au you get different pricing than if you walk-in. This became a small problem when we decided to stay a extra night since the hotel could not offer us a similar price. The solution: book the extra night on my iPhone - done! We stayed two nights on the 17th floor which had pretty nice views. Then we had to change to the 9th floor and got a lot of nice from York Street below - something to think about. We paid $144 AUD per night for a room with King Size bed - no breakfast. In-house parking was $30 and broadband $22 per night. Rooms are kind of basic but they are newly renovated and I thought they were nice. They don't have all the features of a 5 star hotel but room service was actually pretty good (and quick) and my fiancee washed some clothes on the 21st floor where there's a washing room and gym. The location is very good - close to Pitt Street, Darling Harbour and the Opera house.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: hokimai
Reviews.Content: Website we booked through, described the property as 4 stars.I can honestly say, it's more a 2-3 star. Photos of hotel look very modern & sleek, but not in the plain light of day! It's just had a lick of paint, very basic toiletries (no face washer) & just tea,coffee provided, no mini bar in room. Location is good, more accessible to the waterfront end of town & city center. Ok hotel,if you just want to put your head down,not one for a relaxing stay at all.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location”
Reviews.Author: TenerifeThe_reef
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a 3 night stay in this hotel in Sydney. The reviews for this hotel, which we used before we booked are correct what a great location right in the middle of every thing you want to see and visit, 10 mins Darling Harbour, 15mins Harbour Bridge and Opera House. Room was good size 16 floor poor view but that did not spoil anything. The only problem with the hotel is the price of breakfast and internet. Beware though, hot buffet breakfast was $25 but we were told when we were checking in that if we book the night before we would get 20% off, so we booked the breakfast for the first day. We arrived at the restaurant for breakfast the following morning to be told by the guy in charge we should have a voucher for our breakfast to get the 20% off. The staff member was not at all helpfull just said you need to take it up with reception, which we did later. So we were charged the full price. We got a note later that day from the Hotel manager saying that she believe it was a missunderstanding as she had talked to the receptionist who checked us in. The note said we could have the discount for the rest of our stay but not for the first day, (what happened to customer relations or may be a ploy to get you to try the breakfast at least once and pay the full price) so we were not happy about this and did not do breakfast again at the hotel. It's not worth it anyway there are plenty of places to getter better value near by. We did take it up with the receptionist but she just said it must have been a missunderstanding, heard that before. At no time did my wife or I hear her say you need a voucher. Anyway they lossed out and the money we saved paid for far better evening meals. It was a shame, but it did not spoil our stay in Sydney and this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: WorcestershireBella
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 nights from 30th December and found the hotel clean and comfortable. We were not bothered by the traffic noise even though the hotel is on a busy road. There is no parking in front of the hotel and we were quoted $50 a night if we had wanted to park the hire car and that only if they had a space in their car park, not guaranteed and couldn't pre book. We decided to get the car back to the hire firm the same day we arrived and save money so we had to pull up, put the hazard lights on, unload and ask the porter to take our luggage to the room while we moved the car. When we came to check out we had been charged for overnight car parking, but that was removed from the bill straight away. Worth checking what's been added before you pay. The resturant didn't have a very good menu and again like most Aus hotels and resturants seem to have a lack of vegetables with the meals and was pricey, the staff were very attentive though. As someone said, day tour coaches collect over the road at the Menzies Hotel, no problem there, cross at the lights. The city railway station, similar to London Underground, is a minute away and connects to the main line station. We took the train out to Tuggerah to see friends one day and it couldn't have been easier. It is easy to walk to Darling Harbour, the Rocks as well as shopping malls and not far to a monorail station or hop on hop off open top bus stop which takes in all the sights, worth having a day ticket for both to save tired feet. For a reasonably priced hotel this one is very good and I've aready recommended it to a Brisbane friend who is hoping to get to Sydney in a couple of months time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: nathaliejane
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over new year and am happy to recommend it in terms of value (although we still paid over the odds because of the time of year it was better than some of the other prices that we were quoted!!!). The staff couldnt have been more helpful and friendly, and the hotel is perfeclty located for all the main attractions. The room was large and clean and serviced everyday with top ups of tea/coffee and toiletries. I would say with this hotel it does what it says on the tin - good standard three star accomodation in a great location. I would recommend it as a good, comfortable city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Spitfire24
Reviews.Content: Excellent location as mentioned in other reviews. Easy walking distance to The Rocks area, Sydney Bridge, the Opera House, and Darling Bay. No more than 15 minutes in any direction. Room was not huge but clean and comfortable. Internet is available in the front reception. Three screens available 20 mins for $2. Pick-up for trips was not from the front of the hotel but across the street at Menzies. Be careful using the $12 pp shuttle to the airport. We booked it in advance but we were'missed' off the collection and the desk advised us that this had happened to several other people. So it's worth making the desk check on your departure date. After a small altercation with the desk staff and then duty manager we were eventually sent to the airport in a taxi at no additional charge. Overall met our needs perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “VFM”
Reviews.Author: Michnoquet
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, 10-15 minutes from the Rocks 5 minutes from George St and 15 minutes from the Ferries. Large, clean room with great shower and comfy bed. It looks like it has been recently refurbished and a great bonus is that you can open the windows when the A/C has got too much. Although a really busy hotel the service at reception was very good and there is a laundromat on the top floor. We did'nt eat breakfast here as there were so many places nearby to eat. For central Sydney there is no reason to pay more for a room you are only going to use to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Content With Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sammyt27
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. You are close to everything, as the other posts mention. The hotel is on a major street- with 30 buses passing by at all times of the day and night, along with sirens- so the higher up you are, the better. The gym was near the top of the hotel, along with the laundry, and both were decent. The rooms were clean and roomy. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: TykeHBNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Six seniors. Three rooms booked. We found this hotel very much to our liking. Location, value for money, cleanliness, and helpful staff were all tops. No negatives

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: denandmark
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in October as a base for exploring Sydney and the surrounding area. Coming from the airport, you can catch a train direct to Wynyard station and the hotel is just 100yds away, so very easy to reach. We found the staff to be friendly and efficient and the rooms were clean and spacious. The best thing about the hotel though is the location, you are centrally located, no more than a 5 - 10min walk from all the main sights and attractions, absolutely perfect for tourists. Meals at the hotel seemed a bit expensive, but there were loads of other restaurants, cafe's, bars nearby so this didn't really matter.

Reviews.Title: “good value simple accommodation in central Sydney”
Reviews.Author: hoboesque
Reviews.Content: This is a basic, functional hotel in the city centre, well located for transportation and most business addresses. It's clean, well maintained, respectable, and has a very decent restaurant attached. There are no ancillary facilities that I'm aware of. The rooms are simple but with a kettle to make tea/coffee, and (expensive but quite good) internet connection. It's on a busy street but the window insulation seems to be fairly effective in keeping out the noise. It's good value for money - I've stayed in many different city centre hotels in Sydney in this price bracket, and this is one of the better ones. Part of the cost efficiency clearly comes from having a small staff headcount, so be prepared for delays if you're unlucky with the timing of your check in or check out.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: tronski
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location - not far from Circular Quay, Opera House, Bridge and Darling Harbour. Shops are also close by. Room has everything you need - we paid a special rate due to construction, so we were pleased with what we paid for ($105 for the night). I'm not sure I'd pay the full price though. Rooms were clean with 2 large beds (maybe a bit smaller than a double bed per person). Car parking is a bit of a nightmare and is limited. The sign is small and entrance is round the corner from the hotel - once you've mastered the one way system (tip - if you are coming across Harbour Bridge, stay in a left hand lane).Costs $20 a night. Food and internet looked pricey - there are much cheaper options near by. Reception staff were fine and answered any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: stephanieuofw
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very pleasantly surprised by the Travelodge Wynyard. This hotel has a great location and is close to so many attractions and sights within Sydney. We were able to easily walk to the Sydney Opera House, the Rocks, Darling Harbour, the Sydney Aquarium, and many other things. There are also plenty of restaurants nearby. The room itself is not fancy but very adequate. We found the staff to be friendly as well. We did not try to restaurant downstairs because the breakfast and dinner prices seemed on the higher side, but they apparently have an affordable lunch package. The cost of wireless internet connection within the rooms was pricey in my opinion - however, they do have coin operated internet terminals downstairs for quick use. Overall, we were not disappointed and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Most impresssed...”
Reviews.Author: May29
Reviews.Content: The receptionist was very polite and greeted us with "good afternoon, Mr & Mrs..." Although the room smelt faintly of cigarette smoke, especially when in bed, the excellent breakfast well made up for it. We were seated right by the window so great for people watching - the city was buzzing with commuters on their way to work. An ideal hotel to explore everything by foot,. We had an interesting walk to the ferries. Amazing views at night of everyone going home across the bridge and of the pretty lights down below in the CBD. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great unless you need to park a car”
Reviews.Author: Spunkysista75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property hoping to get a reasonable nights accommodation in an inner city hotel. The room was comfortable and the price was ok but parking the car proved to be a dilema. When i booked the accommodation i was told the hotel had parking (which it did) but i wasnt told it had LIMITED parking. Infact it had very limited parking and we ended up having to park in a nearby parking station overnight for a ridiculous cost of $72 for a 12 hour period and then wheel all of our luggage through the traffic,in the rain, to the hotel. I was NOT impressed and would not use this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “staff need customer service training”
Reviews.Author: Magellan4
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip round the east coast of Australia, punctuated by a stopover at Hong Kong and ending in Bangkok, and this was the poorest of all the hotels we stayed in. The staff were not customer friendly so we had to find our own way around, the lady receptionist was always on the phone and the men, on the whole, uninterested. One early start I asked whether we turned left or right out of the hotel for a particular road (that turned out to be just across the road) and the man said 'you have to turn right, it's a one way street', when I said we were walking he just shrugged his shoulders instead of saying that it was only across the road!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel -Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Joey1234
Reviews.Content: Great location, lovely rooms, clean, comfy. Best selling point is the location. 10 mins to Rocks, Circular Quay and 5mins to shopping / George Street. Wynyard rail station immediately next door and it is very handy to get to and from the airport from this station. Nice staff and food overall a lovely experience. BTW no point in getting an executive room just a little bigger but no real view to speak of on the higher floors.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Trawlerman20
Reviews.Content: Had a week here at the end of July 2008. After much discussion we decided to go for a cheaper hotel in Sydney on the principal we would be out and about all the time. The Wynyard Travelodge fits that description perfectly. Very clean and close to all the major central sights and communications to the outer parts of Sydney you may wish to visit. Only 100m from the Station so the transfer from the Airport was very easy. Short walk to Circular Quay, The Rocks and Opera House. In the other direction only a stroll to the city and Darling Harbour. Only down side was we tried the breakfast one morning and it was average at best and not particulary cheap. Better to go out and grap a late breakfast elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Great Service: I Would Return!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kanawha
Reviews.Content: I recently spent at week beginning August 2 at the Travelodge Wynyard. I was very impressed with their communications prior to my visit. My emails and questions were responded to within 24 hours and in a very customer friendly manner. My flight arrived at 6:30am and I was aware that official check in time would not be until 2pm which is typical of most hotels at which I've stayed. They did tell me that they expected the room to be ready by Noon if I wanted to check by with them at that time. They gave me a map and gave me a good orientation to things to see nearby and stored my luggage. I spent that morning looking around and then going to the Sydney Aquarium. and Wildlife Park...a must experience. The time passed quickly and I actually didn't get back to the hotel until almost 2 pm. If you buy a combined ticket to the Aquarium and Wildlife attractions, you get a discount and unlimited visits for 30 days. I did eat the full breakfast on my last day as it would be a very long 24 hours back home. It was excellent with a great selection. Whenever I went out in the morning for my activities, I glanced into the restaurant and found it very busy. I did eat two evening meals in it and they were quite good and reasonable with attentive table service. For those wanting just a light breakfast, Starbucks is just down the street on the corner. McDonalds is located on the next street over with more of a walk than to Starbucks. There is a Japanese restaurant next door and small cafes and delis within easy walking distance. I chose this hotel because I planned to be active and would just need a comfortable room to sleep and did not want to pay sky high exotic destination prices. My room was very clean and it was quiet. I have problems sleeping at times so any small noises can bother me. I heard very little during sleeping hours. The location is excellent as it is within walking distance of Darling Harbour, the Rocks, etc. It is also close to a train station. There is also the monorail, Explorer Bus and the Hop On, Hop Off bus for easy exploration when you get tired of walking. I even took a day tour to Canberra, the Australian captiol, which gave another insight into Australia and a contrast to Sydney but a wonderful city in its own right with its spectacular architecture, buildings, and national embassies. The staff was very good at alerting me to any messages left with activity companies, and they were very friendly. Some spent time in "down" moments discussing the local area as well as the states. Bottom line is that I have stayed in 4 star hotels with far less effective service and which were noisy. I absolutely was satisfied with my reception, my stay, accomodations, and assistance while there. If I return, I will definitely return to the Travelodge Wynyard. It made my vacation a wonderful experience at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Other reviews say it all”
Reviews.Author: canary2211
Reviews.Content: Great location, decent rooms, clean, comfy. Location location location. 10 mins to Rocks, Circular Quay, 5mins to shopping, Wynyard bus/train station immediately next door, 15mins to Darling Harbour. I cannot add to what others have said. Two slight niggles - the right most lift of the three is troublesome! And the lobby smells of the fried foods from the kitchen. We had breakfast once but there are better and cheaper alternatives within 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience - so near to the train station”
Reviews.Author: EnAjOe
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nites n its very convenient as it is just 100 meters or less to the nearest train station n there are eateries at the station n ard it. We got the 7-days pass for train/bus/ferry which even includes the route to Blue Mountains. Room was clean n tidy whenever we requested it. Only complaint was the receptionist at the counter when we checked in. The lady at the desk at that time wasn't friendly and don't carry a smile when we asked for directions to a place. But the ones who was on the duty at nite were really good. We asked for recommendations on the local clubs. She gave us more than enough choices n directions to get there too. The hotel let us kept our luggages for free after we checked out as our flight was at late evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ph001
Reviews.Content: Great location to explore Sydney. The room was nicely upgraded and had room service one evening which was good quality. We had room only basis but went down for breakfast one morning which was nice again but a little rushed. The underground stop is literally 2-mins walk away from the hotel so we decided to get it on the way back to the airport which was perfect - quick and cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheProf100
Reviews.Content: Getting There: While a taxi is the quickest means to get to the hotel, I would strongly recommend (especially for those traveling solo) taking instead the subway, which will be about one-quarter of the cost of a taxi (including return). The subway stops at both the international and domestic terminals of the airport. Take it to the Wynyard Station and exit on York Street. Look to your left; the hotel is on the very next block, about 100 meters away. (It took me, from the time my plane landed in Sydney to the time I arrived at the hotel, exactly one hour; that included the time during which I had to wait to get my bags as the carousel.) Rooms: My room was fairly large. The bed was comfortable, and there was a fair amount of storage space. I had a refrigerator but no microwave. The staff at the Travelodge is very courteous and more than willing to answer questions and provide assistance to patrons. Fun: The Travelodge is in the heart of Sydney. It is about a 10-minute walk from Circular Quay and Sydney Tower, and 20-25 minutes from the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Circular Quay where the Sydney Opera House is located; it is also where one can catch the harbor ferries. Food: There is a restaurant at the hotel. Breakfast runs $20 (Australian) for the continental buffet and $25 for the hot buffet. Dinner will cost about $17-25 per entrÃ©e. If you are on a tight budget or want to eat away from the hotel, there are numerous restaurants and bakeries nearby. I found several bakeries at Wynyard Station, and there is even a grocery store there. One can go through the station into one of the downtown shopping markets. For those looking for a quick cup of coffee or snack, Starbuckâ€™s is located across the street from the hotel. (Head toward Wynyard Station on York Street; you canâ€™t miss it.) Fitness: Sydney is an easy city to walk around. If you are looking for a gym, the hotel does have a fitness center, located on the 21st (top) floor. It has an elliptical machine, treadmill, bike, rowing machine, and dumbbells up to 10 kg. Internet: While there is internet access in the room, it is pricey. On the lobby floor are three computers that offer internet at the cost of $1 for 20 minutes time. One can also print material off at 20 cents a page.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: telcopaul
Reviews.Content: Well located to CBD, Rocks, Darling Harbour and Chinatown, if you don't mind a 10-15 minute walk. Rooms are clean and recently renovated, slight traffic noise from street. Really safe location (ie. no noisy pubs) and less than 100 metres to Wynyard underground station (trains direct to Airport), but nearest alternative restaurants 10-15 minutes walk. Definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Juniper_ie
Reviews.Content: Even though I had emailed the hotel several weeks in advance to request an early check in, unfortunately when we arrived, tired and jet lagged at 8am on a Sunday morning, we were told that we wouldn't be able to check in til 2pm. Luckily we were able to leave our luggage there so off we went to kill some time by going to the cinema. Everything is within walking distance from the hotel so its location is ideal. For longer trips, the train station is just a few doors down. Our room was right next to the lifts which were quite noisy - at night time especially. Breakfast is served on the ground floor and the choice was good. There's 3 coin-operated internet points in the lobby too. Any time we walked through the lobby it always seemed to be thronged with people so we had very little interaction with the reception staff. All in all, even though the location was good, if I was to return to Sydney, I think I'd investigate other hotels. Our travel agent had another hotel for a similar price in the heart of The Rocks [an area that's well worth a visit] so I think next time we'd stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean base in great location”
Reviews.Author: nz08
Reviews.Content: This is a good Travelodge. Room & bathroom as you'd expect, but clean. Great location for visiting Sydney. Good aspects of our stay: - location. Easy enough to walk to Circular Quay / Opera House/ Bridge etc. and also Sydney Tower & Darling Harbour. - we arrived early after an overnight flight. Staff recognised this and kindly gave us a room immediately. Much appreciated. Would have been better to have been on a floor where there was no work going on though. - staff helpful and efficient. Not quite so good: - room on floor without work going on - especially when kindly given room to sleep during the day to recover from jet lag. - had to correct room rate, as tried to charge for additional person in the room (son aged 11), when nothing mentioned on original booking for 2 adults & 1 child. However, they did correct without too much discussion. - raves about the room rates. I'm not sure I'd say it was a great price on it's own. However, I couldn't get anything else that looked as safe a bet at a better price. Recommendations: - get airport shuttle from the airport. We got a taxi and wished we'd got the shuttle. Traffic, although after rush hour, was heavy & guy used toll roads. - get taxi back to airport, particularly if early flight. We used shuttle after the taxi experience and decided we'd just got them the wrong way round! Shuttle went to various different pick-ups and the last couple of pick ups everyone on the bus thought it was full already! Especially the luggage. Also, not all the seatbelts worked! - really enjoyed Opera House tour, Pylon Lookout, Powerhouse Museum, eating at Darling Harbour & Circular Quay, hop on / off bus tour, walking through Botanical Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: 2-many-decisions
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 1 night only during my whistle stop trip to Sydney. Arrived before mid day expecting to have to wait to check-in & was pleased when told my room was ready. Reception staff were quick, friendly & efficient. Room was clean & adequate, views were of buildings but I didn't book this hotel for views. Location was brilliant, walking distance to the Rocks, Circular Quay, the harbour etc couldn't fault it. Would recommend this for travellers who want a clean, well located hotel for a reasonable pricewould certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Fussy08
Reviews.Content: Nothing to complain about with this hotel. Great location, walked everywhere! Go and climb the bridge its worth the money and not scary at all.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: CSGDevizes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights stopover arriving very early in the morning after a flight from Singapore. The room was immediately available and it was a suite with a separate sitting room and a bath in the bathroom!Good facilities for the price. We were on the top floor and had great views over the city. The laundry was in the process of being moved to make way for a gym.Check in was smooth and friendly and room service was quick and efficient. The location is really handy for Circular Quay and Darling Harbour and only a few minutes to the train station which also has food stalls and a supermarket.We had a really enjoyable stay and thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: glenlan
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had the pleasure of staying here for 4 nights as my husband couldn't get away from work. The room was more than adequate. Very clean, very warm, internet access - everything we needed. We didn't have any problems during our stay, so had no need to bother the front desk. Our luggage was stored for us on the day we departed, and Greg hailed us a taxi for our trip to the airport. The hotel is such a perfect location, we were able to walk everywhere - Bridge, Harbour, Cirular Quay, Sydney Tower, Luna Park, Darling Harbour, and had an absolute ball walking and sightseeing. The train, if needed, is only 2 mins from the Hotel - Perfect!! If we come back to Sydney, we will definitely stay here again. Even with a small amount of renovating going on (our room was recently refurbished) it was still a great place to stay. Staff were helpful with maps, knowledge etc. Housekeeping were fantastic. Hope to see you all again soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Barry-Jang
Reviews.Content: Just Returned from a 3 week Holiday in Ausralia.12 April to 1 st May 08 Our first visit.. ! week Melbourne and Area. Great. 1 week Travelodge Wyngard Sydney, very good for location, Rooms better than I expected,ask for the back as quieter..Very busy place with tours coming and going. Breakfast buffet very good but expensive 20au$ pp. Plenty of other places nearby. Much to do and see in Sydney.The Sydney Explorer Bus to Watsons Bay/Gap Great views,( the famous Fish and Chips!, Rubbish) then to Bondi.Very disappointed,but the walk around the headland toTamarama and Bronte Beach was the Highlight.Good day out. 3rd week to Port Douglas, Bueatiful. Clean, Green,open spaces,only 3 storey buildingsMax. The trip to the Barrier Reef great.We went on the Poseidon boat,wow what service,good food and really looked after.Nothing was too much trouble for the staff.Stayed at the Macossan House.just back of the main street. Very good clean apartment.highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Location only redeeming quality”
Reviews.Author: 50countries
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 days here while exploring Sydney. We were very happy with the location (both harbours, bridge climb, shopping etc were easily accessible) but like other reviewers we had some reservations about the hotel facilities. Although staff tried to be very helpful, there were often just too few of them trying to service too many guests. The hotel was in the middle of a refurbishment so the lifts were often locked off by the builders causing massive delays and the place was dusty and covered with scaffolding downstairs. The room was fine but very tired. If ever they finish the makeover (and don't hike up the prices as a result) it could be a great value place to stay. Meanwhile - get a refurbised room on a high floor and enjoy the walks.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, Stinky, Grotty, Service Fine”
Reviews.Author: skywok
Reviews.Content: The first room I was booked into stunk of smoke, even though it's meant to be a non-smoking hotel. The second room I walked into had so much chemical air scent sprayed in it - that my throat became hoarse & I could barely speak. I sounded like I had a heavy cold for three hours afterwards & had to leave the hotel. I have never had a reaction like that before. The beds had creases in them & even on a Sunday it was noisy from the traffic below. The walls and carpets were marked. I was very sorry to have wasted my time on this hotel. My complaints were dealt with fairly effectively, though it still cost me time, cab fares and third party booking fees. The other thing that concerned me was - what on earth is in the air? Save yourself the heartache & go for something better to begin with.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: coljac
Reviews.Content: For our second visit to this great city we wanted a VFM hotel nearer to Circular Quay & Darling Harbour than last time when we were based in Kings Cross. We chose the location well. 5 mins walk from the speedy airport rail link and an easy stroll to the waterfront. Room was a pefectly adequate base for the 6 nights we stayed there, and we would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NormLouise
Reviews.Content: In January and February 2008 month my wife and myself had the pleasure at staying here while we planned and returned from our New Zealand Cruise, the room was very clean and newly appointed; more then adequate for our needs. The Staff at the front desk on several occasions went beyond the call of duty to assist and meet our needs beyond our expectations ---single beds became a king bed in less then an hour, bags where stored with interest and assistance in our departure, assistance was given with internet problems that the kiosk could not attend to, taxi's were hailed from the curbside in amongst the construction and noise....a great staff team..all the right people in the right jobs..ensured great service...

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - worth every $”
Reviews.Author: DownunderSugarglider
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wynard travelodge when travelling on business and if you can't afford the Four Seasons but want to stay near the harbour for a reasonable cost this is the place for you. I stayed up on the 21st floor at the front of the hotel - with a view of the park and the York st buildings. Decent sized room - big for Travelodge - and COMPLETELY refurbished - everything in this room is brand spanking new - shiny tiles, shiny sheets and towels even a shiny new soap holder. A large rainforest showerhead, pretty standard/ usual toiletries, brand new flat LCD tv, broadband internet connection, ironing board, mini bar, HEAPS of storage, block out blinds - GREAT firm pillows. The only thing was that there was a vending machine outside my room door and things in there were half the price or less of the mini bar prices. Room service - pretty standard but OK. The gym room was empty of all equipment - but the TV was operating - so I suppose you could it on the floor and watch the 24hours of continuous TV in a big empty room. Being up high I had very little street noise and despite being practically on top of Wynyard Railway there was no train noise. Taxis and buses literally at the door. Service can be a bit hard to get - it's nice but at checkout in the morning there was only 1 woman and a long queue What can I say - great price, great location, great stay

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: surfoz
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because we could easily get a train from the airport to Wynyard and also it was close to the cruise terminal where we would be departing from on the following day. I had also stayed several times in this hotel when it was known as the Corus. Even though the Corus was ok, it is nice to see it being renovated. We had a nice size renovated room, no problems. On Check in they did not have our booking and I think they tried to sort it out with the agent over the phoe, after about 15 mins we were in our room. Although our booking was room only, when i enquired about the cost of breakfast next morning, the desk advised it was included in our room charge, so that was a bonus. Breakkie was nice. All in all, I'm glad we chose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “location”
Reviews.Author: tart1
Reviews.Content: there was some building work being done when we stayed but it never caused us any problems and the hotel was very clean and kept to a good standard the rooms are serviced very well the location of the hotel is fantastic right in the heart of the city close to all amineties darling harbour is a must very pleased with our stay at the wynyard the staff are very helpful makes your stay much better

Reviews.Title: “Great location - rooms OK”
Reviews.Author: Mbarrow
