Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have rightly stated, the best aspect of this hotel is it's location. Great for getting to all the tourist spots. Whilst we were at the hotel upgrade works were taking place to both the inside and outside of the building, whilst these did not disturb us it did leave the hotel looking messy (both outside and along the landings were rooms were being worked on). The rooms were comfortable and we were lucky enough to get into one of the refurbished rooms. Not a massive difference between the refurbished rooms. The view from our room was straight into the office block behind the hotel, but we didn't mind as we didn't spend much time in there. My only complaint would be the fact that the front desk staff booked us a taxi to take us back to the airport that never turned up and we ended up flagging one off the street (eventually!).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Sozzal26
Reviews.Content: For a Travelodge this is fantastic value for money, it's right at the heart of the city near all the great locations like Circular Quay, Darling Harbour, The Rocks, Shopping. We got a great deal with an extra night free. Rooms come with a safe which is always good & the hotel offer left luggage if you have a late flight. There was some construction work going on, but it didn't cause any bother, also the views aren't great unless you go above the 16 floor. But how much time will you spend in the room?

Reviews.Title: “Great option right in town”
Reviews.Author: Canuk17
Reviews.Content: We chose this place because of a major reduction in cost due to construction. Our view was blocked but it was very quiet. It was clean and a great location. It was an amazing deal. If it was more expensive, I would suggest staying in the Rocks area- it's much more closer to restaurants and still close to the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky room, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: H-J-Bham
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in September for my birthday while exploring the city. It was our first time to Sydney and we really couldnâ€™t have picked a better hotel. The rooms had recently renovated and for a Travel Lodge, were surprisingly swanky! The room was really clean and had everything you needed. The bathroom, though small, was very stylish. They had certainly made very good use of a small room by using mirrors to make it feel bigger. The hotel itself is not amazing by any means - the staff were friendly but slightly inexperienced, however this was not an issue and we didnâ€™t have any problems with the hotel or the staff. We were staying on a B&B basis and the breakfast wasnâ€™t great. It was a buffet breakfast and if you like your cooked breakfast every morning you will be slightly disappointed because it wasnâ€™t very nice. The cooked food was stodgy but there was lots of fruit and other breads and meats and cereal so it wasnâ€™t that bad. This hotel is really all about the location (and the room!). It was slap bang in the middle of everything, the furthest we had to walk was about 15 minutes down to the Darling Harbour. The harbour bridge was about 5 minutes walk and the Opera House and Botanical Gardens about 10 minutes walk. It was also 3 minute walk to Wynyard Station so excellent if you are using public transport. I would highly recommend using the train to get to and from the airport because itâ€™s so much easier and takes less time than the hotel shuttle bus which, although itâ€™s about the same price, they pick up from other hotels so takes about 30 minutes longer! All in all, we loved it here and we really could not have chosen a better hotel to stay in. If all you want to do is explore the city all day and come back to a comfortable and stylish hotel room, this is the one for you. If youâ€™re taste is more upmarket and you want a more lavish and over the top hotel, then this probably wont be the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: saxie
Reviews.Content: Arrived 21-00 Sunday hungry! Reception were unable to direct us to a food outlet even Circular Quay seemed to be closed. Eventually made it to Macdonalds just before they shut. We were surprised by this in a big city. There were vending machines in the hotel for chocolate bars crisps etc. It all seemed a bit grubby but looked better in the sunshine next day. This is a basic hotel, in a good central location. Reasonably priced place to lay your head while you enjoy sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: Poprostu
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is simply great. It takes about 10 min walk to Circular Quay, the Opera House, the Harbour Bridge and the Rocks. In the other direction it is about 15 min walk to the Queen Victoria Building shopping mall and the surrounding shopping and business areas. In fact, most tourist areas of central Sydney are probably within 20 min walk from the hotel. I had just 3 days to spend in Sydney at the end of my business trip to Australia and I made the most of the time by staying at this Travelodge. The hotel does not look impressive from the outside, but inside I found my room to be quite nice, with new furniture, decently sized modern bathroom, a fridge, tea making and ironing facilities, and a large bed. My room faced an office building, which was just several meters away. So it had absolutely no view. Strangely, there were no curtains on the window, just a wooden screen that you could slide. The TV was also in the room with a fairly small number of Australian channels. Wired broadband internet was also available in the room, however I cannot comment on it much since I haven't used it. I found housekeeping to be a bit spotty - e.g., one day I had 2 large towels, the next day just 1, the next day 2 again. Similarly, teabags were not always refilled. There is a restaurant at the hotel and a Japanese restaurant in the building next to the hotel. Overall, Travelodge Wynyard is a great choice for central Sydney accommodation at a reasonable price. I would no doubt stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Holiday_Monkeys
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 days on our Sydney leg of our honeymoon. It was ok for the price, but unfortunately we were there when they were having renovation work done. It wouldn't have been so bad but we firstly didn't kow anything about it - was not notified by travel agent or the hotel when we booked in. The builders were not suppose to start until 9am but there was always banging and drilling at 7am. We complained to the Manager who apologised and did nothing ! I even went as far as writing a letter, but still never heard anything back. Despite this the hotel is very near the Rocks and Darling Harbour which you can walk to easily and Wynard Street Station is only across the road. Don't have breakfast here ! It is so expensive !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steveconnors
Reviews.Content: Just returned from months tour of Australia (on our Honeymoon). We stayed at the Travelodge Wynyard for 8 nights. Really is a 'value for money' hotel. The location is so perfect ,being 10 minutes from Darling Harbour, 15 from The Rocks and 10 minutes from Chinatown. As its practically next door to Wynyard Station. Which you can use from the Airport and Back. If you buy a sydney travel pass this train fare is included. The pass doesn't start until you use it within sydney town centre (so think about how many days you require) Hotel is off the same standard as our Travel Inns - so you know what to expect. There is a Coles Suppermarket located in Wynyard station for all your conveniences. If you need any advice whilst in sydney, then a visit to the sydney visitor centre in the rocks will sort you out. Have fun

Reviews.Title: “My Favourit Sydney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sailormod
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the price for what the Travelodge offers. Most of the rooms have been recently renovated and are clean, bright and tidy. Its within walking distance of the main shopping areas of Sydney, and the Opera House, the historic Rocks district, which is an entertainment area as well as being a tourist and historical drawcard. Wynyard Railway station is just across the street with connections all over the city, the buses are close and its a short walk to the ferrys at Circular Quay. Service was excellent, receptionist and roomstaff were friendly, cheerful and courteous. Even on APEC weekend when the city was "locked down" the Travelodge was an oasis of calm, friendly, efficient service. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Location”
Reviews.Author: karmalcam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and the location, as everyone has said is fantastic. You couldn't ask for a more centally located hotel. Plenty of pubs around, only a short walk to Darling Harbour and Sydney Harbour. Wynyard Station is right down the road so getting the airport train is pretty much right to the door. The rooms were average but in good condition. We stayed on the 7th floor and heard traffic noise. The housekeeping was also on the same floor so there was constant door opening etc. Overall the experience was good and would recommend to most travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Andy_Anderson
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel, and excellent location. Rooms are not top class but adequately furnished and clean. Very close to local metro station and all Syndey's top attractions. Good choice of restaurants and cafes in vicinity. There are washing machines on the top floor which is helpful, along with vending machines for a quick thurst!

Reviews.Title: “Ideally Placed”
Reviews.Author: EasyNote
Reviews.Content: Every other person who reviews this hotel has already mentioned it......GREAT location in which to explore Sydney! The rooms are what you would expect from the 'Travelodge' brand and are adequate. If your looking for good accomadation in a fantastic location at a budget then book this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: w0rldwidetraveller
Reviews.Content: We were unsure when we first arrived as the building is not very attractive from the outside. But our room had been recently renovated and for the money it was a comfortable size, had a nice bathroom and was clean. The staff were fine. On a slight down side there were limited washing machine for the size of the building. It is only about 10 minutes walk to the Harbour and is near train station.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “standard accomodation”
Reviews.Author: JillFriends
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the travelodge for 3 nights in total. found the hotel good, just what you expect from a travel lodge in the UK. clean and tidy with good size bed and full bathroom. Breakfast was a bit over priced and poor quality so after the 1st morning we ate out. great loacation for the whole of sydney and very helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dekostop
Reviews.Content: location, location, location 10 min. walking distance from circular quay (ferries). 15 min. walking distance to opera house. reasonably priced right in downtown sydney. 5 min walking distance to subway station (wynyard). try to get a room on the highest floor facing york st. the other side of hotel faces a highrise building about 5 meters apart from hotel building. facing york st. one can see a small portion of sydney harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: ozzietripper
Reviews.Content: We really appreciated our stay at the travelodge. The staff were helpful and very friendly. Room service was good too. The only grip we had was the size of the bathroom/toilet. It was far too small. You were basically peeing right next too some clean towels. My partner said that she wouldn't stay here again because it was too small. The breakfast was very expensive at $22 for buffet and $17 for continental. There aren't many local places to eat for breakfast unless you walked to Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: fijidrama
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Travelodge is the price and the location. The hotel is very old and tired, although they were doing works while we were there. There are two computers in the reception area - which permanantly have people on them. We used an internet cafe instead. Rooms are clean and basic. They left a bottle of fizz for us, and also left a wedding card and some fizz from friends of ours who left it in the hotel's care the month previously. The location is great - easy to walk to Darling Harbour and the bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Diving_bell
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfy hotel and in an excellent location. Very easy to get to the Opera House & Harbour Bridge, the Rocks and also Darling Harbour. Vicky, London

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Anne_M_D
Reviews.Content: Main reason for staying here was the fact I couldn't get into the Philip St one and the bonus of being able to leave the car here was a big plus. Loved it, good sized room, very clean, friendly service. Will definitely stay here again. Very centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: GillianandJames
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the travel lodge for 3 nights on our honeymoon, and then treated ourselves to the last 3 nights at the Shangri-la hotel. The travel lodge is a great hotel, we had a newly refurbished room which was very comfortable. The staff were really friendly and very helpful on providing restaurant recommendations. The location is just fantastic, close to the harbour with all of the attractions and a few minutes walk from the Rocks. We only found out that the Shangri-la and Travel lodge were on the very same road when we were in Sydney and had we have known, we would have stayed at the travel lodge and saved our money and spent it on something else during our honeymoon. Would definitley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: AnnePerth
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here before when it was the Corus Hotel and had always found it convenient and inexpensive if a little dowdy. This time with the refurbishment it was very pleasent and still very reasonable. The room at the back is smallish but quite adequate ,is light and still has a bit of an outlook . The furniture is comfortable, functional and has what is needed. The value for money at Travelodge became evident when we had to move hotels and found the next one in the same location to be more expensive with a large opulent lobby but a dark room looking on to a light well, furniture which was not useful eg the bedside table on one side of a double bed only. We will cheerfully return to the Travelodge Wynyard .

Reviews.Title: “Great base from which to explore the best attractions around Sydney”
Reviews.Author: 1ObservantTraveler
Reviews.Content: Travelodge Wynyard was a great base from which to explore Sydney. It is in an excellent locationâ€¦.only a few blocks from the breathtaking Sydney Harbor Bridge, Opera House, and The Rocks area. As of Oct 2006, the hotel was undergoing renovations and the room I was originally given was one that had not been renovated and was sub-standard. However, when I called the reception desk to complain I was quickly assigned to a room that had been renovated and it made all the difference in the world. Be sure to request a renovated room---they are SO much nicer! The dÃ©cor is very contemporary and the room was clean and spacious! Continental breakfast was not included in my room rate and for the charge of around $16 you can do better by going out to a cafÃ© or alternatively, grabbing a quick bite at Starbucks across the street. Overall, the hotel was â€œno frillsâ€� (as expected for the reasonable room rate), but the room was comfortable and you canâ€™t beat the location! And during your stay, take the time to have a leisurely lunch or dinner around the Sydney Harbor.....

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: shelby2b
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only a few minutes away from all the main attractions of Sydney. The Bridge, Opera House and Darling Harbour are only 5-10minutes walk away. Although the staff were friendly and helpful I was unable to check in any earlier than 2pm which was hard since I had arrived at 6am. The hotel is in the process of refurbishment but we didn't here or see anything. Our room was a little dated but clean. The room was nice but the pillows were a bit flat. This is a good hotel at a good price. I would certainly recommend it for the location and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Knighty
Reviews.Content: The hotel is busy having work done but we did not hear anything. The hotel room was clean and basic however the hall ways are very grubby. The hotel has a small bar in the entrance. We used the laundry facilities but they were very poor and not worth the wait. The hotel is in a great location just a short walk to the bridge and opera house. If you just want a clean bed to sleep in while you look around Sydney then this is for you it's not glam but for the price it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne46
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the wynyard travel-lodge for three nights in july. The hotel was lovely and clean and in a brillant location. We however also had a problem with the shower - either either freezing or boiling hot - we also reported this to reception and it was not sorted. However overall all I would stay that the hotel again because it is such good value for money. It was so convenient having the train and bus station just across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Good location...thats about it”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Cronin
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 week round-the-world honeymoon, stayed at the Wynyard hotel while in Sydney. We arrived on a flight from Bangkok arriving in Sydney at 6.30am. We came straight from the airport to the hotel and asked about possibly getting a room immediately. We were unable to get it, and told we would have to wait until 2pm, maybe 1pm if we were lucky, the staff just seemed uninterested and unhelpful which is what you dont need after a long flight when you are tired. (We were not the only couple who had arrived on an early flight) So we made the most of a bad situation, we were able to use their washrooms to get changed, and so we started our Sydney sight-seeting immediately. Returned to hotel at 1pm and room was still not ready. Eventually got the room at 2.15pm. We did get a suite on the top floor which was spacious and clean. The hotel is very central. We climbed the Harbour Bridge the following day. Well worth it. Also went to the Blue Mountains and Hunter Valley. Also well worth doing. The hotel does have a self service laundry service which was handy. I would not recommend this hotel based on what I saw of other floors.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but clean and in a brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: On_the_move_365
Reviews.Content: Booked this with trailfinders If you are looking for somewhere cheap and central this is the place. It is near the Bridge, Circular Quay, Opera House, Shopping, Nightlife and Wynard Train station. We took a cab from the airport (mistake as it cost us $30) on way back we used walked 200 yards to the Train station and got train to the airport. While in Sydney we purchased the Sydney pass $110 dollars, but great value. we got a day harbour cruise, night harbour cruise, the Sydney explorer bus, bondi explorer bus, all other bus and rail transport including out to airport. Â£40 sterling, it worked out very good value for a tourist type trip to Sydney. The Travelodge was very basic, breakfast was available but not included in the price, but we availed of the local food courts which were terrific value. We had a problem with the shower, it was either boiling or freezing and report it to the desk, but they didnâ€™t appear to sort it out. Requested extra towels, but they never came. However, all that aside when you are in Sydney for a holiday, you basically use a place like the Travelodge to sleep in. The fact that it was central was a more important factor. Would stay here again, but would ensure that the shower was working first ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mazz-1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week in this hotel and after visiting a Travelodge in Melbourne for a few days came back for a further week. The Hotel staff are really nice and couldn't be more helpful. Breakfast is a bit expensive but there is plenty of it. The Hotel is apparently undergoing some renovation at the moment and some of the rooms could do with it. Having said that although the carpet in our room was a bit shabby the room was clean and the bed linen all seemed new. The second time we stayed we had a room with a balcony which was a bit more expensive but seemed to have been one of the upgraded ones and was really nice. The situation of the hotel was perfect. Five minute walk to Darling Harbour and ten minutes to Circular Quay. For us it couldn't have been better. The Hotel also has a bar and the restaurant does evening meals which we also sampled and could recommend. The price is reasonable and you get good value for money. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. The hotel is in the central business district, so a bit quieter at night than other areas, but that has its benefits. Very easy to walk to Darling Harbour which is briliant for a meal/drinks in the evening - all restaurants around a harbourwhich is lovely when all lit up). Breakfast is a bit pricey, but other places fairly close by to walk to. Nice walk to Sydney Opera house - maybe 15 mins - in the morning you walk down the same roads as all those people going to work in their suits. The hotel is being upgraded at the moment, so if you get a poor quality room do make a fuss to get upgraded. Room was Â£60 a night, so good price for such a central location. There are a few travelodges with similiar sounding names so make sure you give your cab driver the address too. Internet access available for a fee in Reception and lots of pamphlets on the surrounding area available in hotel. Small hotel bar, but not much to write home about. Seemed to just be used for people waiting for cabs to airport. Easy to walk to shops, monorail station, Rocks and everything Sydney has to offer. Not the most luxurious hotel in Sydney, but remember it is a Travelodge, and you definitely won't be disappointed. Would highly recommend - for good quality, good priced accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location, Needs Renovation”
Reviews.Author: Happyfolk
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its excellent location for the price you pay. All the sites, shops and restaurants are only a couple of minutes walk away. The rooms are a bit shabby and the bathrooms the smallest I have ever seen and could do with a facelift. A letter was left on the bed stating that upgrading work was scheduled to start at the hotel shortly after we left, so these issues (not sure how the bathroom size could be addressed) may be resolved.

Reviews.Title: “The studio rooms here are great”
Reviews.Author: hywel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights as part of an extended holiday. The location is great very close to Darling Harbour, the Rocks and only a short walk to Wynyard station where you can get the rail and buses. It is in the CBD so at night and weekends the area is a bit lifeless, rather reminiscent of the city of London, but it is not far to get to somewhere where there is some nightlife The studio rooms are very large and are like a mini suite - it is well worth paying the extra. We had been travelling for two weeks by this point and it was good to have the option to just make and eat something simple rather than always having to go out to a restaurant. There is a supermarket in the station (you access it via the station entrance next to The Menzies Hotel, which is just opposite the Travelodge) The staff were very friendly and helpful. We didn't use the restaurant so can't really comment on that, but there is a Starbucks opposite if you need a caffeine fix! It has a laundry, but no dryer so if you do do washing then you will have to drape things around your room.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in March 06 for 5 nights. It was clean and comfortable. Excellent location for tourists. Well worth the money if you want a budget hotel to sleep and shower in.

Reviews.Title: “Well positioned and value for money.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well positioned and within a fifteen minute walk of both The Rocks area and Darling Harbour. Room good size and clean and breakfast very good. Mel & Karen.Stoke-on-Trent.UK

Reviews.Title: “In need of further renovation: but great location”
Reviews.Author: yugs
Reviews.Content: This hotel disappointed. We travelled as a family of 5. The 2 rooms allocated were shabby and the air condition was not working. Given the heat, this was not what was wanted. The hotel had a major air con problem that week. A helpful manager upgraded us to decent rooms after some serious negotiation: far superior, actually decorated this century with good beds, more room.....and working air con ! After that bad start, things improved. Good cleanliness. Excellent location. We stayed 5 nights. If we had been allocated the decent rooms initially, I would have had a far better view of the hotel, as it is only 3 star. There were clearly a number of rooms needing an overhaul however. Only tried breakfast once: good but overpriced. Better deals available on several nearby cafes (though some not open at weekends as this street is primarily a business street). Bar OK, but closed early. Very near the Wynyard station, making airport transfers easy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: SallyLJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights, as part of a 'world tour' and found it to be excellent. The taxi driver found it no problem at all, once we had told him the Road name. We arrived around 6pm and we were told upon check-in that we would receive a complimentary upgrade to a studio room, as the standard rooms had all been booked out! Our room was fantastic, and I would definately recommend paying the extra in the future for this room. One complaint however, is that the walls are very thin and that you can clearly hear what is happening next door!! The hotel is ideally situated, with Darling Harbour a 15 minute walk away and The Rocks area 10 minutes. It is also only a 2 minute walk from Wynyard station. All the staff in the hotel were more than helpful and the number of leaflets available in reception was fantastic (although it took me about an hour to read through them all). The maid was very understanding about our jet lag etc. and often went out of her way to ensure she still attended to our room, even if it was quite late! Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone planning to visit Sydney in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Shabby”
Reviews.Author: Kal1982
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the travelodge for a couple of days, flying back to England on New years day. We were very disappointed with the hotel. The 'superior' rooms are just higher up, meaning a longer ride in the lift. The staff weren't very helpful, especially in giving information about the city. Prices were extremely high for new years eve, which would be fine if you felt you were getting something for it. We checked out early on new years day and after spending the day on the beach we asked if there were any facilities for us to wash. We were told to use the toilets in the restaurant, which were filthy. Compared to the Radisson in Melbourne and even some of the YHAs in WA, this hotel is really poor.

Reviews.Title: “Central and clean”
Reviews.Author: aust2005
Reviews.Content: The Travelodge Wynyard is located right by Wynyard train and bus station. It is only a 5-10 minute walk to the harbour, a 10-15 minute walk to Darling Harbour and on a road parallel to the main shopping street in Sydney so is very central. Our room was very clean and adequate for a week in the city. Being a travelodge it's not luxurious but it's great value for money. There's so much to see in Sydney, you're not going to be spending much time in the hotel room! The area is very quiet at weekends but becomes very busy in the week as it's just down the road from the main business area of Sydney. Alot of the cafes around the hotel are only open in the week. We felt the breakfast was very overpriced so usually went for breakfast to one of the many food courts in Sydney or to a cafe in Darling Harbour. We didn't have dinner at the hotel either as there are plenty of restaurants in Sydney to choose from. Overall, I'd recommend the Travelodge if you want a value for money, clean central hotel in Sydney as a base for your holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but with Reservations”
Reviews.Author: Counterweight
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the other reviews of the Travelodge Wynyard. The location is outstanding, it's easy to walk to the Rocks (entertainment district), Circular Quay, the Harbor Bridge, the Opera House, Darling Harbor, etc. The room was small but modern and clean, and we got a good rate for a downtown hotel from the hotel rate search engine on the tripadvisor web site. The not so good that we experienced; Not everyone knows about this hotel, as it used to be a Corus hotel, so we had a couple problems initially with cab drivers finding it. The management and staff seemed overwhelmed and not so competent. We arrived around 10 in the evening, we were told the hotel was fully booked so they had to put us up in a sister hotel. We had a 3 night stay, so we had to move back to this hotel after spending the first night in another hotel (they were nice about arranging this and paying for the cabs back and forth, though). I also heard several other issues at the front desk as were coming and going, they seemed to be related to rooms not being ready. The staff blamed this on a new computer system, but who knows. The concierge/bell-man was not very impressive. He was very nice, but didn't have a lot of knowledge about the local attractions and restaurants. There were several groups staying when were there, so it was often difficult to get his attention or assistance as he was constantly checking and un-checking bags for people. All in all, if you can get a good rate I'd consider the Travelodge Wynyard, but if you're not a self-sufficient traveler I'd consider another option.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service, poor facilities”
Reviews.Author: Vet-traveler51
Reviews.Content: As the other reviews indicated, cental location is the best reason to stay. We were impressed with the service too, espcially the front desk and bell man. However, the rooms and other areas needed significant restoration, but the conversion to brand name may help. We were initially given a smokers room with a heavy odor, but when we insisted on on nonsmoking room the front desk accomidated us. Breakfast was overpriced, but many other options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain stay at a friendly, clean and central hotel”
Reviews.Author: LynnieP
Reviews.Content: Note: This hotel was previously Corus Hotel. From 30th June 2005 it became a Travelodge. ------ I booked a room very last minute (the night before) through a well known Aussie late deal website, and got a room for $99 (40 quid-ish) which is a v. good price for central Sydney on a Friday night. Although living in Sydney at the moment, my husband and I were heading to a gig near the Rocks which we knew would finish very late, so we thought we?d treat ourselves. I rang up the hotel after booking to ask a question on deposits and they were very helpful. (If you don?t want to leave a credit card number at reception on arrival, they ask for $100 cash which you get back on checkout) Anyway, I turned up after work Friday evening to check in, and there was some confusion as hubby had already checked in having snuck off work early (which I didn?t know about!). The girl at reception was extremely polite and friendly and didn?t seem to mind us being so daft. Apparently hubby had left his mobile at reception earlier, and they?d brought it up to straight away having rung to check it was him who?d left it there. We were given a large non-smoking room which overlooked the CBD. A bit traffic noisy but you can?t expect much else if you want a location in the city. As mentioned in previous reviews, the Travelodge (previously Corus up to the end of June 05) is just outside Wynyard station, and within 10 minutes walk of circular quay. It?s an excellent location for tourists. For non-hotel snacks, there?s a starbucks next door (and a krispy cr?me about a minute down York street if you want seriously sickly stuff) and the main shopping Streets (George and Pitt) run parallel. The central shopping area is about 5 minutes walk away. The room itself has obviously recently been overhauled. It?s a mixture of old (the bizarre wooden ?blinds? that you have to haul across the window, the peeling windowledge, and the old fridge) and the new ? all the fixtures and fittings (cupboards, desk, chairs, table, lamps, bedside tables, pictures) looked brand new. We had a double bed and a single bed in our room. The bed was very comfy with nice crisp sheets and there?s an extra pillow in the cupboard. The carpet was clean, although didn?t look brand new. You also get an ironing board and iron, and a safe. There are the usual coffee/tea making facilities. The fridge is useful, especially if you?re staying longer (there?s a small Coles supermarket in Wynyard station for supplies) The TV has foxtel, and there?s an internet connection if you need it. Overall I was very impressed with the room, certainly for the amount we paid. The bathroom was desperately shabby, although a letter on the desk explained they were in the process of renovating, so I expect they?ll get around to the bathrooms at some point. There was nothing at all wrong functionally and it was spotlessly clean, but the paint was peeling, the ceiling above the bath a bit mouldy, and the bath itself cracked. The shower head above the bath was bizarrely low, so that it touched my head (and I?m only 5,5) My husband had some trouble since he?s 6 ft tall. It was still perfectly adequate however, and the little touches made up for it. For instance there were loads of lovely fluffy white towels ? far more than we actually needed, and you?re given all the nick-nacks you?d expect and a couple more. I was particularly pleased that you got individual shampoo AND conditioner rather than that showergel/shampoo stuff. Plus body lotion, sewing kit, razor and gel, shoe shine, sanitary bag, shower cap, soap, box of tissues and extra loo rolls. The hairdryer was obviously old, but at least had some power in it, unlike some that sort of waft a soft breeze around your head. I can?t comment on room service or the restaurant facilities as we didn?t use them but I would hope its as efficient as reception were on check-in. I did note that they have a customer coin-op laundry which is great if you?re staying a few days since you don?t have to pay silly amounts to your smalls washed by the hotel staff. There?s a gym too apparently. They?re doing a ?winter warmer? dinner deal at the moment for $16 I think it was (I can?t tell you the details because we ate out ? sorry) The Travelodge is probably a 3.5 star hotel in my opinion ( I don?t know the actual rating because it varies depending on the site you visit). I am rating it highly because I found the staff to be extremely courteous, friendly and helpful, and I thought the standard of cleanliness very high. I've only knocked a mark off because the bathroom could have been better. I?ve stayed at 4 stars which are nowhere near as good, and at 3 stars which are way below this standard. I recommend it if you want a shopping trip followed by a night out in the Rocks (there are some lovely little outdoor restaurants) at a bargain price (the other hotels in this area are vastly more expensive) We were in 1301.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere if looking for nice hotel at a value price”
Reviews.Author: Darren7676
Reviews.Content: Hotel is full of coach tours, which unfortunately for them they won't know any better. Although we asked for a non-smoking room we were presented with a smoking room, stained and tainted by years of smoke. Bed was uncomfortable, and bathroom tiny. Service was terrible. Unfortunately obtained food poisoning during stay, thought to be from the hotel "resturaunt" which is suprising given their somewhat limited and overpriced menu. Other Sydney CBD venues such as The Somerset offer much better accomodation and comfier for much the same price. Shop around, and if you can, ask to see a room before you commit, or at least get a Sydney friend to check it out if you can. Comments on this website and photos WERE NOT representative.

Reviews.Title: “Superb for the money”
Reviews.Author: Darren_1138
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Sydney and we'd spent a long time looking for a deal online around the Darling Harbour area with the more common chain names, thinking this was the best place for evening meals and the casino entertainment. I'm so glad we eventually ended up at the Corus because it was a lot cheaper and I suspect the rooms were larger. This place is perfectly positioned for everything. All the main places were literally ten minutes walk away (Rocks, Darling etc). The room we had was facing York Road. There was some building work over the road, but I expect this has finished by now (we were there for four nights back in November 2004). There was a bit of street noise and the windows were single glazed, so If you're a light sleepr try to get a higher floor. Facing York Road meant a view of the tower, nicely lit by night. The room itself was basically furnished. We had a king bed and a sofa as well as a desk, coffee table, couple of chairs and the double wardrobe . We're used to quite small european rooms, and although this wasn't much bigger it was a nice change. It seemed like a suburban sized Holiday Inn (you know.. the one's that are just a little bigger). The bathroom was small, but served its purpose. You won't find anything spectacular in the regular rooms, but it was in spotless order. The staff were always courteous and polite. I couldn't fault them. We had what seems an amazing deal at Â£60 per night with an all you can eat buffet breakfast. There was a vast selection of hot/cold, sweet/savoury foods. Fill up for a long day's sight-seeing. On the whole, if you you want to be safe and comfortable this will do you fine. A bright decent room at a nice hotel just a few yards from the underground station linked to the airport. There's no doubt that when we return to this fabulous city we'll be booking in with the Corus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but need some renovations”
Reviews.Author: Ermejo
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is its excellent location. It is 10 minutes walking from the Rocks, the harbourfront and many other attractions in Sydney. Overall the hotel, outside and inside, has a kind of run down appearance. The room was OK but the bathroom was kind of obsolete, with very old and loose faucets and it did not look very clean.

HotelInfo.Name: Travelodge Wynyard Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 7 - 9 York St, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia (Formerly Corus Sydney)
